1.content:
Cheer Practice - Due to a prank by his friends, a teenage boy is signed up for the cheer-leading team and he is helped by cheerleaders, and becomes one.

Don't Go in the Closet- A young boy looks in his parent's closets and finds some things he'd never thought he'd see.

Witness Protection- A young man witnesses a dangerous crime, and is put in Witness Protection, but to protect him, he has to disguise himself as a woman.

Always a Bridesmaid- A young man attends a relative's wedding, and has to take the place of one of the bridesmaid.
1.title: It begins...

choices: They hadn't realized you were a boy
They knew you were a boy, they were expected a big strong guy
11.content:
During the first week of the school year Everyone has the option to sign up for a sport, which if they make it, the practices will replace your gym period.

You hadn't planned on joining any sports, since you were a bit on the small side for your age of 16, a Freshman in highschool, unbeknownst to you, a few of your friends had signed you up for cheerleading.

It wasn't until nearly two weeks later, that you got a note in your locker that said.

"Since Most of our cheerleaders graduated this year, and unexpectedly low signups for tryout, everyone that signed up for tryouts has been accepted."

You look it over, it must've been placed in the wrong locker... right? But it said your name on it.

At the bottom it said to report to the gym after school.

You decide to figure out what's going on, so you wait until the school day is over and head to the gym.
11.title: Cheer Practice

111.content:
You walk in a bit late, you were having trouble with your locker.

You introduce yourself to the head cheerleader, a girl named Katy, who was a Senior.

"Hi, I'm Adam, I got this saying I was accepted to cheerleading, but I didn't sign up..."

"Oh! hmm," she looks over the sign up list. "I hadn't even noticed, those were sent out automatically, I just assumed it was all girls, I mean, not that boys can't do it... But your name is on the sign up sheet, you're sure you didn't sign up?"

"Yeah, someone must've put my name on there as a prank or something."

Katy stay silent for a moment, thinking something over it seemed.

"that really sucks, because as the paper you got said, we're pretty short this year, a ton of the cheerleaders were Seniors, and they all graduated, there are 3 of us Juniors that are now Seniors, 2 Sophomore now Juniors, and 2 Freshman now Sophomore, and with the 3 new Freshmen, you included, we just him the minimum requirement... So without you, there won't be any cheerleading this year." She whispered the last part, not wanting the others to hear.

"Your serious? That sucks, but I'm not really athletic, and not really into cheerleading"

"Tell you what, give it a chance, and if you really don't like it I totally understand, and another thing, normally guy cheerleaders are lifters and throwers, strong guys to hold the smaller girls up, but I don't think that's something you're up to, so you'll be a flyer, or one of the girls- sorry one of the cheerleaders that gets thrown into the air.... Pleeeeeeeease."

You sigh...
111.title: They hadn't realized you were a boy

1111.content:
"Fine..." You reluctantly say. This girl was really pretty, and you didn't want to let her down.

"YAY" Katy yelled. "Now, there's two options...we can either dress you up every time we have a performance and practice, but that would be a lot of work. Or, we can get you one of those new body suit things. They're really cool, you put it on and it's like you're a new person! People wouldn't even have to wonder why there's a boy on the cheer leading team. We go to a boarding school, so we could move you into the girls block."
1111.title: "OK"

11111.content:
You mull it over, and honestly you feel that dressing up each time will be easier in the long run.

"Oh, well that's a bit more work, but nothing we can't handle." Katy said. "Practice starts tomorrow."

You walk away, unsure of what you got into
11111.title: Dress up every time

111111.content:
You go to practice tomorrow, and talk to Katy.

"I honestly expected you to quit after the first day" Said katy.

"What's the fun in that?" You say with a grin.


You and Katy keep talking until practice starts.

First, you change into your cheerleading outfit in no time flat, like you've done it all your.

This practice, you surprise even yourself with how athletic and flexible you've became.

"Wow, are you sure you signed up on accident." Katy joked

"Positive."
111111.title: Practice tomorrow

choices: "It would make more sense to wear the girl's uniform."
1111111.content:
Two weeks later, you get a call from the coach.
"Is this the Mann residence?"
"Yes, Robin Mann speaking"
"Robin, just who I wanted to see." the coach started
"We finally got the guy's uniform in for you, you don't have to wear the old one."
Internally, you are not as happy as you think you should be. While at first it was bothersome, you want to keep wearing the girl's uniform. On the other hand, wearing the guy's will make it less weird when you tell anyone about the cheer team.

"Listen Coach...
1111111.title: Skip to two weeks

11111111.content:
To people who don't know you, you look like a girl, so wearing the girl's uniform will be better in the long run. Also, you have started to enjoy wearing it.

"I'd prefer to keep wearing the old uniform, if you don't mind."

"Really?" This came as a shock to the coach.

"Yeah, it'll cause less trouble for me in the long run."

"Okay, have a good day."

"You too"

With that out of the way, you decide to call up your fellow cheerleaders and go to...
11111111.title: "It would make more sense to wear the girl&...

11112.content: you said ok and ask for some details...
11112.title: Body suit

choices: Felt some slight pain as i connected to your nerves
You felt nothing but Katy saw it adjust
111121.content:
Katy asked you to waot and left then came back about half an hour later and handed you something.

What is it? It's a bodysuit but since i couldn't find one in the locker room i knew the science geeks had one that they were doing experiments to make seem as realistic as possible from what they said you just put in on and it will just adjust to your body here you are.

You took it and lokk at Katy... i feels like skin... try it on Adam please.

You went into a changing cubicle stripped and put it on after struggling as it is so tight.... you walk out and sat down on a near by bench once it was on and Katy looked then you...
111121.title: details

1112.content:
You look at Katy apologize
"Look I'm sorry Katy but this really isn't my thing at all, I will spend all my time at the gym and bulk so I can help you next semester" You say
"We need you now Adam, we need to practice now and without enough people we don't get the gym or the equipment, or the funding, so next semester we'll really suck" Katy begs
1112.title: "I'm Sorry

choices: You can date any of the cheerleaders
They will invite you to all of the parties
11123.title: Everybody's got a price

111231.content: "If you stay with the team you can date any of us cheerleaders without boyfriends, and to sweeten the deal, I'll pay."
111231.title: You can date any of the cheerleaders

1113.content:
"I guess I could try it" You reluctantly say. You felt guilty, being the tenth sign up, and getting their hopes up, even if you weren't the one that signed yourself up.

"YAY" Katy yelled. We've already handed out uniforms before you got here, let me find a boys uniform for you..."

She digs through a box, lifts up one, "No that's a large..." she mutters, then grabs another, "A medium!" She holds it against you, "Hmmm, still too big, there's bound to a small in here somewhere, she digs for another minute.

After searching for a minute she sighs. "Another Snafu, there aren't any male uniforms that would fit you, and we can't practice without everyone in uniform, school rules. We could... maybe... if you didn't mind."

"What?" You ask, not knowing where she's going with that.

"Wearagirl'suniformjustfortoday" she said really fast.

"What I missed that?"

"Since your already being such a good sport, maybe... if you didn't mind you could wear one of the girl's smalls, we'll order a small Boy's uniform, so it would just be for today promise, and really they're not that different, the tops are almost identical, and the skirts have an inner lining you step into, so people cant see up the skirt when it flips up.

You really want to say no, and just quit this whole thing, but you hate disappointing people, especially a cute girl who is relying on you right now, giving you doe eyes.

"I guess... but just for today."

"Of course Just today, we'll have a real uniform for you next time, if you decide to stay. Here go change into this, don't be embarrassed we're all wearing the same thing."
1113.title: Something else

11131.content:
You quickly head into the guys changing room, nobody else is using it since its after school.

You quickly strip to your boxers and get a look at what you just agreed to wear. a simple top, red with a white sash-like stripe diagnolly across it with the school letters on it, a pleated red and white skirt, and what looked like red panties, but were later informed were spankies

You first tried to wear the skirt with your boxers, but they got all bunched up and it clearly would't work, so you went with the red panty things, then the skirt, then the top, luckily you were wearing tennis shoes.

You tentatively took a few steps out back into the gym. Katy meets you half Way.

"Not bad, lets introduce you to the rest of the team." She turns to the rest of the girls, chatting amongst themselves "Guys, this is Adam, He along with Amelia" she points to a petite blond girl "are our flyers." Katy proceeds to tell you the rest of the team's names but you don't remember most, you've never been good with names. "He's only wearing this uniform for today, there aren't any small guy's uniforms, for obvious reasons. since usually guys are lifters and throwers, Adam's being a good sport and gonna be one of the girls today.

You say hi to all the girls, and meet Amelia especially since you and her will be performing the same stunts you'll be working and practicing together most of the time.
11131.title: You put it on

111311.content:
Your first practice as a cheerleader goes excellently. From warm ups to basic stunt practices you excel surprising yourself and everyone else on the team. When being instructed by Katy about stunt procedure and etiquette, you only need to be told once. You learn to keep your head up at all times and distribute your weight evenly. Your small size compared to the other girls makes it easier for them and for you too balance. Even with the chants you are a natural not slipping up or getting tongue tied at all, much to the amazement of some of the veteran girls. You find yourself enjoying the training more and more, relishing the challenge of a new new stunt. Being lifted and cradled by the girls is pretty emasculating however and is something you struggle getting used to. You soon forget about the uniform though and don't become too worried when your skirt flips on some of the stunts, its just something you have to wear.


At the end of the practice, Katy is so confident with your abilities that she lets you attempt a basic toss. Two girls come either side of you and launch you into the air, you pirouette spreading your weight between the two catchers and land delicately in their arms. When put down you are panting from the adrenaline and sheer enjoyment but all good things have to come to an end and training finishes.

Katy approaches you at the end. "Wow, all I can say is wow. I have never seen anyone pick up cheerleading as fast as you did. There's no doubt about it, we need you on the team Adam and we need you now."

Having never been good at any sort of sport you are overwhelmed by this. "Thanks Katy that really means a lot. Yeah I would really love to be on the team but umm..." you trail off.

"What? What is it?" Katy says looking panicked by your hesitation.

"Its just that I'll be a boy doing cheerleading. I really want be on the team but I can see a lot of bullying in my future if I do." you say.

Katy brightens at this. "You don't need to worry about that, during practice I came up with an idea that would solve both our problems. Its pretty odd to have a guy as a flyer, even one as small as you so Amelia and I thought it would be better if you joined the team as a girl."

You are taken aback by this. "How would I do that."

"Simple, we help you dress and act like a girl. We talk to the principle to clear it and sort out classes and I know she will, give you a makeover and lessons to be a girl and then you you would come to school as a girl and no one would be the wiser. No bullying, you get to do cheerleading and I get an all star flyer for football games and competitions, everyone one wins. What do you think?" She says grinning.

You are flattered by being called an all star but you can't help picking holes in her plan. "But what about my friends and what would my mom say?"

"Friends? You mean the guys that signed you up for cheerleading in the first place and anyway aren't they the weirdos who hang around the bike shed after class, you could do better Adam." She has you there, you never have been good at making friends, always falling in with losers and two-faced dicks. "And as for your mom, Im sure she would understand, maybe she would encourage you to help out a sports group in need."

"But how would I pass for a girl?" you say now scrapping the bottom of your excuse barrel.

Katy smirks at this. "Um Adam, don't take this the wrong way but I don't think it would be hard at all for you to pass as a girl. Your face is androgynous if not feminine and your small frame is just right for a girl. All you need is a bit of makeover and I think you would be a lot prettier than most of the girls in the school."

"You really think I could do it?"

"I wouldn't ask you if you couldn't. So what do you say?"

Your head is spinning with the offer of being made to look like a girl and given a new identity. Of course you are resisting the idea, your a guy, you like girls but on the other hand, you have never loved anything as much as cheerleading, the guys you hang around with are all douches and having a new identity could be a fresh start, a clean break.
111311.title: First Practice

1113112.content:
You take a deep breathe. "I'm really sorry Katy but I can't. I agree with all your saying, I really do like cheerleading and I want to help out but having to act and dress like a girl everyday to do it. I just couldn't, I'm really very sorry."

Katy visibly slumps at this, you can see the disappointment in her eyes. "Oh okay, I understand. Its your choice after all, I guess we won't have a cheer squad this year after all. No hard feelings." She turns and trudges off to the changing rooms. "Oh and you can keep the uniform, we won't need it and besides you look cute in it." She says over her shoulder.

You feel terrible, the worst you have felt in your life. Not only are you denying yourself something you really enjoy but also denying it others. You too head for the boy's changing room and change, almost reluctantly back into your normal clothes. You put the uniform in your bag as a keepsake and head home.

"Mom, I'm home" you yell as you enter your house. You fling your bag next to the door and take off your shoes, glad you can relax after the strenuous training.

"Great timing Adam, dinners on the table." you here your mom's voice come from the kitchen. You walk on though to the dinning room and see your two sisters already at the table.

Your older sister Erin greets you with her traditional "Sup dork."

While your year younger sister Lilly opts for a more pleasant "Hey Adam."

You take your seat next to Lilly without saying anything and wait for your mom. Its not long before she joins you and you all dig into your food. Talk over dinner is mostly about Lilly's upcoming hockey game and also features another one of Erin's classic feminist rants. Just one year of doing sociology and gender studies and she thinks she knows it all. You don't contribute much, only offering the occasional "uh huh" or "okay" as your mind is still on the cheer team. The guilt you feel is almost unbearable but thinking of living in girl's clothes helps it dissipate a little. At the end of dinner you offer to clear the table and help with the washing, perhaps to alleviate some of the guilt. Lilly washes while you wipe and Erin just lounges at the kitchen table on her phone. Just as you are drying a plate the phone rings and your mom answers.

"Hello, well hi principle Granger, how can I help you?" your ears prick up at this and so do Lilly's and Erin's. All production in washing up comes to a standstill. "I see, well that's just terrible, the cheerleaders at the sports games always livened things up." your mom continues.

Lilly gets back to washing. "Granger probably wants donations." she says relived.

You don't budge, still holding a plate in your hand, ears straining to hear more of the conversation. And then came the words every child dreads to hear their parent say. "Oh he did, did he?" you mom says. Erin and Lilly gaze at you grinning.

"Busted dweeb." Erin says triumphantly.

You grimace wondering what you did wrong and how could the cheer squad be involved.

"Okay, okay, its a little unorthodox but I can see the merits to it and I think it will be the best for him if what your saying about the people he hangs out with is true and if it helps the teams in the process, I see no reason why not. You have my full support principle Granger." A pause ensues and Erin and Lilly are both falling about with laughter silently. You remain still, filled with dread, hoping against hope what is happening is not what you think is happening.
"What's that?" your mom continues. "Ms. Wilkes thinks it would be good for Erin too? That's great, I'm sure Erin will be delighted you said that and that offer is very generous." Erin stops laughing and looks confused now. Ms. Wilkes is Erin's sociology and gender studies teacher. "Okay okay, let her know we will start immediately and she can come and help tomorrow. Aren't we lucky we have the weekend eh?" your mom laughs. "Okay bye principle Granger and thank you." The phone goes down.

Immediately all you Erin and Lilly get back to work looking busy as possible. Your mom walks in with an odd expression on her face, something that can only be described as a mixture of pride and mild disappointment. "That was your principle on the phone as I'm sure you all know. She had some interesting things to tell me and put forward a few dramatic changes that I whole wholeheartedly support." She pauses to collect her thoughts. "She tells me that you tried out for the cheer squad today Adam." Lilly stifles an amused snort and your mom scowls at her and all signs of her mirth disappear. "She tells me that you refused to join the team despite knowing that it was short on numbers which is shameful even if you were signed up as a joke." She says scoldingly and you look down at the floor. "However" her tone changes to pride, "she also told me that from watching you from her office window, that you were one of, if not the best cheerleader she has ever seen and being that good without prior practice is incredible. Apparently she was amazed that you were a boy. This is why you turning it down was so inconceivable."

You find your voice now. "But mom they wanted me to go to school as a girl." Erin, stiffens at this.

"I know. Principle Granger told me about Katy's plan and approves of it. Apparently your new so-called friends are not the A-students that you would have me believe them to be. I'm told they're slackers, troublemakers and smokers." Your mom's becomes menacing "If I find out that you so much as touched a cigarette young man you'll be in more trouble than you ever thought possible."

"I've never smoked" you say panicked.

"But its a just a matter of time before you do hanging around with those scruffs which is why I think Katy's idea is best for you." Your jaw drops. "It lets you have a new start away from bad influences which will help your school work, it will let the girls on the cheer squad have a team and from what I'm told you rather enjoy cheerleading too." Lilly looks like she is about to laugh again but manages to hold firm. "So from this day on, your going to live as though you are my middle daughter, not just at school and in cheerleading but full time."

"What!? How can you do this?" you exclaim, not believing what you just heard.

"Quite easily after being told all the advantages, this will be best for you."

"But but" you stutter but your mom ignores you.

Erin speaks up now. "I agree completely with your decision mom its just what he needs." you glare at her "but where do I come into this? I heard you mention me on the phone."

"Ah I almost forgot the other benefit of this arrangement. Ms. Wilkes has expressed that she is extremely pleased with your progress and called you a perfect example of a modern, assertive and independent young woman..." Erin smiles proudly at this. "and she tells me that Adam's change would be help her research in understanding reversing gender roles in society and hopes that you would like to document some results and also help guide his transformation in return for a recommendation for a scholarship to any Ivy league university of your choice, apparently she has some pull with the acceptance offices."

Erin almost leaps out of her seat. "Yes I'll do it" she shouts happily.

"Good well its settled then. Adam, for the rest of your time at high school, you will go as a girl. Every aspect of your life will now be that of a girl's and I think we better start as we mean to go on by making you look more presentable for our shopping trip tomorrow."

"Shopping trip? Why?" is all you can muster. You are in shock, you must be dreading, something like this can't be real.

"Well we can't have you wearing any of your sister's clothes for the next couple of years, it wouldn't be fair to them, besides both their clothes would be too big for you." She's right there. Erin is quite tall at 5 ft 10 and Lilly is 5ft 8 but built much bigger than you from hockey practice and exercise. "So Lilly, would you mind finishing the dishes dear while your sister and I make your new sister look more appropriate?"
1113112.title: No escape

11131121.content:
You try one last ditch attempt to get out of it. "I won't do it" you say. "You can't force me to go to school as a girl!"

"Well you're right honey" Mom replies. "We can't force you to do anything. But you can be that boy that's in the cheer leading squad, wears a girls uniform, and performs the girls parts in the cheer leading routines. You're going to be in the cheer squad and that's final. I think being a girl would be less humiliating for you as long as nobody finds out. Would you agree?"

You had to agree she was right. As long as nobody found out, you were much better off this way. "Fine, whatever" You muttered.

"Now Erin", Mom said, "I'll let you get started with him, excuse me, her, while I go do some work around the house. I'll check in with you later. Now Adam, unless you want everyone finding out about our little secret, you will listen to everything Erin says. Erin, I give you full authority over him."

"Awesome!" Erin said excitedly. "C'mon little sis, let's get started!" You cringed at her calling you that. She led you up to her bedroom, and shut the door behind her. "First, strip".

"No way!" You refused. "I am not taking off my clothes in front of you!"

"Well I guess I could just tell Mom someone wasn't cooperating..." You reluctantly pulled off your clothes, embarrassed. "Now, head to the bathroom, take a shower, and use this cream, but don't use any on your face. Only use it on your arms and legs. You did as instructed, the cream burned your skin, and you saw all your hair wash away in the shower! You came out body hairless, with a towel wrapped around your waist. You headed back outside to where Erin was waiting. "Wonderful! No more pesky hair to ruin the look. Now, lose the towel." Reluctantly, you dropped the towel, exposing yourself completely.

You noticed Erin has some clothes picked out for you already. "These are compression panties" She explained as she slid them on you. "They'll help you hide your member". She tucked it inside, and surprisingly, your butt area looked feminine. Next came a bra. She applied makeup to your face, and since your hair was already long for a guy, she straightened it out. Looking in the mirror, you could almost fool yourself into thinking you were a girl. Next came the clothes. There were two outfits. One was a skirt and blouse, the other was a casual summer dress. She let you pick one, you picked
11131121.title: The makeover

111311212.content:
You picked the dress, it seemed simpler, and it might be nice to have so much freedom of movement. Erin helped you zip it up from the back, after stuffing your bra with toilet paper. "Why can't I just wear pants?" You asked her.

"Skirts and dresses are more free flowing" she said, "meaning it'll hide any, well, irregularities, in your underwear from showing. From now on, only skirts and dresses outside of the house. Also, you're a cheerleader, dress like one!"

"Great" You muttered. She brought out a pair of summery wedge heels to complete the outfit. "Woah, heels? I don't know about this."

"Well you have to get used to them eventually. Also, this is all I have really, so you gotta wear them!" You slip them on and look in the mirror. Surprisingly, you do look like a real girl. You wouldn't even question it if you didn't know. Erin took you downstairs where Mom and Lilly were waiting for you.

"Presenting the new and improved Adam! Or should I say, Addison!" Erin announced.

"Oh my gosh, you look adorable!" Mom swooned. "That'll look great for the shopping trip tomorrow". What next?
111311212.title: Dress

11131122.content:
Thinking back to your conversation earlier, you've figured a way out.

"I said no to this earlier, but can I just join the cheer team as a guy, and not go through all these extra steps? I'll even ask the principal about it." You say, pleading

Your mother thinks about it. "If you're really serious, then yes, you can."

You cheer internally, while your sister looks disappointed. You go call up Katy to tell her the change of plans.

"But what about the bullying?" Asks Katy.

"I'll handle it, see you at practice Wednesday.
11131122.title: Escape???

choices: Talk your way out of this
111311222.content:
Surprisingly, you don't get a lot of flak for joining the cheer team. Most guys are jealous they didn't think of it first, and most girls call you brave. Apparently, befriending the popular girls isn't a bad idea.

You're walking to lunch when you hear a guy yell, "Watch out sissy." You turn and see John Meadows, Captain of the football team, and Katy's ex-girlfriend. "You're the one who's been making eyes at my girl, and I don't take kindly to that.

He makes a fist, and you...
111311222.title: Bullies

1113112221.content:
You know you'd get creamed so you use your way with words that got you into this in the first place.

"C'mon, Jonathan, I'm no threat to you. Katy's all yours, I'm just her friend." You hope it'll soothe his worries

He takes a while to mull it over, he takes a swing, but leaves before he actually hits you.

You meet up with Katy in the hallway. "What was that about?"

"Oh, John" she says halfheartedly. "He's mad that I dumped him so he scares every guy I meet."

"Weird"

"So, are you ready for today's practice?"
1113112221.title: Talk your way out of this

111312.content:
"If it makes you feel any better, you look pretty decent in the outfit." Amelia giggles.

"Thanks... I think. Though the faster they get a small boy's uniform, the happier I'll be." you said.

"Okay." Katy said. "Today we're going to start with getting to know the basics, since we have a lot of newbies here. Bases, find a flier and I just want you to lift them up and see what you're working with. Fliers, put your arms into a t-shape when they lift you."

It was an admittedly awkward practice, as the base, you can't remember her name, lifted you up and down repeatedly. It took a while to get the posture down, but you think you figured it out by the end.

Once that exercise was done...
111312.title: Something else

choices: "I didn't mean to sign up" (They believe you)
"I didn't mean to sign up" (They think you're lying)
"I can do it, just let me try"
112.content:
"Did you hear we got a guy for the team this year?"

"Yeah, we'll finally be able to do some of the more difficult tricks. He could get us to the next level as a team."

"This is going to be a great season... who's that walking in."

The taller of the two girls notices you, then her redheaded friend asks, "Are you lost, this is cheerleading practice."

"Uhh... I got signed up for the team."

"Fuck," the taller girl sighs, "You won't be able to hold any of us up will you... why did you even join?"
112.title: They knew you were a boy, they were expected a ...

113.content:
You weren't quite sure how to handle such a problem. You could just ignore the note, but what if something bad happened as a result? Perhaps it would be worth your time to at least check this out, despite how absurd being a cheerleader sounded to you. No guys in your school did it, so why you? Anyway, school was over soon enough, meaning that you had to choose. You walked to and from school, so you weren't in any rush at all. With a sigh, you ended up walking towards the gym, deciding to see what it was about.

As you entered, you sound found who the head cheerleader was. Her name was Katie, a Senior at the school.

"Um, hi." you said hesitantly. She gave you a soft smile.

"Hello, can I help you?" she asked. At that, you brought out the note.

"Well, my name is Adam. I found this note in my locker, but I'm pretty sure I didn't sign up or anything." you said, holding the note out. Katie looked perplexed.

"Let me see that," she said as she took the note, reading it over and nodding. "I didn't really notice that. Your name is here on the list and all. Guess I just thought that you were a girl since you were on here."

"Well, I'm not, so I can't really join, right?" you asked. Katie gave you a rather sad look.

"Unfortunately, if you don't, then we're in trouble." she said. "Most girls on the squad last year were Seniors, so they've all graduated. Including me, we now have 3 Seniors, 2 Juniors, 2 Sophomore, and 3 Freshman, including you. We need 10 minimum or the group would be discontinued."

"Ouch, that's harsh." you said, sad to hear that such a thing was happening.

"So, I know it's asking a lot...but could you consider?" she asked. "I've met the other girls and I'm sure that you would be welcomed in. Obviously, we'd have to work on some things, but I think it would work out. Please?"

This was a tough spot for you. Be a cheerleader with the other girls? That hardly sounded reasonable. Still, you didn't want to see them be unable to compete at all.

"I'm not really athletic you know." you said.

"That can be worked out. We have a spot for everyone." smiled Katie.

You had to decide now.
113.title: Walking in

1131.content:
"All right, I guess I can try it." you sighed, which then made Katie smile.

"Yay! Thank you!" she said with excitement. "Now, I don't think we have any guy uniforms, although I know that we have plenty of girl uniforms. We might have to order a new male uniform if you want it."

"I guess so." you said. There didn't seem to be many other options.

Right after you said that, Katie reached down to a box and ran through it, looking through the sizes, and occasionally looking at you. She dug around some more, before finally grabbing some items.

"These should fit you well." she said as she handed them to you.

The tops were simple, red with a sash-like design along the front with the school letters. The skirt was red and white and pleated. There was also a little pair of what you thought were panties, although Katie eventually said that they were spankies. The skirt had an inner lining, so no underwear would be seen. A simple pair of tennis shoes were also included.

"Well, we're going to have to start soon. Could you go change and meet us out on the field?" asked Katie.

"Okay." you said, not seeing any other choice.
1131.title: Join them

choices: You meekly apologise, and explain 'you' didn't put your name on the list.
You assure her, that you'll try your best.
She stops you, "We don't have any outfits for ... your physique." she warns.
114.content:
The rhythmic swishing behind you causes you to whirl around. Your bag clangs loudly against the open locker door.

"Mighty jumpy... aren't ya." The janitor observes a smile playing across his face.

"You just startled me, is all." Although, you find yourself reluctant to turn your back on him to properly close the locker.

Jamming the note in your pocket, your fingers tremble as you try to zip your bag closed. But determined to prove the janitor wrong, you close the locker, secure the padlock in place.

The janitor is resting with his hands atop the handle of the broom.

"Only kidding, didn't mean nothing by it."

The idea of putting your name down for cheerleading wasn't your idea. But a few 'friends' had written your name on the list. The same friends that ensured your life was a living hell in any of the other sports teams you tried out for. But options were getting harder and you needed to pick a sport element.

Your first thought had been to scrunch up the mocking note. To dismiss this petty bullshit, and find some other activity. As you walk away, you realise you could use this to your advantage. All the rest of the team applicants were female, so you'd be in a prime position.

None of your friends were going to be mocking the other cheerleaders, as they still wanted to date them, themselves.

As you headed to the gym, you felt your doubts growing. Would this just turn the other half of the school against you. Would the girls think you were mocking them. Would they want an outsider in their ranks. As you got nearer, you realise you could use this to explain it was a mistake. That it wasn't you who applied, surely they wouldn't make you do a try-out for the squad, against your will.

The walk across the courtyard was the hardest, groups of giggling girls were heading in the same direction, and no other boys. Your destination was clear to anyone with eyes.

Ahead of all of you, the new gym loomed high. The building looked out of place, because it was. The fire that had destroyed the previous one, was a school disaster, almost causing the school to be closed. The death of the students painfully recent. In fact, it was the cheerleaders who perished there.

The numbers had never been as high since the fire. And, of course, the stories of ghosts and strange unexplained occurrences, were being fed by students eager for scares and excitement. Students eager to cuddle up to, and comfort jittery girlfriends.

Girls brush past you, as you slow to a stop. Sniggers quickly hidden behind slender hands, and furtive glances seem to be their secret form of communication. Although the message was quite clear to you.

Perhaps attracted by the noise, Miss Hardbroom appears in the doorframe. She scowls at your briefly before comprehension dawns, and with a quick glance to her sheet of names, she spares you a curt nod of the head. At least it ended the giggles and sniggers.

She's a rather imposing figure. Her tight sports clothes leave nothing to the imagination, showing off her svelte figure rather well. You try desperately not to ogle her well presented bust. The girls held high and firm, despite their size, a testament to the virtue of exercise.

Cautiously you approach her, the fear of getting an erection means your blood courses loudly in your ears, as you try to focus on anything else, on everything else, than all the nearby female flesh. All preparing to change clothes and get sweaty and competitive.
114.title: Something else

choices: You hear a faint spectral voice chuckling in amusement.
Steadying your nerves, you emerge to join the other cheer candidates.
Curious, your fingers caress the mirror surface where you saw her.
1143.content:
"Although now I see you, I have to confess, it looks to be less of a concern than I thought."

Reaching behind the door, she turns back to you with a neatly folded bundle of clothes. She thrusts an cheerleader's outfit into your hands.

"You can change in my office." She points to a door, just in front of the changing rooms.

You want to ask her quite what she meant, but standing their with the neatly folded. Obediently, you trek into the office. Unfolding the bundle you see a simple pair of cotton panties have been placed in with the rest of the costume.

Holding it up in front of your body, it looks slightly too small. You pull at it, and find it quite resilient but also flexible. Perhaps it will fit after all.

While you are uncertain about needing the panties, you think it might be a test of some kind. They slide smoothly up your legs, and you step into the rest of the costume. Thankfully there isn't a bra to go with it. Running your fingers over the material, you find that it comes with some built in support.

You have to really pull hard to get your arms inside the sleeves, and slip it onto your shoulders. The stitching, pattern, and the built in support all combine to make it look, as if you have your own very modest bust.

You pick at it, trying to stop it pinching, and smooth out any wrinkles. Looking in the mirror, it's a convincing reflection you see. Your raven hair, looking just a little to short. Not sure why, you pout at your reflection, pose and primp.

From the corner of your eye, you spot a beautiful, blonde haired, emerald eyed beauty smile in amusement.

Instantly you whirl around to face her, excuses and jokes battle to be spoken. But, you find only your reflection, and your own reflection staring back, fear and embarrassment battling on your face. Quickly you snap your head left and right, but there's nobody else there, and nowhere else that look could have come from.
1143.title: She stops you, "We don't have any outfi...

choices: Miss Hardbroom starts to eliminate girls.
Miss Hardbroom gestures for you to come nearer the front.
Oh God, Oh God, Oh God... it's starting. You feel your blood pulsing, pounding.
11431.content:
Unable to put it off any longer, you steel your nerves and head out to join the other candidates for the cheer squad.

As you reach the door, a rolling, chuckling laugh sounds, it sounds as it's at your shoulder, but also quite far away too. You whirl around, to catch the joker, but the small office is empty apart from yourself.

A shudder runs down your spine, as you convince yourself, it's just girls giggling coming through the vents. You cast around, but can't see any ventilation grills.

"Nah..." you mutter as you grab the chilly door handle, the ghost stories were just stories ... right.

You fit in with the rest of the try-outs, milling around the changing room, the voice and vision just an unsettling memory. There's a buzz in the air, an excitement, the girls are eager to get on the squad.

A whistle blast silences the chattering, as everyone looks over to the impressive figure of the teacher standing in the doorway.

"We're looking for ten girls to form the squad, and I'll have the final decision." She lets the whistle fall down. You just wish you hadn't felt your eyes drawn to the cushioned bounces before the cord settled it in her cleavage.

"Now, into the hall and give yourself plenty of space facing the mirror."

You follow, as the girls pour out of the changing room. You try not to think about getting an erection. But even that thought make the little fellow pulse in his confinement as if sensing a challenge.

You pass Miss Hardbroom, as you do, "No favourites, no special treatment." Her voice was husky, low and clearly aimed at you.

You just wished she knew the effect her sultry voice had on you... or rather you didn't.

There's room towards the back of the gym, and you find a place with enough room for you to circle your arms.

A sense of pride suddenly swells, and you are determined to give this your best shot. You certainly don't want to be the first eliminated.

In front of you the entire wall is mirrored, with a beam at waist height for ballet practices, everyone can see what everyone is doing. You try not to focus on the scrumptious arses, as the girls flex and stretch in preparation.

Dear God, please don't....

You pray sincerely to focus on the routine. When Miss Hardbroom does her stretches you're afraid to look away and miss the start of the try-out. Her body ripples as she stretches, she must be in her mid-twenties, and still has a gorgeous body. You keep noticing the shimmying, and teasing from her chest as her sports bra smothers it's movement.

You swallow loudly, oddly certain that everybody must have heard that. You need to forget about her sports bra, and those breasts held in that lycra embrace, each intimate detail of her perfect nipples held and revealed.

Shit...., she's started.

You start copying her moves, the kicks, the waves of the arms, the balancing. There's even a smile on your reflected face. You're enjoying this, really just enjoying it. Better even than that you see that you're not the worst. Already you can see other girls -damn it- just others, who are flailing like landed fish. Who can't tell their left from their right, and look like they can barely balance with both feet on the ground.

A smirk forms, as you see some of the girls are unprepared. Their own titties flying wildly despite their best efforts, their cheeks turning deeper and deeper red as their embarrassment builds.

Weirdly, you feel satisfaction as they fail, concentrating on imitating her gestures is working. And you're not thinking on ...

Concentrate on the work! You berate yourself.
11431.title: You hear a faint spectral voice chuckling in am...

choices: You ask to be a male cheerleader.
115.content:
Your name was Cire Masters, a shy but kind thirteen year old boy. You were always short and slender for your age with gentle blue eyes and longish dust blond hair. You were often mistaken for a girl, you had become used to it. You were athletic but not enough to join the football team as you hoped. It crushed you to hear the coach say you looked too feminine to be a football player. When you received the note to report to cheerleading practice, you feared it was just an attempt to add insult to injury.

"Might as well get this joke done and over with..." Sulking, you muttered.

Upon entering the gym, you were greeted by the cheer coach, Ms Sarah Stone who grinned upon seeing you approach. "Ah, Miss Cire." giggling, she said. "You are right on time."

"Ha Ha." Humorlessly, you said. "Have your laugh on the feminine boy."

Sarah sighed. "I heard about what the football coach said to you." Turning serious, she said. "My girls and I all agree that it was not right or fair that he treated you like that."

"Why did you want to see me?" Curious, you asked. "Do the girls need help with coming up with a new cheer?"

Sarah smiled. You had been helping the cheerleading squad come up with the most spectacular cheers which have won them championships throughout the state since you were only seven. The squad had often regarded you as one of them even though were were a boy.

"Something like that." Bemused, Sarah said. "The girls and I had a long talk and we have come up with a plan that will put you onto the footfall field."

"You want to make me a male cheerleader?" Wincing, you asked.

"Not quite." Grinning, Sarah said.

You turned hearing a number of girls giggling to find you were surrounded by the entire cheerleading squad from the Frenchmen to the Seniors. All of them were wearing their cheerleading uniforms. Among them was your twin sister, Emily.

"W-What's going on, sis?" Nervous, you demanded.

Emily smiled kindly. "You have always really been one of us, Cire." Calmly, she said. "You have done so much for us and now we want to do something for you."

"By making me dress up as a girl and a cheerleader?" Worried, you asked. "You know that if I am placed on the roster, I will have to dress up as a girl all the time."

"Everyone sees you as a girl anyway." Firmly but kindly, Sarah said. "That and I know you are safe around my girls due to that malpractice incident when you were ten."

You blushed terribly, turning to Emily. "You told them?!" Tearfully, you demanded.

"They figured it out on their own." Defensive, Emily said. "Being neuter does not make you any less of a person." She then smiled. "Besides, you are too cute to be a boy."

You blushed further at that. It was supposed to be a hernia operation only the surgeon got your papers mixed up with another patient with the same first and last name. As a result, you received a partial sex reassignment surgery as the nurses discovered the mistake half way through the procedure. The lawsuit that followed gave your family a fine settlement but it still left you looking more like a girl than a boy.

"What the coach did was wrong, Cire." Firmly, Sarah said. "Let us turn a curse into a blessing by putting you on the squad."

You looked around, hoping to find some avenue of escape but the girls all had you surrounded as Emily held up the cheer uniform in your size in one hand and a pair of white panties with a matching padded bra in the other...
115.title: Too cute to be a boy.

choices: the girl's school uniform and mary janes.
skinny jeans and a crop top shirt.
1151.content:
"I guess I have nothing left to lose." Sighing, you said. "Okay..."

Sarah smiled as she and a number of the cheerleaders, including Emily escorted you into the girl's locker room. There, Sarah instructed you to remove your clothes and step into the shower. Seeing you blush, she giggled, "We're all girls here, Cire. There is nothing you have any of us have not seen in the mirror thousands of times."

Reluctantly, you stripped down to the skin and stepped into the locker room showers where you found feminine shampoo and body wash waiting for you. With a sigh, you showered yourself and toweled dry. Since the incident, mom had insisted upon you using such products so it was really nothing new. Still, you were surprised by how soft your skin and hair had become from using what they left you once. Having not yet hit puberty, even at your age, you had no hair anywhere other than on the top of your head which made you look more girlish. Upon stepping out, still blushing, Emily gave you the panties which were easy enough to put on then you were instructed in how to put on the padded bra.

"The padding is made of silicon, the same material used for breast enhancements so they will feel real." Serious, Emily explained. "We have ordered breast forms for you but they have not come in yet."

This startled you but your need to get dressed was more pressing to your mind at the moment and you quickly put on the cheerleading blouse and skirt which had sewn in bloomers top hide your panties. It was all a perfect fit and, turning to a mirror in the room, you looked just like one of the girls getting ready for practice. Emily handed you a pair of pink ankle socks and girls sneakers in your size which you put on and sat down on one of the benches next to the mirror.

"So far so good." Smiling, Sarah said. "Now to complete the look."

You did not like the sound of that and cringed as Emily approached with her large makeup kit in hand. "Just relax, Cire." Calmly, she said. "The idea of makeup is to look as if you are not wearing any at all."

"Um... I don't get it..." Wincing, you said.

Sarah smiled as the other cheerleaders giggled. "You will."

With that, the makeover started with Emily giving you a foundation brush loaded with a powder that matched your skin tone. "Soft circles or it won't look even."

"Wait, you're making me do it?" Surprised, you demanded.

"You have to know how to do this yourself as you will need to do this every morning." Serious, Emily said. "Trust me, you'll look great."

Uncertain, you began to apply the foundation to your face, using the mirror to guide you as Emily and Sarah coached you through it. Next came some blush, mascara, lip liner, lipstick and lip gloss as well as eyeliner and a shot of perfume. Emily then began to work on your hair, brushing it out until it shined the added two butterfly clips to keep it out of your eyes. When she finally announced that your makeover was done and you looked into the mirror in shock. What greeted you was not a feminine looking boy but a blue eyed, dust blond teenage girl in a cheerleading uniform.

"Is- Is that really me?" Almost whispering, you asked.

"That is really you, Cire." Kindly, Sarah said. "You make a beautiful girl." She placed a light hand onto your shoulder. "Welcome to the squad, Miss Masters.."

You blushed as the cheerleaders cheered and escorted you out onto the field where the other cheerleaders cheered as well. You were given a number of compliments and hugs, making you blush further before Emily motioned to the field. "The football team is beginning their practice." Smiling, she said. "Let's introduce them to our newest member."

You winced at that, not seeing Sarah shaking her head. "No, I want to save that for their first home game next week." Serious, she said. "Cire may know cheerleading in and out but she has no idea how to act like a young lady out of uniform."

The cheer captain, Rachel Stone, a near mirror image of coach Sarah became thoughtful. "Cire is going to need a small wardrobe to start her new life." Serious, she said. "Dad owns a clothing surplus store here in town, we can get her a good deal on the latest fashions."

Susan Porter, Emily's best friend got into the spirit. She was near Emily's size with shoulder length red hair and green eyes. "My mom has a shoe store in the local mall." Excited, she said. "She is also a female etiquette coach, she can help Cire learn to present herself as a proper girl."

Sarah turned to you. "What do you think, Cire?" Kindly, she asked. "I'd rather have you wait before revealing yourself to the football team, slowly having them see your transformation build up to the home game but the choice is yours."

"Um... I might as well practice with the rest of you today since all of you went though so much trouble for me." Nervous, you said. "Still, I'd rather wait for the big reveal too as I'm still not sure about this."

Sarah smiled as Emily and Susan giggled. "You're no trouble at all, Cire." Kindly, she said. "I promise you made the right decision." She then turned serious. "Alright, girls! Get into formation, we have a new cheerleader to break in!"

You blushed more at that, if it were even possible as practice began and you were run through the drills. Practice was hard and tiring but it felt good to be a part of a team, even it was though a team of the opposite gender. When practice ended two hours later, Sarah ordered everyone to hit the showers. That was when you realized you had no clothing to wear other than your old clothes which Emily had put into a bag. She let out a giggle seeing your worried expression. "We got you a set of clothing to wear after practice... sis." Grinning, she said. "Relax."

You were very uncomfortable showering with all of the girls and washed yourself as quickly and neatly as you could. The other girls found it bemusing and giggled at your obvious sense of shyness. Coach Sarah was waiting for you as you toweled dry with a set of clothing for you to wear. "Just try keep an open mind, Cire." Firmly but kindly, she said. "You are one of the girls now."

You gave a weak smile and turned to the clothing to find it was a pair of pink and lace panties with a matching bra and...
1151.title: Nothing to lose.

11511.content:
"You still have to go back inside to gather your books." Seeing your confusion, Sarah said. "You will be assigned a new locker right next to your sister's starting tomorrow."

The girl's school uniform consisted of a dark blue pleated skirt that stopped just above the knees, a light blue blouse, a dark blue sleeveless sweater and a pink ribbon bow. You always found it strange that the button and zipper were on the side but you had no difficulty putting it on. The socks that came with the uniform went up to your knees and were a bit harder to put on but you managed. After putting on the blouse, you looked in the mirror. A cute, shy little school girl stared back at you. "This is going to take some getting used to." Sighing, you said.

"You'll be fine." Kindly, Emily said. She was also wearing the school uniform. "Let's go clean out your locker and get home."

You nodded and followed Emily back into the school where you both walked through the crowd of students all getting ready to leave for the day. A few students raised an eyebrow seeing you but nothing more, at least at the moment. You reached your locker and cleaned it completely out with Emily's help. There really wasn't much there but you gave it a second carefully look as you would be getting another locker.

"It feels like I'm starting a new life." Wincing, you said.

"In a way, you are." Smiling, Emily replied. "Hopefully, this one will be better for you."

"What does mom think about all of this?" Curious, you asked.

Emily blushed. "Actually it was mom's idea." Softly, she said. "She was furious when she found out what the football coach said to you." She giggled slightly as you followed her towards the exit. "She told me to tell you she has a surprise waiting for you at home."

"Today has been full of surprises." Rolling your eyes, you said.

"Excuse me, are you new here?" A male voice asked.

You and Emily stopped walking and turned to face...
11511.title: the girl's school uniform and mary janes.

115113.content:
You winced seeing a boy no older than yourself with short brown hair and brown eyes in the boy's school uniform looking at you with both curiosity and interest. You turned to Emily who grinned, obviously enjoying your awkward situation. "This is Cire." Honestly, she said. "She's my twin."

"I'm Ryan Sands." Smiling, the boy said. "I kind of stay in the crowd as my older sister, Bree is known as the gossip queen here at school." He blushed. "I never noticed you before now but... you're really cute."

Emily looked at you, her bemused grin turning into a more sinister one. "Well, my sister is a bit shy so she tends to blend into the crowd too."

"I guess we have something in common." smiling more, Ryan said.

You could not help blush as you discretely threw Emily a dirty look, one Ryan did not see, before forcing a shy smile. "I guess..."

Ryan took a cautious step forward. "Maybe... Maybe we can get together sometime and have a soda or something." Shyly, she said. He offered you a small folded piece of paper you suspected had his phone number on it. "Call me, if you're interested."

You hesitated but Emily took the paper and pushed it into a pocket in the folds of your pleated skirt. "She'll think about it, Ryan." Winking, she said.

You blushed further at that, not knowing how irresistibly cute it made you look. "Yeah... I'll think about it." Not knowing what else to say, you softly agreed.

Ryan smiled, blushing in tune with you. "Okay." Stepping back, he said. "I look forward to your call... Don't keep me waiting."

With that, he hurried off, vanishing into the crowd while Emily giggled. "Thanks for your support, sis." Sarcastically, you said. "I don't need a boy swooning over me on top of all of this."

"Welcome to a girl's world, sis." Bemused, she whispered. "I have to admit that I'm a bit jealous. You've only been a girl for a few hours and you're already sweeping boys off their feet without any effort." She giggled. "This is going to prove interesting."

"What do you mean?" Worried, you demanded.

"Bree Sands is the senior gossip queen." Smiling, Emily explained. "It won't be long before she learns that her little brother has asked out the new mystery girl in school."

You felt the color draining from your face. "She'll make the entire school curious about the 'mysterious' new girl." Nervous, you said. "What have you done?!"

"Calm down, Cire." Smiling, Emily said. "I just started a rumor that will help the school accept you as the girl you are."

You gulped. "This is all beginning to scare me." Uncertain, you muttered.

Emily giggled. "If you think this is scary, just wait until mom gives you 'The Talk'."

You sighed, wondering if you had made the right decision. With all that had happened, you knew that it was already too late to back out. You walked with Emily to mom whop was waiting for you in her car.

Mom was tall and slender but muscular with long forest brown hair and emerald green eyes and a body models would kill for though she did not flaunt it as others might. "There are my girls." Teasing, she said. "How was your day, my angels?"

Emily giggled as you blushed. "It was eventful, mom." Softly, you said. "But I'm guessing you already know most of it."

Mom motioned for you and Emily to get into the car where you all put on your seat belts and mom drove away from the school. "I will admit that I spearheaded the effort to start your journey into becoming a cheerleader." Calmly, she said. "Only no one is going to push you into becoming legally female." she frowned. "This is just to teach that arrogant football coach, Rusty Rune a lesson."

"A boy hit on me just before we left the school." Frowning, you said. "He gave me his number and is older sister is the school gossip queen."

Mom smiled. "My little girl is growing up." Teasing you again, she said. Seeing your face harden, she sighed. "No one is going to force you to call him but, if this boy is determined, giving him the cold shoulder will not detour him."

"I feel 'The Talk' coming on." Wincing, you said.

Mom smiled. "There are a lot of things girls need to worry about that no boy will ever understand, Cire." Calmly, she said. "Because you were born a boy, you don't need to worry about getting pregnant but there other issues."

As mom explained the various issues you would face being 'female', you began to gain a better understanding of how deep you had fallen into a girl's world including the fear of getting raped among other things. It was not until the car stopped that mom ended her lecture and you found yourself...
115113.title: Starting a rumor.

1151132.content:
It was not until the car stopped that mom ended her lecture and you found yourself in front of the local mall. "Dare I ask why we are here?" wincing, you asked.

"You are going to need a small wardrobe since you will be a girl for the school year." Serious, mom said. "That means you will be dressed appropriately at all times."

"Lovely..." Frowning, you said.

"It won't be as bad as you think." Kindly, Emily said. "Your measurements are very close to my own." She giggled. "Minus your 'bust' but we'll work on that."

You found yourself blushing again to which mom ushered you and Emily out of the car and into the mall where she half carried and half dragged you into a clothing store called Stone Surplus with Emily following with a smile on her face.

"Welcome, Ms Masters." Politely, a tall and muscular man in a suit said. "My wife, Sarah said you would be coming straight from school." He turned to you, smiling. "This must be the young lady in need of a new wardrobe."

You gulped. The man easily towered over you and seemed forbidding with his crew cut black hair and rock like build. Only his baby blue eyes and gentle smile told a different story, you could not help shyly smile back. "Hi..."

"This is my son, Cire." Serious, mom explained. "I'm sure your wife briefed you on the situation at hand."

The man nodded. "She did indeed." Turning serious, he said. He turned back to you. "My name is Rodger Stone. I understand that the decision before you is a difficult one but I think I can find a style that will please both the boy and the girl within you."

"Let's get started then." Calmly, mom said. "We have a few other stops to make before we go home."

Rodger nodded. "This way then."

You were led by the hand to the teen girls section of the store where you were shown a number of jeans, shorts and skirts. You could feel the warmth of your blushing as mom had you try on one outfit after another. this included swimsuits, one piece and two piece which made you blush even more. The only thing that made it all bearable was that mom and Emily both asked how you liked the outfits. Reluctantly, you had to admit that you liked how many of the outfits looked on the teen girl you saw in the mirror. within an hour, you had built a small wardrobe. All that was left was to try on a few dresses which you had saved for last. It was mostly because you did not like the thought of having to wear one.

"Not all girls like wearing dresses." Smiling, Emily said. "Still, they all own at least one so you need to pick out a few for your closet if only for appearances." Then she thought, "Or you decide to become a girl for real."

With a sigh, you picked out a dress at random and stepped into the changing room to try it on. You did not catch mom and Emily's bemused smile as you closed the changing room door. The dress was white with three tiers and a lot of frills. The inner fabric was very soft against your smooth skin, which made you shudder slightly as you pushed your arms through the short puffed sleeves. Only as you tried to reach the zipper in the back, you found it was out of your reach.

"I- I can't reach the zipper!" Blushing, you called out.

The door opened and mom entered smiling. "Let me help." Softly, she said. "It takes a little practice, that's all."

She pushed the zipper closed then pulled you out of the dressing room to face a mirror where your entire face turned red from your blushing.

"This is a wedding dress!" Shocked and embarrassed, you screamed.

Mom and Emily laughed as Rodger unsuccessfully hid a smile. "It's actually a flower girl dress, Cire." Correcting, you, he said. "Still, it looks rather stunning on the girl in the mirror, don't you think?"

You moaned, pouting at your reflection. "Are we done yet?"

Mom smiled. "I think we're done." Calmly, she said. "i picked out a simple white dress for you to try on later, if you want." She turned to Rodger. "We're ready to purchase our order, Mr. Stone."

Rodger shook his head. "My wife and I agreed there will be no charge." Smiling, he said. "It will be worth it to see that arrogant coach knocked down a peg or two."

Mom nodded in agreement then had you change into a pair of skinny jeans and a loose fitting blouse before leaving the store with your new wardrobe.

"Where to now?" Sighing, you asked. "It's been a long day."

"Patience, Cire." Kindly, mom said. "We are now going to..."
1151132.title: at the mall.

11511321.content:
"Why are you taking me to a shoe store?" Curious, you asked. "I have shoes."

"There is much you need to learn about a girl's wardrobe, Cire." Bemused, mom said. "However, we will get into that later. Just trust me when I say you will need them."

Reluctantly, you followed mom and Emily into the store to find Susan waiting with her mother, a near mirror image of herself waiting for you who introduced herself as Terry. "Welcome to our store, Cire." Smiling, Susan said. "You look great!" She giggled seeing you blush. "I can't wait to show you the latest fashions in footwear."

"Are shoes really that important?" Wincing, you asked.

"Well, shoe fashions really do not change that much from year to year for boys." Serious, Terry said. "For girls, especially teenagers, they are often judged by the shoes they wear and how they compliment their chosen outfits."

"Without training, you will likely stick out like a sore thumb just for your shoes." Softly, Emily added, "That is why they are so important to girls."

You sighed. "It sounds a bit high maintenance."

Emily and Susan giggled as mom and Terry smiled. "Welcome to our world, sweetie." Bemused, mom said. "Don't worry though, we'll help you ease into your role."

With that, your education on shoes began including how to walk in heels. Just as you thought you got used to them, Emily placed a book onto your head. "Walk without knocking the book down." Serious, she said. "Proper posture is a must."

You were again struggling to keep your balance while balancing a book on your head and each time the book fell, Emily or mom would give you a painful whack on the rear. "Ow!" Irritated, after the fourth whack, you yelled. "Must you!?"

"Emily had to go through this too, Cire." Firmly, mom said. "I had my turn when I was her age and now its your turn."

It seemed to last forever though it was only really about a half hour before you were able to balance four books on your head back and forth across the store. Mom and Terry applauded you with Emily and Susan quickly following. The books were taken off your head and you were given back your pink sneakers. "I'm done with this." Grumpily, you complained. "Can we go home now?"

Mom sighed. "I know this is wearing on your patience, Cire." Gently, she said. "Please just allow us a little more time. I promise we are almost done."

You glared at mom. The embarrassment of having to be a girl and a cheerleader for most of the school year was bad enough. On top of that, you were sore and tired from cheerleading practice. Now, your bottom and feet were sore from learning how to walk in high heels with proper posture as they called it. "I don't know how much more I can take in one day, mom..." Tearing up, you whispered.

"I know you are having a rough day, Cire." Gently, mom said. "I'll tell you what... If you agree to go into one last store with us, I will buy you something very special. A little something extra, just for you."

The thought of something special intrigued you but you were a little worried about the surprise mom had in store for you at home. You moaned, not knowing what to do. finally, you sighed and gave a silent nod.

"Thank you, Cire." Smiling, mom said.

"The shoes are on us." Kindly, Terry said. "Consider it compensation for your sore rear and bruised ego."

Mom hid a grin while Susan and Emily tried hard not to laugh out loud. You however, were still pouting, wishing for nothing more than for the day to end.

Next mom and Emily dragged you to...
11511321.title: a shoe store.

choices: a salon for a full makeover.
the food court where Ryan Sands works.
115113211.content:
You blushed even more, if that was possible upon seeing mom drag you into a lingerie shop where you were greeted by her sister, your aunt Gwen Summers. She was just as tall as mom with the body of a model only she had long blond hair and blue eyes. The two hugged each other before Gwen turned to you with a patient smile. "I can already tell that you are not in the best of moods, Cire." Calmly, she said. "Try to understand that all of this and more will help you avoid greater troubles and frustrations later."

"Why smack my rear while walking in heels though?" Pouting, you demanded.

"I'm sure you had seen many a boy smack a girl in the rear while wearing heels." patiently, Gwen replied. "If they did not know proper posture, they would likely stumble and fall, revealing their panties to the boy who had hit her."

"That or injure themselves." Serious, mom added. "Everything has a reason."

You sighed at that then blushed eying the panties and bras. "Are you here to help me pick out some undergarments and nightgowns?" Frowning, you asked.

"That and to install your breast forms." Smiling, Gwen said.

You took a step back, slowly shaking your head but mom took a firm hold of your shoulder, holding you in place. "There is nothing to be afraid of, sweetie." Cooing you, mom said. "The glue does bond them to your skin at the molecular level but they come off with the proper solvent regardless of how long you have worn them."

"This is too much." Now crying, you said. "Please... no more."

"This is the last thing, I promise." Softly, mom said. "Then you get that something extra special I told you about."

"No one is going to see your underwear but you and the girls when you change." Serious, Gwen said. "The breast forms I ordered for you are the top of the line, they look and feel like the real thing." she smiled. "They have sensors built in that allow you to feel it when you or someone else touches them so it won't seem so weird."

"Just thinking about it seems weird." Wincing, you said.

After some convincing, you agreed to have the breast forms installed and Gwen led you to the back room where she had you lay down on a bench with your blouse and push up bra removed. She then carefully applied the glue to your bare chest and the beast forms before firmly pushing them into place. You winced, feeling her hands against the breasts as if they were really yours but before it got to bee too weird for you, she released them and handed you a pink bra with a yellow bow on the front and white lace on the trim. "I'm a bit surprised." Looking at you, she said. "I ordered mid B cup breasts but, on your small frame, they look huge."

"They're heavy..." pouting, you complained.

You winced as even touching them sent unfamiliar chills up your spine. Gwen walked you through putting on the bra before having you put your blouse back on. "The bra will give you a bit of a trapped feeling but that will pass as you get used to wearing it." Calmly, she said. "The sensitivity of your new breasts will pass as well as you get used to how they feel."

"You look great, honey." smiling, mom said. "We already got you a sufficient amount of panties, bras, and nightgowns so we are done here." She then took your hand and pulled you towards the door. "Now for that extra something special..."

You sighed, happy your day was almost over but you were also a bit fearful of what mom had in mind. She took you to...
115113211.title: a lingerie shop.

1151132114.content:
You turned to mom, confused seeing that she had taken you to a jewelry booth just outside of Gwen's lingerie shop. "If I remember right, you had wanted pierced ears since you started helping the cheerleaders six years ago." Whispering, mom explained. "I told you that no son of mine will have pierced ears." she smiled. "Well, you look more like my daughter now..."

Your jaw dropped as mom gently urged you to sit in a chair at the booth while the saleslady asked, "Which earrings would your daughter like?"

"Ask her." Smiling, mom said. "Though you might want to give her a minute. I think she's still a bit surprised."

Emily giggled before catching your attention. "I like the heart shaped earrings." Giggling, she said. "They are so you."

You looked at the earrings Emily had pointed out and inwardly winced. They were cute, too cute for your taste. You looked at the other selections and pointed out a pair of earrings that had a tiny boy and a tiny girls side by side. "I'd like to have those." Softly, you said. "The girl and boy earrings."

"That's an interesting choice." Bemused, mom said. "May I ask why?"

You threw mom a look that told her she knew why but because Emily and the young saleslady seemed to be waiting for an answer, you replied, "I'm a tomboy. Cute as a girl but tough as a boy."

The saleslady laughed. "Good answer." Smiling, she said. "Hold still, this won't take but a minute or two."

with that, she rubbed your earlobe with an alcohol wipe then made a tiny mark with a pen before bringing out a piercing gun. You closed your eyes, expecting a painful pinch but felt nothing but a little pressure. Before you knew what was happening, the saleslady announced she was done. You looked into the mirror next to the chair and gawked at your new look. You now had a tiny silver girl on your left earlobe and a tiny silver boy on your right. Though you were hoping they would have been placed the other way around, you smiled and said, "I like it."

"I'm glad you like it, sweetie." Hugging you, mom said. "Now we can go home."

With that, you all left the mall. You and Emily helped mom load the car with your new small wardrobe and mom drove you both home. The ride was quiet but not really uncomfortable as you were lost in thought over the events of the day. You woke up this morning as a sad and depressed teenage boy. Now, you were going home as a confused, shy and cute teenage girl. "Curiouser and curiouser... how deep does the rabbit hole go..."

In a strange way, you felt like Alice in Wonderland, falling deeper and deeper into a strange world, a girl's world. You began to wonder if there would be any way out for you once it was all over. You wondered if you would really want to find a way out.

"Mom... What if I get to like this?" Nervous, you asked. "Being a girl, I mean..."

"We will cross that bridge when we get to it, honey." Kindly, mom said. "Right now, I think you've had enough adventure for one day."

Upon returning home, mom asked you to unlock the door while she and Emily started to gather your new belongings. You eagerly walked up to the front door, hoping to find some form or normalcy, and thrust the key into the lock. Only, as you opened the door, the inside lights came on, forcing you to let out a high pitched shriek as you heard a chorus of female voices yell, "Surprise!!"

Mom giggled behind you, carrying one of the boxes. "I guess you forgot that little surprise I mentioned was waiting for you at home." Bemused, she said. "The entire cheer squad came here to celebrate..."
1151132114.title: A small reward and big surprise.

11511321141.content:
To say you were surprised would have been an understatement. The spacious family room had been decorated with streamers in the color of your school and banners that read: Welcome to the Squad. There was one table set up with drinks and snacks and another set up with a portable sound station with light rock music playing. Waiting for you there were all five cheerleaders from your class with coach Sarah Stone, all wearing casual dresses and flats. You and Emily made it a full squad of seven. Sarah smiled as she approached you. "It had become a tradition to have a small celebration when a new girl joins the cheer squad." Bemused, she said. "By all rights, you should have been given a party when you started helping my girls come up with award winning cheer routines years ago."

"We are making up for that by throwing you a big party now." Smiling, Rachel added. She giggled. "You look great, Cire."

"I must admit I'm a bit jealous." Grinning, Susan said. "Your 'girls' are bigger than mine."

You blushed at that as the other girls approached to introduce themselves. You knew them all due to helping the squad for so long. First was a short, petite girl with long blond hair and blue eyes. You knew her as Fae Winters. She was barely your height with delicate doll like features that would make one suspect she was a fragile girl only she was deceptively strong. "Welcome to the squad, Cire." Grinning, she said. "No more behind the scenes work for you."

You could not help giggle at that. "I guess not." Smiling, you said. then you winked and added, I'll try not to upstage you."

Fae laughed. "Not a chance, girl." Teasing, she retorted.

Next was a tall and fit girl with shoulder length brown hair and green eyes. You knew her as Bree West, an all over tomboy who had more than once stood up for you when the boys picked on you for your feminine looks. "I see you finally found the courage to try out, Cire." Teasing, she said. "I'm glad you made the cut."

You blushed more at that but found yourself softly saying, "Actually... so am I."

"What was that?" Grinning, Bree demanded. "Speak up like a mother bear!"

This irritated you after all that had happened and, before you could stop yourself, you blurted out, "I'm glad I made the cut!"

Bree smiled. "That's more like it!" Tussling your hair, she said.

You blushed more, not believing what you had just done and turned to the last girl. She was short and slender with short black hair and blue eyes. She smiled shyly at you, which you returned. Her name was Amy Smith whom had a slight weight issue the year before. You had more than once stood up for when she was picked on and showed her how cheerleading could change her life. "You helped me regain my spirit and confidence." Smiling, she said. "I'll do all I can to do the same for you." She surprised you with a warm hug. "Welcome to the squad... and womanhood."

You did not know how to react to that so you merely smiled. "Thank you."

"All of the boxes have been unloaded." Taking your arm, Emily said. "It's time for you get ready for the party."

You gulped remembering that everyone was wearing dresses. "That dress mom bought for me..."

Mom giggled, holding up the simple white dress. "Yup!"

"Don't keep us waiting, girls." Teasing, Sarah said. "Let's get this party started."

Mom and Emily half carried, half dragged you up the stairs to your bedroom...
11511321141.title: you joining the squad.

115113211412.content:
Minutes later, you walked into the sitting room wearing a knee length short sleeve dress with a dark blue sash. There were peal inlays around the collar which dipped low enough to show a modest amount of cleavage. You were wearing white flats but no stockings to hide your legs. Fortunately, they were naturally smooth and silky thanks to mom insisting upon you using feminine hygiene. Mom and Emily were right behind you, wearing similar dresses but everyone's eyes were fixed upon you.

"You look absolutely stunning, Cire." Gushing, Sarah said.

"Th- Thank you." Blushing, you said. "It- It wasn't easy to look this way..."

Everyone laughed, confusing you before mom placed a gentle hand onto your shoulder with a kind smile. "We all know it was not easy for you to turn out this way." Bemused, she said. "However, to the unsuspecting boy or girl, you are a real knockout."

"I wish I could look as good as you." Smiling, Susan said. "You make it look effortless."

"Not bad for being born a boy." Grinning, Bree said. "You still need some work though." She giggled, seeing worry on your face. "Don't worry, we'll show you the ropes."

"What do you mean?" Sitting down, you asked.

Sarah smiled. "For starters, close or cross your legs when you sit." Pointing, she said. "Unless you want every boy to get a clear view up your dress."

You let out a short yelp before quickly crossing your legs as the girls laughed again. "There is a lot you need to learn, Cire." Smiling, Emily said. "We'll be giving you a crash course though the entire party."

"I'm honored..." Sighing, you said.

Mom giggled. "Don't you fret, honey." Cooing you, she said. "We'll make it fun for you."

She then walked to the door and opened it. "Gentlemen, you are just in time..."

You spun around to see a number of boys walking in wearing suits. "You invited some boys to the party?!" Whispering, you demanded.

You wanted to run but Sarah and Emily had a firm hand onto your shoulders. "Relax, young lady." Firmly but kindly, Sarah said. "These are the cheerleader's boyfriends, you are going to be seeing a lot of them. They were invited to meet the mysterious new member of the squad."

"They are going to spark a conversation with you at some point." Serious, Emily added. "It's best if you are introduced to them with us around."
