"Okay sir, I'm leaving for lunch," you smiled with a little knock on his door. You still had a habit of calling him sir in the office, even though he said it was fine for you to call him Jeff.

"Okay, have fun," he smiled as he waved you off.

From there, you grabbed your purse and took your time to the elevator, excited to get to know more people. Since becoming a woman, you really wanted to connect with these people more. It was part of who you were. So, you were happy as you reached the lobby, seeing Mandy and about 2 other women there. From their nametags alone, you could see Nicole Stapleton and Amy Hartford.

"Ah, nice to see you," Mandy smiled as she welcomed you along. "Everyone, this is Alex, the new girl here."

"Hello," smiled Amy, enthusiastic to meet you. Nicole was equally as excited.

So, with that in mind, Mandy offered to take them all in her own car, which was rather nice of her. The four of you got to her car rather quickly, with you going in the back seat with Amy.

"So Alex..." Amy smiled at you as Mandy began to drive. "Could you tell me a bit about yourself? Where you grew up? What school you studied at? Anything?"

She was a boatload of questions, though that just made you laugh a bit.

"Well..." you started.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: You'll join them

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You hadn't much talked about your upbringing with anyone, everyone just seemed to know back at the old office. This is new territory, but you could handle it.

"Well, I grew up in Chicago. It's a great city, though I have to admit, despite my hometown pride, L.A. is a lot more beautiful." you giggled. "I graduated from Vathun University with a degree in business."

That was a local college where you were from, one that prior to that visit to the office was where you had intended to go. But that's silly cause you already graduated.

"How did you end up at the company?" Amy asked.

"I don't really know. I just sort of showed up one day and things fell into place. It's not where I intended to be, but I'm happy that I'm here." you said.

Your mind started to be flooded with memories. You remembered your life, growing up as a little girl, your mother getting you your job at the company right out of college, you remembered proms and graduations, lectures, even a period of pledging a sorority, and of course the years you spent at the company, first as an intern and then a secretary, you had come a long way.

"Alex, I hope you don't mind me asking, and I don't mean to offend but..." Nicole piped up from the passenger seat. "Are you and Mr. Hoffman together?"

"Are people talking?" you asked.

"Oh, no. It's just that I saw you walk in together and..." she started.

"Sort of." you blushed. "We live together. My apartment fell through right before the move and..."

"I get it." Nicole said.

Eventually you arrived at the restaurant, a rather nice diner that you assumed that they frequented, based on the rapport they had with the staff. You and the girls went to a table and sat down, perusing the menu.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Casual Talk

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Guess you've had quite the ride," Nicole smiled as she looked through her menu.

"Yeah, it's been fun," you smiled.

Even through everything you remembered, that one day over a month ago in the office still stood out to you so much. In a way, it was like a beginning, even though you knew you worked there for years. Well, it made you smile all the same. Somehow....you felt you were better for it.

"Both of us are from around here," Amy smiled. "Nicole and I were actually buds at UCLA, so we know each other pretty well since we were in the same degree."

"Oh, that's nice," you smiled. "It's nice being at a job with a good friend."

"Definitely," Amy agreed.

More casual talk came as you ordered little drinks and all. Amy liked to gush about a lot of things while Nicole held back a bit. They were all pretty funny to talk with. You already felt like you were going to be great friends.

"Well, hopefully everything works out for you," Mandy smiled.

"Me too. Thanks," you thanked her. "You been here a long time?"

"Yes, I've been here a few years, though I was in Orlando originally," she said. "Quite the ride to get over here, but it's been worth it. My husband was very supportive over the move."

"Oh, you're married?" you asked sincerely.

"Yep," Mandy smiled, her wedding ring showing. "Best time of my life."

Just hearing about that briefly made you think about that with....Jeff....Just the very thought of it made you blush heavily, but you smiled all the same.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: More talk over lunch

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You continued talking over lunch and you got to know them all really well, though you were still thinking about Jeff. You thought back to that comment your mother made about "popping the question", and wondered yourself when/if he was going to do it.

"I definitely see you going far, Alex." Mandy said. "You've got the same spunk that I had when I was your age."

"That's very nice of you to say." you replied.

"Oh come on, you say that to all the secretaries. You said that to both of us when we started too!" Amy interjected.

"It's still true," Mandy laughed.

You finished lunch and headed back to the office. You all went back to your respective offices/desks and you felt happy that you had made some new friends. When you returned there was a big pile of new work to do, so you got right to it.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: More time over lunch

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The weeks just flew by in your new home.

Daily life with Jeff in his apartment quickly became second nature, and you couldn't be happier for it. Days merged into weeks and then a couple of months since the move to LA.

Of course, you and Jeff had come a good ways in your jobs as well. While your positions hadn't changed, the higher-ups had certainly noticed your dedication and work ethic, as well as Jeff's own. They were quite proud of both of you. It made you wonder if a promotion could be in the future. If so, perhaps the pay increase could result in you both being able to buy a house.

That sounded so heavenly, not that apartment wasn't nice though. In any case, after yet another day of work, you and Jeff had gone out to a fancy restaurant. You had been waiting a while to wear the dress you were wearing, a nice green one that showed off your figure.

"This is probably the most we've spent since coming here," you smiled as you had a sip of wine.

"Yeah, definitely," Jeff said, though he seemed like his mind was occupied with something.

You had noticed that since the beginning of the night out, making you wonder what was going on. Was he told something?

"You okay?" you asked with concern.

"Yeah...I'm okay," Jeff smiled a bit. "Just thinking is all."

You left it at that, though you were curious all the same. Eventually, you all finished your meals and began to leave.

"Say...there's a place I'd like you to see." Jeff said.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A few weeks later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You got into the car and Jeff began driving. He seemed to be checking his pocket a lot, but you didn't notice it as strange. Sometimes he got a little fidgety when he was preoccupied. You didn't talk much on the drive aside from stray comments about the quality of the dinner. The car stopped in a parking lot and you got out, seeing a pier in front of you.

"What's this place?" you asked.

"I wanted to find a nice quiet place to relax after dinner. We always go straight home." Jeff replied.

You walked down the pier together, before stopping at the end. You looked off into the distance, and in the glow of the moonlight and the stars, it was a sight to behold. You turned to Jeff to see that he was kneeling on the ground with one of his hands digging into his pocket. He smiled at you. Your heart stopped and you felt a slight tremble. You held your breath as you waited for what would happen next.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Going to a new place

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Predictably, Jeff held the box out, with a ring inside.

"You were just waiting for it, were you?" he smiled, like he was reading your mind. "Will you marry me, Alexandra Thompson?"

Well, that much was obvious, and you couldn't be happier. With everything you two had been through coming to mind, you eagerly said yes to his proposal, hugging him immediately and kissing him hard. The two of you just stayed like that for a while, enjoying each others company as you accepted the ring. Of course, your mind immediately went to how long it would be until your marriage.

"I can't wait to tell everyone," you smiled

****A few months later****

Of course, everyone gushed over the news of your pending marriage, to the point where it was all anyone would talk about for a while. It did get a bit old after a while, but you were excited none the less. Heck, here you were, standing in a long white dress, all dolled up and ready to go. Everyone had come out to see this union, which was held in Chicago, since that was where you wanted to be married.

The marriage played out as many do, with all the typical amenities like the music and rings and everything else. You could barely hold yourself in as you were finally allowed to kiss, sending cheering everywhere.

"So, now where from here?" you smiled as you walked along with Jeff.

"Well, I got a great honeymoon lined up," Jeff smiled while giving you another kiss.

Yeah, pretty much everything had lead up to this. Funny enough, you still thought of that one day in the office that just seemed to set everything in motion. Good thing though, because things had been heavenly since.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Jeff proposes

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
****Six Months Later****

You sat on the couch in the living room of the house that you and Jeff now shared. It was a little ways from the office, but the commute wasn't bad. You had continued working together, even though Jeff's new salary could accommodate you staying at home, you just felt wrong when you weren't at your desk. Today though, you were awaiting Jeff's return home, since you had taken the day off for a very special doctor's appointment. You could hardly contain your excitement when Jeff walked through the door.

"Honey, I'm home!" Jeff said. "How did it go?"

"Everything's fine. Though of course, we'll need to go food shopping more often." you said.

"Huh?" Jeff asked.

You took a deep breath and smiled.

"Because I'll be eating for two." you replied.

"Alex, that's great!" Jeff exclaimed, as he ran over to you and hugged you.

Everything had fallen into place. You were a secretary, a wife and soon to be a mother. What else could a girl ask for?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Kids?

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Life just continued on as normal for you, granted there were all the things associated with pregnancy and all.

Still, you wouldn't trade it for the world, and Jeff was incredibly supportive throughout the 9 month period. By the time it was done, you gave birth to a boy, named Damon Hoffman.

The shift to paranthood brought it's own unique challenges, but like everything, you just seemed to excel at it all. So much that...well....you guys didn't just stop at one.

Nope, eventually you got pregnant a second time...and eventually a third time. The second child was also a boy, named Chris, while the third child was a girl, who you named Erin.

"Quite the family we have," you smiled at a picture of you with your husband and three kids. Jeff was there smiling with you.

"Indeed," he agreed, sharing an affectionate kiss with you.

With that all settled, your story pretty much came to an end. You were a secretary, a wife, and now a mother of three. This life had become the new norm for you, and you were happy for it, even if the true nature of that one day in the office wasn't really known to you.

However...with your life settled and story coming to a close, there remains one question. Surely, magic is still out there, such is the kind that turned you into you are now. It could get to anyone, including your family. There was the possibility that maybe one of your kids could end up on a transformation journey of their own.

But does it happen?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The end?

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content: This time, one of Alex and Jeff's children is the one sent on the transformation journey, either Damon, Chris or Erin. However, it doesn't occur at their parent's workplace, we've already seen that. Does it maybe happen at a summer job or something like that?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Adjusting for the Job II

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
All right, now what kind of summer job then?

Perhaps at a Japanese maid cafe?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Adjusting for the Summer Job

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
In a suburban area of L.A., a family house stood, with a father, a mother and three children living inside. School has just let out for the summer and one of those children is destined to get a summer job that just might change their lives forever.

Who is it then that gets to follow in their mother's footsteps, Damon, Chris or Erin?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Yes

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
All right, it's one of the sons then.

Which one would it be? Damon, who's in High School? Or Chris, who had just graduated from Middle School?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Damon/Chris

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content: You are Chris Hoffman, and you're about to start your first summer job. You didn't really want one, but your parents had insisted, your father especially whose philosophy on money was if you want money, you have to earn it. Your mother had offered to try to get you something at the office that both your parents work at, but you didn't want to work there. You had wanted to enjoy your summer like your younger sister gets to, and your older brother gets to, since he's two months off of college, you're only two months off of starting high school. So you sent out applications in the area to see what bit. You had sent applications to supermarkets, department stores and even a summer camp, but only one application got accepted, a Japanese maid cafe that had recently opened up near your house.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Chris

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Frankly, you were surprised as anyone that that one of all things got accepted. No doubt you got a bit of heckling from your big brother about it. Even Erin took some jokes at it. Oh well, you were used to dealing with them.

Still, you weren't sure how to take it. I mean, you liked the occasional anime and all that, but that was quite a step beyond that. You had never even been to such a place, just sending in one of many online applications. The whole concept sounded kind of weird, especially compared to your mom's work as a secretary. Still, this was how things were I suppose.

"Admit it, you think it's strange," you sighed as your mom drove you in the car.

"I do not," she smiled sincerely. "Any place is good job experience."

You wondered if she really believed that, but you shrugged all the same and let it go for now. The place wasn't too far away so it wasn't a long drive. Of course, as one might expect, the entrance seemed kind of inconspicuous. Yeah, you could already see the mix of English and Japanese words on the front of it. You just felt an odd sense of curiosity and dread right now. If anyone else knew about this, you'd get heckled for life.

"Want me to come in with you?" your mom asked.

"No, I can handle it," you said. You were 14 after all. You could handle yourself.

"Okay...I'll come back at around 4:00 then," your mom smiled as she gave you a little kiss before you jumped out of the car, your stuff in hand.

Eventually, your mom left, leaving you in front of the weird place. Well, Dad always talked about having to lay in your bed as you made it, so you guessed you had no choice. Surely, as a guy, you wouldn't have to do anything too bad. With a deep breath, you slowly opened the door. The inside of the store was....pretty cutesy as one would expect. If they ever liked Japanese anime and all that, chances are they'd feel a little bit at home. For you, it was a mix of that and just finding it a bit strange.

Still, it was a bit quiet right now, making you wonder who was even around.

"Hello?" you called out a bit.

Suddenly, you heard the clacking of footsteps coming. Right around the corner came who you assumed to be one of the employees, or maids given the atmosphere. Fittingly, she looked Japanese, and had the full uniform on. She didn't look a whole lot older than you though, possibly in high school like your older brother.

"Um, hello?" you said, trying to be nice. "I'm...Chris Hoffman. I submitted an application recently and....I was told to start today...."

Boy, you really didn't know what to say to the girl. Bet she didn't expect a boy to come in and say that.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your first day of work

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Oh, you're the new hire..." the girl said, pondering over you for a moment and then snapped back to the conversation. "I'm Ruki, I'm the most senior person working today."

"So, what exactly am I going to be doing?" you asked.

"Well, while we could use another maid... I think today you can start with sweeping up." Ruki replied, handing you a white apron, similar to the type a barista would wear, though it did appear to have a rather lacy design, but that could just be keeping with the aesthetic of the cafe.

"Alright." you said, wrapping the apron around your black dress pants. You were wearing those and a white button down shirt that your mother had said was perfect for the first day at a new job.

You found a broom and got to work sweeping the floors.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Introductions

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Honestly, things just seemed to proceed smoothly and slowly at the cafe. You didn't really have to deal with any customers. It seemed to be either Ruki or someone else doing it. Fittingly, pretty much every employee seemed to be Japanese, though you didn't really talk with anyone often.

"Feels kind of weird," you said as you flattened the apron a bit. "Well, at least this is easy enough."

You just continued to sweep, just enjoying what time you could. Hey, any job experience was good, so you were okay with something as simple as this. There didn't seem to be too many employees right now, though the restaurant wasn't too big to begin with so it made sense.

However....enough sweeping eventually made you kind of bored.

"Boy...sweeping a place this small kind of gets repetitive," you sighed.

You weren't sure how much time had passed, but you were beginning to feel a bit hungry. You looked up at the clock, seeing that it was past noon. Wow, it had been that much time already?

"Excuse me!" one maid accidentally ran into you, though thankfully nothing bad happened.

You barely got a glimpse of the girl before she had run off to serve whatever food she had. Once she was done and had calmed down, you could get a better look. Like many of the others, she had dark hair, though hers was in a ponytail. She hardly looked over than you as well, which kind of fit the place anyway. She was cute though, probably the kind of girl you wouldn't mind dating.

"Sorry about that," she said with a small bow. "I was a in a bit of a rush."

"No problem," you smiled, deciding to give a little bow back out of respect. "I'm Chris by the way. The...uh..new guy here."

The girl beamed a bit. "Oh, I had heard a boy had applied here. It's nice to meet you. I'm Aiko. Aiko Sugihara, at your service."

She did a little curtsey just for fun, which got a little laugh out of you both. Okay, this girl was pretty nice. Maybe you could be friends. Though, right then, your stomach rumbled. Aiko smiled a bit more.

"You know, I think we can have our lunch break now," she said. "I was just about to have mine anyway."

"Um, sure." you said, agreeing with her as you put the broom in a good spot.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The day goes on

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You walked out of the cafe with Aiko, who was still in her maid costume. You looked at her quizzically as you walked out.

"Right, forgot you were new. We're not really supposed to take off the uniforms, even to leave the building. It's something about staying in character. People stared at first, but the cafe's been here long enough that everyone just accepts it." Aiko said.

"Huh." you remarked. It did seem that no one was staring at Aiko.

You walked two doors down to a fast food restaurant and walked inside. You ordered your food and sat down.

"You know, I've gotta ask. Why work at the cafe?" Aiko asked.

"It was the only place that accepted my application." you replied.

"Well there are worse places to work." Aiko giggled. "I'm sure you'll eventually fit right in."

"I hope so." you said.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Lunch break with Aiko

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Lunch proceeded rather quickly, although it dawned on you that you were having lunch with a pretty girl. First time you could say that ever happened. Perhaps this wouldn't be so bad.

"So...." you began to say. "Is...everyone Japanese at the cafe?"

"Yep, everyone," Aiko smiled. "Some of us have lived here for much of our lives though, while just some actually just came from Japan. My family and I have lived here for a few years."

"Ah, neat." you smiled, continuing to eat. "Guess that explains why you talk so well.....Ah, no offense!" you immediately said as you felt like you messed up a bit there.

"None taken. I get that sometimes," Aiko nodded. "Though...I think you might be the first boy I've actually seen work at the cafe."

"Well, it's easy to see why," you said. "I mean, I'm not exactly one for dresses." you added with a smirk.

Both of you got a little laugh out of that, easing the mood a bit. Although...oddly enough, as you were eating, your hand glanced over your arm a bit, and something....felt a little bit off. With a hum, you looked at your arm, feeling like it was...kind of smooth? Granted, going through puberty, you certainly weren't the hairiest boy around, but it felt like your hand went over your arm a lot smoother.

"Hmm, maybe it's just the work or something," you said.

"What was that?" Aiko quizzily asked.

"Ah, nothing," you waved it off. It couldn't be anything really. "Just thinking to myself."
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Lunch continues

choices: Talking about your day over dinner
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You and Aiko walked back to the cafe and you both got back to work. After some sweeping you stood back and rested for a moment, brushing some hair out of your face. Had it really been this long since your last haircut? You brushed off the thought and got back to work. Eventually, Riku walked up to you.

"Chris, I'm very impressed with your sweep work. You'll be a maid in no time!" Riku laughed.

You laughed as well, but for some reason, the thought of being a maid felt slightly appealing. You felt pride in your work that you had never felt before, maybe this job wasn't going to be so bad.

Eventually, your first shift ended, and you hung up your apron and went home for the night.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back to Work

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Eventually, your mom came around to pick you up.

"How was your day?" she asked with a smile.

"Not bad," you smiled surprisingly. "I got to meet some of the girls there. They're really nice and supportive."

"That's good to hear," your mom nodded, her smile not going away.

Later on, you both got home, to which you just settled in and did things you normally did, like games and such, until dinner was ready. Things were rather typical, until your dad asked you about your day as well. You reiterated the same things to him. However, one thing you never mentioned was that feeling with your skin, and no one seemed to care about the slightly longer hair either.

"They put you in a dress?" snickered Damon.

"No," you replied with a deadpan look. "I just did my job. That's more than you can say."

"Alright, enough," smiled your mom.

"Were they all really cute?" giggled Erin.

"Um...yeah, I could say so," you shrugged.

Truthfully, you thought they were very cute. Definitely girls you would date if you got the chance. Still, you were getting ahead of yourself. It was just one day after all. Best to take things slowly.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking about your day over dinner

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
That night, before settling in for bed, you inspected your body. It was definitely smoother than it was the day before, and it wasn't just lack of hair that was unsettling. You got into your pajamas and climbed into bed. Despite the odd feeling that your skin was having rubbing against your pajamas, you fell asleep rather quickly.

Suddenly, you were back at the cafe. You looked around, everything seemed normal. You turned to see Ruki standing across the room from you.

"Hey! Chris, that table needs their order!" Ruki shouted.

That confused you, since you didn't serve. You felt a weight in your arms and you were suddenly holding several trays. You looked down and saw that you were wearing one of the maid uniforms. You dropped the trays, save for a silver tray that you picked up and inspected yourself in. You were indeed in the uniform, dress, heels and all.

"What's going on?" you asked.

You looked at your face, which was framed with long black hair, in contrast to your lighter brownish hair. Your features were even vaguely Japanese-like.

You screamed.

You woke up in a cold sweat. You picked up your phone and immediately turned the flashlight on inspecting yourself. You were still yourself. You lay back in bed.

"It was probably those stupid comments that Damon made that gave me nightmares. Nothing weird is going on." you said to yourself.

You fell back asleep.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: That night

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Thankfully, you were able to get back to sleep and have normal dreams. Still, that nightmare was there, like it was in the corner of your mind. With that, it wasn't too surprising that when you woke up, you were groggy as heck. Inspecting yourself over lightly while you were in the shower, you could still feel smooth skin. Even your armpits seemed like they had less hair.

"I'm just overthinking it," you said, just focusing on washing yourself, though the slightly bushier hair wasn't helping much. It wasn't that long, barely enough to cover your ears, but it was longer than you ever had it before.

Anyway, you went back after getting dressed up, having breakfast as you always did. You were pretty much scheduled to work every weekday, and yesterday was Monday. Boy, you hoped you could get used to this.

"Looking a little tired there, maid," smirked Damon.

"Shut up," you snapped back. Seriously, if only Damon could have an experience like this. That would show him.

Anyway, things went normally from there. Granted, your siblings were like opposites. While Damon kind of got on your case about it, Erin was kind of happy. She thought it was cute. While being called cute was hardly a compliment you'd like, it was better than Damon's snarkiness.

"Well...gotta go," you said, grabbing your stuff.

"Bye!" Erin cheerily waved good bye.

With that, you left with your mom to head to the cafe, same route as yesterday. You didn't speak with your mom much, as if much needed to be said right now. You of course did say good bye upon being left off, before walking inside.

"Hello," you said as you entered the now familiar cafe.

"Ah, Kon'nichiwa!" It was Aiko who was the first to see you this time, though she blushed a bit when she realized what she said. "Sorry, I tend to go back to my native tongue when I get excited. I'm glad to see you again."

Honestly, it was kind of cute when she spoke naturally. This was a Japanese cafe after all.

"It's fine," you smiled as you grabbed the same apron as yesterday. "Say, could you show me some words sometime?"

"I'd be delighted!" Aiko giggled, curtsying a bit which got you laughing too.

Well, at least there was someone you could call a friend.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The next morning

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You started the day off with sweeping, but the cafe got very busy very fast and Ruki approached you.

"Chris, can you help out in the kitchen setting up the trays?" she asked.

"Of course." you said and went to the kitchen. Even the kitchen staff was mostly made up of girls of Japanese descent.

You quickly got to work helping arrange the trays with the various food items and drinks that the cafe served and left them for the maids to deliver to the patrons. You found that the job got progressively easier as you continued, and soon you were arranging faster then they could prepare the food.

"Dang! You're a quick study!" Ruki remarked as she checked in on your progress.

You beamed with pride. That continued until your lunch and you went out with Aiko again, and over lunch she attempts to teach you some conversational Japanese.

"This is one I use at the restaurant a lot. Some of the customers like it when you use actual Japanese." Aiko started. "Go chūmon wa okimaridesu ka?"

"Go... chumon wa okimaridesu ka?" you repeated. "What does it mean?"

"Are you ready to order?" Aiko replied.

"Go chūmon wa okimaridesu ka..." you repeated again, saying it better.

"Hey, that was pretty good, though you have a bit of an accent." Aiko joked.

"That's not that hard. Maybe I'll be able to understand anime without subtitles soon." you laughed.

You noticed that your hands seemed... smaller. Though maybe it was just a trick of the large cup you were drinking from. Your fingernails also seemed slightly longer, but it wasn't that noticeable.

You finished lunch and headed back to work.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tuesday work

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Getting back to the restaurant meant a return to what you were doing before, as in more sweeping and cleaning the lobby as well as arranging trays when it got too busy. It was definitely busier than it was yesterday, so you were kept busy.

Still, it seemed like a lot more people were becoming impressed with how quickly you were picking things up comparatively speaking. That honestly made you happy, giving you a sense of pride. The place was quickly becoming one you could be comfortable with, though you were still adjusting and all. In any case, during one instance, you were handing one tray off to another girl with twin ponytails, though she nearly tripped. Thankfully, you were there to help her stay upright.

"Arigatōgozaimashita!" she smiled gratefully after breathing a sigh of relief. Judging by her nametag, you could see her name was Sayaka. "Watashi wa chotto bukiyōda"

You weren't entirely sure what she said, but something in your head told you that she was thanking you and telling that she's a little clumsy. Oh well, there was no problem with that.

"Mondainai" you just replied with a smile.

The response just sent Sayaka giggling as she left to take the order out, while you were left confused. All you meant to say was that it was no problem, but it came out in Japanese? Did you pick up on something from being around the girls all that much? You spoke a few words to yourself just to see.

"Nothing..strange here," you spoke normally.

Huh...well, it wasn't a bad thing at least. Being at a Japanese cafe, you were probably bound to pick up on a word or two. Most of the girls were pretty fluent in both languages, so it wasn't that big a deal.

"Hey thanks for helping with Sayaka," Aiko smiled as she was apparently next to get a tray from you. "She actually hasn't been here that long either. She lived in Japan until very recently."

Ah, so she's kind of new as well? You could sympathize with the thought of being new. Well, she seemed pretty nice at least. Anyway, you nodded at Aiko's words, continuing to do work with the trays. Granted, you didn't get that good a look, but that small feeling from your hands continued on, almost like a very dainty feeling. Heck, your arms as a whole seemed to be feeling a little soft and dainty. Your nails were actually getting a little more longer as well, though you didn't pay attention to that much.

But in any case, time flew by, as it was once again time to head home.

"See you tomorrow!" Aiko giggled as she waved you good bye.

You waved as well as you left, heading back to your mom's car. This was getting kind of fun.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You got home and prepared for another session of Damon making fun of you. You sat down on the couch, next to Erin, who was watching cartoons, as you waited for dinner.

"How was work?" she asked.

"Pretty good. Really busy though. I'm beat." you replied, slumping down.

"You want to watch something?" Erin asked. "There's nothing good on the channels I like."

"Thanks." you said as she handed you the remote.

You could swear that your hands looked smaller, even compared to Erin's hands they weren't as large as they usually were compared to them. You flipped the channels until you settled on a channel that showed anime. Ironically enough an anime about a maid cafe was currently on. You settled in to watch it. After a few minutes, Erin piped up.

"So, is this what work is like?" she asked.

"Oh, not at all." you said. "I mean, it's similar, but there aren't any giant robots or weird monsters at the cafe."

Overall, the show wasn't all that bad. You managed to watch a few more episodes before dinner started.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heading home for the night

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After those episodes, your mom eventually called you all for dinner. Your mom was making one of your favorite dinners, so you were looking forward to that. Granted, Damon's heckling was not something you were excited for.

"So what's you do this time?" he smirked.

"For your information, I actually helped arrange trays for the maids," you said proudly. "In fact, they said I'm a quick learner."

"That's good to know," your dad smiled. "I was worried that things might not go well at first."

"Yeah, things have been pretty smooth," you smiled. "One of the girls there, Aiko, us really nice. She's even showing me a little Japanese on the side."

"Oh, can you say any right now?!" Erin got excited.

"Um....Not right now," you said. You felt like you couldn't pronounce anything right now. "Oh well, no one learns anything in a day."

"Except your mom," your dad laughed a bit, getting a mocking look from your mom in return.

Things went typically from there. Casual conversation about other things took over for the rest of the meal. Afterwards, you decided to head straight to your room. You never mentioned the feeling with your hands. Boy did they look small, with delicate nails as well. Maybe it just had something to do with handling trays all day.

Well, that was for another day, so it was time to head to bed. Granted, your skin still kind of felt strange against your pajamas. Maybe you should get new ones sometime.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dinner

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Suddenly, you were sitting at the dinner table again. You looked around and everything seemed normal, until you looked down at your body. You were wearing the maid costume again. You tried to stand up, but you were glued to the seat. Your thrashed around and tried your damnedest to stand. Your mother looked at you concerned.

"Honey, are you okay?" she asked.

"Naze watashi wa okiru koto ga dekinai nodesu ka?" you replied, before covering your mouth. "Naze watashi wa eigo o hanasemasen ka?"

"I knew they'd get him into that dress eventually." Damon laughed. "My brother the maid!"

"Damare!" you shouted back, almost in tears, but he kept laughing.

You were finally able to stand up and you ran out of the room, as fast as you could in the heels that you were wearing, but turned when Erin started screaming. You looked back and Damon had transformed into one of the giant monsters from the anime you watched. The monster leapt at you and you blacked out.

You sat up quickly, out of breath and inhaled and exhaled deeply.

"What the hell do these dreams mean?" you asked yourself before you lay back down to try to fall asleep again.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Another strange dream

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It wasn't quite as easy getting back to sleep this time, meaning you were groggy as heck when you woke up. It was a minor miracle you could even get up on time for your shift today. Yawning, you just went through the motions, showering before anything else. It only brought back that weird sensation as you were washing your skin. It felt smooth everywhere, with nary a trace of hair. Granted, that wasn't all bad. It was kind of a hassle to begin with. Still strange though.

"Whatever..." you groaned as you eventually got out and dried up.

After that, you got ready to go, After you were dressed up, you went down to have breakfast as usual. Everyone was there of course, but you were in no mood to talk to Damon right now. Seriously, just looking at him brought back the sensation of a Japanese monster, just like the anime you had been watching. Seriously, what was that show even called? Guess you didn't look.

There wasn't much talking, as you weren't in the mood. Still, you brightened up as you got into your mom's car and she drove you down as usual. At least you could look forward to seeing Aiko and the others. They had been so good to you so far, accepting you and even praising your work. It honestly made you look forward to it.

"You look happy," your mom smiled. "These girls good friends already?"

"Well...I don't know, but they're certainly nice," you smiled. "I'm glad that they like me being there."

"That's wonderful," your mom was happy to hear. "I hope it gets better for you."

Eventually, she dropped you off, and you walked inside as usual. It seemed that it was never too busy at the times you arrived, which was nice since it gave you time to get adjusted. As you walked in and grabbed your apron as usual, Aiko walked by, her smile still present.

"Kon'nichiwa!" she giggled.

"Kon'nichiwa" you spoke back almost immediately. Aiko's eyes widened a bit, though yours did too.

"Wow, that was perfect," Aiko smiled, clapping her hands a bit. "Still need to work on the accent a bit, but the enunciation was perfect."

"Well...thank you," you smiled. Eh, who cares what happened. You were just glad that you got something down.

At that moment though, a strand of hair fell into your face again. This had been becoming more common of late. Groaning, you tucked it away again, laying one hand on your head. It felt...longer now. Getting a nearby reflection, it looked like your hair had grown enough to cover your ears now, nearing chin-length. The strands even seemed straighter, and even darker. Your hair was light brown to begin with, but now it seemed like a darker brown.

"Something wrong?" Aiko asked.

"Yeah...my hair's been kind of annoying of late," you groaned.

"Well, that's perfect timing then," you both turned to see Ruki approaching, a smile on her face and her hands behind her back. "You've done a great job so far, so I'm here to hand you something new."

With that, she giggled as she pulled out something from behind her back. It was a white headdress, just like the other girls had. Honestly, you were kind of curious as to why, but then again, it was the uniform here. You were a boy, but perhaps you did have to abide by some rules, like with the apron. Aiko was happy to help though, since you had no idea how to work it. Eventually, she got it comfortably on your head, even keeping your hair in order.

"There. Like it?" she asked.

Well, you weren't sure, but at least it fit. You looked bizarre with it to be honest, but how could you say that to Aiko? She was so helpful with it, and Ruki seemed proud too.

"It's perfect," you smiled, getting equal smiles from the girls.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The next day

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Anyway, the reason I gave it to you, aside from reigning in that hair, is because you're going to be out on the floor more, so you have to look the part." Ruki said.

"That's fair." you reasoned.

"I'll also need you to be on hand to help the girls carry stuff to tables when we're busy. There's only so many of them and some customers order a lot." Ruki said.

"I'll do my best." you said.

It seemed as if this place was busier every day, but I guess that was good since it ensured your continued employment. It was strenuous, but it got progressively easier, and no one seemed to stare at your headpiece. though you guess that you can't be the weirdest looking person to ever have been in there. You helped out a lot of the girls, but you definitely gravitated to helping Aiko whenever you could. Just being around her made you feel better, and after last night, you needed it.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Some new work today

choices: You and Aiko talk over lunch
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Dōzo omeshiagarikudasai!" Aiko told a table of customers, telling them to enjoy their meal. They definitely seemed to be the sort of people who enjoyed this kind of thing, judging by the smiles they gave her.

"How do you deal with all this?" you said with an exasperated smile.

"Oh you get used to it," Aiko smiled, grabbing a tray for herself and handing one to you. "I'd had a bit of practice anyway."

In any case, you continued to help with whatever was needed. When things slowed for a bit, you helped with cleaning the lobby, sweeping the floors and rubbing down any tables that needed it. You liked to think that you were getting pretty good at it by now. Whenever things got a little busy, you put that down and helped to bring food out. You pretty much left all the conversing to Aiko and the girls of course. Not like you were ever going to get involved in that.

Although, as time went on, you began to wonder something. As a boy going through puberty, you were at 5'6" or so, just a little above average. However, the more time you spent around Aiko, the more it felt like you two were even or something. Aiko was definitely around 5'2" or around there, so it was kind of confusing to see her eyes just about even with your own. In fact, there was just a feeling in you that you were a bit smaller. Even your clothes just seemed a bit baggier. Not nearly enough for anyone to notice though.

Eventually, lunch break came around. However, as you were able to go to the take-out place as usual, Aiko stopped you.

"Actually...I wanted to formally welcome you here," she smiled, pulling you back to where the maids actually had a break room.

It was decently-spaced, filled with anime looking stuff as one person might expect from this kind of place. There was even a TV where you could watch stuff, which seemed to have some good channels. Still though, you were kind of confused as to what Aiko was implying.

"What's going on?" you asked.

"Oh no, nothing bad," Aiko raised her hands up to relay that point. "It's just that...I usually bring a lunch most of the time, and I actually wanted to share some with you. I made enough for two and I think you'll like it."

Wow, a girl that could be that thoughtful for you. You couldn't help but blush at her generosity. Besides, it was true that you never had Japanese food before, and it would be worth not spending money on take-out lunch every day. With that, you nodded and agreed to her request, making her giggle with delight. She ran over to a locker where she kept her stuff, soon pulling out some bento boxes.

"Here, this one is yours," she offered.

"Thank you," you smiled back, taking a seat next to her in the break room.

Of course, the box had all the typical stuff you would expect of a Japanese lunch, with even chopsticks to go with them. Yeah...this was going to take getting used to. Good news was that you had a great teacher to help you.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You started looking over the food and got to talking, as per usual. However, Aiko noticed you struggling with the chopsticks.

"Here, try holding them like me." Aiko said, demonstrating.

You tried to imitate, but kept falling flat.

"Got a fork?" you asked, jokingly.

"Come on, you can do it. Try again." she said.

You did, and you got the hang of it.

"Hey, I did it!" you exclaimed.

"Yoku yatta!" she exclaimed. You looked at her confusedly. "Good job."

"Ah." you said and started to use the chopsticks more and more fluently.

"So," Aiko started. "What are you going to spend your first paycheck on?"

You hadn't even thought about that. What would you buy with it?

"Probably a video game or clothes or something boring like that." you said.

"My first paycheck went straight into my cosplay budget." Aiko said.

"You cosplay?"

"You don't think I only dress up here, do you? I've been to every anime convention in the area. Make my own costumes too. It's super fun, you should come to one."

"I've always wanted to go to conventions, but I've never had anyone to go with."

"Well now you have me, so we should do that one day. I can make you a costume and everything!"

Wow. She's really done a good job of welcoming you to the cafe. Screw what Damon thinks, this job is awesome!
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: You and Aiko talk over lunch

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After lunch, the rest of the day went fairly normally. You just spent it doing whatever you could to help.

Actually, that's how things went for the next couple of days. Your duties didn't change at all, so you just kept doing the same thing, not that you minded. You hadn't had any major dreams either so things were rather peaceful for a while. Aiko was by far your best support, though you had begun to develop friendships with Ruki, Sayaka, and some of the other girls.

Funny enough, by the time Friday came, they almost felt like a 2nd family.

****Friday****

Just like that, Friday had come, which was also payday according to Aiko. You were quite curious to get a check for the first time in your life. You weren't entirely sure how much the job paid to be honest, but that hadn't been a major concern when you were looking for a first job. In any case, you got to work, as typical as possible. You went and got your apron and headpiece as usual.

"Kon'nichiwa" you smiled at Aiko, who was just coming around.

"Kon'nichiwa," she smiled back. "You sound great now. I couldn't do it any better."

"That's flattering," you smiled.

In any case, work started up as usual. The lobby was about as busy as it had gotten when you got the headpiece, so you kind of knew what to expect. A certain sense of routine had been growing with you here. You always greeted the girls as you saw them, and they all giggled when you said hi in Japanese, getting gentle replies in return. Even Ruki liked your progress there.

"I wonder when she'll have more work for me," you smirked as you had lunch with Aiko again. Boy, you weren't sure if she made this or her parents, whoever it was was a great cook.

"Probably next week," Aiko giggled.

At that mention, Ruki came right around to the break room, confusing you for a second before she offered envelopes to both you and Aiko. She said a quick congrats before returning to her work.

"Ah, payday at last," Aiko smiled.

"Ah, of course," you smiled, opening it to get your check. "Oh, that's pretty good for a place like this."

"Yeah. You ever thought about my offer?" Aiko smiled.

"A little bit," you smiled back. "It would be fun if we could."

"Sugureta!" she exclaimed. However, right afterwards, she got a little shy. "Say...if it's alright...would you like to come over to my house after work today? My parents are going out so....I could show you around. We could talk about all sorts of things."

You almost spat your drink out at that. A girl offering to take you to her house? Boy, that was quite the advancement. Your friendship must have been even better than you thought it was.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Skip to payday?

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was very forward of her but, you didn't see her outside of work and hey, maybe this could evolve into something else. You quickly accepted and texted your mom to tell her that you'd find your own way home and that you'd be a little late because you were hanging out with Aiko. She naturally was completely on board with it.

Work ended and you hung around a bit while Aiko finished her work. While you did, you inspected your nails, which were definitely longer than they had been that morning. Eventually the two of you left for her house, coming to a house that looked fairly normal. Your noticing of that must have been a little bit unsubtler than you thought because Aiko giggled.

"You didn't think I lived in one of those traditional houses, did you? In the middle of L.A? You've been watching too much anime." she laughed and you laughed along with her.

You went inside and the house was pretty normal looking, though there was a lot of Japanese decor. Aiko even had a shoes at the door policy, so you walked around in your socks as she led you to her room.

"Here it is. It's not much but..." she opened her closet to reveal several cosplays from various Japanese shows and animes that you recognized.

"Wow." you said, your mouth agape. "This is so cool!"

"You know, there's a convention coming up in a month or so. Tickets are still on sale, if you're interested."

"I dunno, I don't have a costume."

"Don't worry, you can borrow one of mine, I think this one might fit." she pulled what looked like a Sailor Moon costume out of the closet.

"Very funny." you said.

"It was worth a shot... and for what it's worth I think you'd look cute in it." she said.

You mused on what fun Damon would have with that if he had heard it.

"Anyway..." you tried to move the conversation away,
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Considering her offer

choices: Your mom brings your stuff over
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"So...how long have you lived here?" you asked, casually going about her room and trying not to touch anything that might offend her.

"Since I was 8," Aiko smiled. "I used to live in Tokyo. In fact, most of my family still lives there."

"Oh, that's nice," you said. "You visit them?"

"Of course," Aiko smiled again. "We try to visit at least once a year."

Aiko then began to go into some little details about her family, though it wasn't much. They were fairly ordinary for a Japanese family, nothing too strange or anything. Still, just knowing that much meant a lot to you. You had never had a relationship this strong with a girl before. It felt really nice. It was like she truly trusted you. In a way, it was almost like you had known her longer than a week. No idea why though.

"How about you? What's your family like?" Aiko smiled, dangling her legs over her bed. She actually patted the spot next to her, prompting her to sit with her. You hesitated for a sec, but then took her up on it.

"Oh, nothing special. My mom and dad work in the same business office. Supposedly, they came from Chicago originally," you said. "I have a big brother named Damon. He's not a bad guy, but he gets on my case a lot. And then there's my little sister Erin. She's pretty nice and likes cute things."

"I might get along with her," Aiko giggled before looking back at you. "Your brother likes to pick on you?"

"Oh yeah, and definitely since I got this job," you snickered. "In fact, a few nights ago, I had this strange dream where he turned into a big Japanese monster like I saw on an anime."

Aiko just flat out laughed at that, more than you ever heard her before. However, it was such a soothing laugh, like an angel. Sheesh, you being dramatic? Who would have thought?

"I can somehow imagine that," Aiko got up from her spot and did a monstrous pose. "Like this? Roar!"

She looked so silly, and you just laughed which got her laughing too.

"Yeah, pretty much!" you laughed. "And I was like the struggling damsel."

"That sounds funny!" Aiko giggled again, swaying on her feet again. However, her tone went down a bit after she looked outside and saw the sunset. "Say Chris...would you like to stay over tonight?"

You stopped at that. Woah! A sleepover? Where did that come from?

"You mean tonight?" you asked. Aiko nodded a bit.

"Y-Yeah..." she nodded, blushing and smiling a bit. "Sorry if it's sudden...but my parents are actually celebrating their anniversary tonight, so they're spending the night out. I..don't really have anyone else to talk to..."

Well...you honestly didn't want to turn her down. You asked for a minute to call your mom, explaining the situation. To your surprise, she seemed to have no problems with the arrangement. She said she'd bring stuff over for you once you told her when Aiko lived.

"Okay, I'm staying for the night!" you said to Aiko.

Aiko immediately jumped for joy, crying out words in Japanese before giving you a big hug. Boy...you could get used to this.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Hanging out with Aiko

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Eventually your mom showed up at the door with a duffel bag. You opened it to make sure everything was there and saw something odd on top. A new pair of pajamas. It was a button shirt with pants, both colored a powder blue and made of something that looked to be a softer material than your old ones. You looked at your mom quizzically.

"I was going to give you those when you got home. I know about the problems you've been having with your old ones." she said.

"How did you..." you started.

"A mother always knows." she said.

"Thanks." you said.

"No problem. Have fun tonight." she said, before hugging you and kissing you on the head. She didn't seem at all concerned about your longer hair.

"I will." you said.

Your mother left and you went back to Aiko's room. While you were gone, she had changed out of her clothes and into her pajamas, a nightgown with a floral design. You went into the bathroom and did the same, changing into your new pajamas. They were nice, though they looked almost like they were cut for a girl. You shrugged it off, since they were a gift from your mom, and you went back to Aiko's room.

"Perfect! Now the sleepover can begin!" Aiko exclaimed, grabbing your hand.

She looked down at your hand and dragged you to her bed.

"Your nails look terrible." she said. "So ragged... I've got just the thing."

She ran to her vanity and picked up a nail file. She sat back down and started filing your nails. You started to pull your hand away.

"What's wrong?" Aiko asked.

"Well, you know..." you motioned towards the nail file.

"Oh, come on, I'm just buffing out the rough edges. It'll make them look normal, trust me."

You did trust her and let her continue. In the end, she was right. Your nails, while still longer than usual, looked much better once she had filed and shaped them.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your mom brings your stuff over

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Oh wow...thank you," you smiled as you looked at your nails. Boy, they actually looked nice, especially with your smaller hands. "They actually do look better."

"Of course," Aiko giggled before going back to her vanity. She seemed to pick up an extra file. "Here, I have an extra. Now you can do it yourself."

You blushed a bit but accepted the little gift. No reason for you to turn her gift down. You stowed it away in the duffel bag along with most of the other things and looked back at Aiko. You know, Aiko always had her hair in a ponytail at work, so this was your first time seeing her with her hair down. Wow, she had long pretty hair. Made her look even cuter than she did before.

In any case, she had a few leftovers that you guys could use for dinner, which actually was some leftover pizza. Again, you must have been as unsubtle as a jackhammer because she immediately dissected your reaction as expecting something Japanese. She called you a silly goose for that, even giving you a light slap to your shoulder, and you put your hands up in mock surrender, getting a laugh out of both of you.

"Hey, don't blame me. Everything else in there looked traditional enough," you laughed as you ate.

"It's nothing. I pretty much got the same thing when I had a sleepover with a friend a long time ago," she smiled. "Still, in any case, this has been rather fun. I like get-togethers like this."

"Me too," you smiled. "I'm kind of introverted a little bit, so I've never had too much of this. Still, I like this a lot."

"Cool," Aiko smiled.

From there, you didn't do anything too special. You both got into the family room to watch a little anime. It was fun actually getting to watch anime with someone else who shared your interests for once. Funny enough though, it felt as if you could pick out certain words in the character's dialogue and remember what it meant, almost like it was instinctual. You didn't think much of it though. Being with Aiko and the others had taught you a great deal about Japanese so there was nothing weird there. Still, you did notice that, sitting next to Aiko, you did look to be a similar size to her height-wise.

Eh, it's probably nothing. It's been a long day after all. Anyway, as you both watched, you just had some casual talk over certain things, especially stuff you were watching and all. In fact, it was that same anime that had the maids and monsters from before. You really wished you could get the name of it. Oh well.

"Well...time to head to bed," Aiko stretched a bit as she got off the sofa. "We can sleep on the floor in my room. It's actually pretty comfortable."

You accepted what she said, going back up to her room with her. You brushed your teeth and did everything you typically did, though you were a bit nicer for her sake. After making sure everything was good, you got back into her room to see her arranging a futon. That made sense honestly, as it was something big enough for two at least.

"This should be fun," you smiled as you sat next to her on it.

"Absolutely," she smiled as she went and turned the lights off before returning. "Really Chris, thanks a bunch for spending the night. It's been so much fun."

"I concur." you agreed, laying down on your pillow.

With a yawn, Aiko settled in. "Oyasumi," she said as she wished you good night.

You replied in kind, settling in next to her. You could see a bit of her face through the leaked in moonlight. Boy, she was pretty. Sure, most Japanese girls were pretty, but Aiko was really pretty. Okay mister, it was probably enough of that for now. You turned a bit and fell asleep, wondering what could be next.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The sleepover continues

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
This time you found yourself on the show floor of a convention center, an anime convention, or at least what you thought one was like, since you haven't ever been to one. You looked around seeing booths and displays from a bunch of anime that you had heard of/seen. You turned to see Aiko, who was dressed in a cosplay that you recognized as being from Madoka Magica. You think she was Homura, though you didn't consider it long as you saw a flash and someone took a picture of you. You looked down at yourself and saw that you were wearing a costume as well. It was that costume that Aiko had pulled out of her closet earlier, a Sailor Moon cosplay, complete with the tied hair hanging from your head.

"Nantekotta i?" (What the hell?) you asked.

"You look so great, Chris!" Aiko said as she posed for a picture.

You involuntarily found yourself posing as well. You looked around at everyone taking photos. It felt nice to be admired. You weren't all that scared anymore, in fact, you kind of liked it.

"Aiko, kore wa hontōni tanoshīdesu!" Aiko, this is really fun! you said.

This time you didn't wake up in a cold sweat. You awoke peacefully and saw Aiko next to you. Something about being near her made everything better. You fell back asleep.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Another dream that night

choices: Your clothes seemed a little different
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Eventually, the sun began to creak in through the windows of Aiko's room. Your eyes slowly opened, yawning a bit as you slowly got up. While you were always a little groggy in the morning, the peaceful sensation you had last night did help a lot.

"Good morning...." you began to say.

However, when you turned to your right, Aiko wasn't there anymore. You raised in eyebrow in confusion. Was she already up? Your question was quickly answered when Aiko suddenly walked back into the room, wearing typical clothing for an average day.

"Ohayōgozaimasu,"(Good morning) Aiko smiled as she walked in. "You looked so comfy that I didn't want to wake you up."

Ah, well that explained a lot. It was kind of nice of her to let you sleep in a bit. You often had somebody waking you up at home, be it either your siblings or parents. Speaking of which....

"Well thank you," you smiled as you got up. "Your parents come home yet?"

"No, they'll be back later. There are some things they want to do," Aiko said. "But that's fine with me. I like having some time to myself."

"As do it," you smiled back.

"Anyway, I got a little breakfast done. Come on," she waved you over.

You both went down into the kitchen, where Aiko apparently knew how to make waffles. Boy, they looked delicious. Waffles were always a big favorite for you when it came to breakfast.

"Thanks a bunch," you smiled. "You're a pretty good cook."

"Thanks," Aiko blushed but smiled brightly. "I often have to make something for myself, especially when my parents are busy."

You both made some small talk before finishing up the meal. Once you were done, you asked if it was alright for you to take a shower here. Aiko didn't mind at all. In fact, she insisted you use her shower, rather than using her parent's one. You weren't sure about using her stuff, but she said she was okay with it. So, with her blessing, you went in to her bathroom and stripped down. It was a pretty cute bathroom all things considered. Her shampoo and soap both smelled really nice.

"She's got good taste," you smiled before going in and showering.

Honestly, it was probably the most peaceful shower you ever had. No one was going to bug you, and the scents were super relaxing. Perhaps you could ask your mom to get you something like this, though the others would probably laugh. The soap had a nice flower scent while the shampoo for your hair smelled like strawberries. Really nice combo there. Aiko actually had a few selections around.

"Guess she likes to try a variety," you smiled as you eventually turned the shower off.

Grabbing a towel, you began to dry yourself off before going over to the duffel bag you brought into the bathroom with you. Once you were dry enough, you opened the zipper to look inside. Though...it wasn't entirely what you were expecting.

"Huh?" you said to yourself.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The next morning

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You pulled out your clothes, and while the underwear and socks were normal enough, the shirt and pants were a bit... off. The pants were in fact a pair of jean shorts, which, while you did own a pair of jean shorts, these seemed a little tighter than the ones you own. Then again maybe they shrunk in the wash or something. And the shirt, well, that was weird. It was a striped tank top, which you also owned, but the neckline seemed a little low. That could also have happened in the wash, so you shrugged it off. You got dressed and walked out, seeing that Aiko was waiting in your room.

"I gotta say, that was the best shower I've ever taken. With two siblings, showering isn't always relaxing." you said.

"I wouldn't know, I'm an only child. But that just means my parents spoil me." Aiko laughed.

"So, what were you planning to do today?" you asked.

"I'm not sure, though I was considering going shopping. I don't have anyone to go with me, though." she pouted.

You knew where this was going. Having a sister meant that you knew exactly what that pout meant.

"Do you want me to tag along?" you asked.

"Would you?" she exclaimed. "It would be boring to go all alone..."

What do you say?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your clothes seemed a little different

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Well, you didn't have much else to do okay. Obviously there was no work today, and no school either. You weren't aware of any plans your family had today. It was likely just a normal day overall. What did you have to lose anyway?

"Sure, I'll come," you smiled, getting a bigger one from Aiko.

"That's great!" she smiled and clapped a bit before looking at the clock. "It's already 11:00. I think now would be a good time. The mall is not too far on foot from here."

You nodded in agreement before you both went to grab what things you needed. The tighter jean shorts certainly stood out as you walked. It felt like they even showed a little more leg than usual. Still, it didn't feel too bad, not even the lower neckline on the tank top. Granted, a tank top wasn't what you normally wore outside of your house, but you didn't see the problem right now.

So, after grabbing your wallet and anything else you needed, you met Aiko downstairs. Immediately, you both left the house, beginning the walk towards the mall.

"You wall there often?" you ask.

"Enough to know the way," Aiko smiled. "Sometimes I go there to actually buy something, but other times it's just to get away. There's plenty there to do and just hang out."

"Agreed...though I've never spent much time there myself," you shrugged. "Usually I'm only there because mom dragged me there for a reason."

"Well now you have me," giggled Aiko, getting a friendly shove from her.

The walk to the mall was rather pleasant. The weather was honestly perfect, not too hot or cold. It was just the time for a walk. It wasn't something you did often, but it was good to get some exercise.

Eventually, the large mall came into view. You and Aiko walked across the last street to make your way over, before going into the large complex at last.

"All right, so what would you like to do?" you asked curiously.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Go shopping with Aiko

choices: Let Aiko pick something out for you
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I was thinking that I'd check out some clothing stores. There's this dress that I've had my eye on for a couple of weeks." Aiko said. "Who knows, maybe you'll find something you like there."

She led you to a department store and you milled around while Aiko went through the racks, looking for the dress as you just looked around. You strolled over to the Mens department as she looked and looked at shirts, all the while brushing hair out of your face until you heard a very distinctive Japanese exclamation.

"Saigo ni!" (Finally!) Aiko shouted.

You strolled back over to her, seeing her holding the dress she was looking for, which had a floral design, vaguely similar to cherry blossoms.

"I found it." she said. "I'm going to go try it on."

"All right, I'll be over by the guy stuff." you said as she happily skipped away.

You walked back over and a few minutes later you saw her wave from the dressing rooms. She had stepped out and you walked over to see her, looking very pretty in the dress.

"How do I look?" she asked.

"..." you felt as if your jaw was dropped and quickly regained your composure. "You look great!"

"Thanks!" she said. "Lemme change back."

She walked back in and changed back to her clothes and held the dress over her shoulder. She walked back up to you and inspected you.

"You okay?" she asked.

"Yeah, it's just my hair. It keeps getting in the way." you said, brushing it.

"I can fix that." she said and took a hair tie off of her wrist and motioned for you to turn around.

She expertly tied your hair back in a low ponytail.

"Wow, thanks." you said.

"No prob. Say, since you were so patient waiting for me, let me pick out something for you." Aiko said.

"..." you mused over the decision.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Where Aiko wants to go

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Well....okay if you insist," you sighed a bit, to which Aiko just giggled.

"Got it!" she smiled as she left her dress on a bench right next to you. "Look after that for me would you?"

You casually agreed as she left, once again exploring. You could only wonder what she would pick out for you. Not that you've ever experienced a girl wanting to pick something out for you, other than your mom of course.

In any case, while you had the time to yourself, you felt your newly tied hair a bit. It had gone down to your chin a while ago, but now it seemed even longer, to your shoulders at least. Any curls you might have had seemed to be gone as well, leaving your hair straighter. The shade of color was the same dark drown as before, but you couldn't help but wonder if there were black strands in there somewhere. Well, hair changing color as you got older was something your dad said happened sometimes. Perhaps that was just what you were going through.

Well, at least Aiko actually kind of liked your hair as it was. Maybe you'd keep it if you felt like it.

"Chris!" Aiko suddenly cried out, waving you over.

Grabbing her dress neatly, you began to walk over to where Aiko was. She was standing near some accessories. Obviously it wasn't super expansive ones, but they were simple and quite girlish. What she seemed to be holding though was a sort of bracelet that, much like her dress, had a bit of a cherry blossom motif to it.

"Isn't it cute?" she smiled. "I couldn't believe my eyes as well when I saw it. My dress and your bracelet could match.

Thinking about it, it was kind of cute, though you weren't sure if you should get it. Still, you at least allowed her to try the bracelet on you. She slipped it on to your left wrist, letting it glimmer against the light a bit. Wow, it was kind of cute, and it fit you perfectly honestly. The cherry blossom theme really made it stand out.

"You know, I like it," you smiled. "Let's get it."

"Great! Arigatōgozaimashita!" (Thank you!) she smiled gratefully.

With that, the two of you bought your purchases, with you donning the little bracelet once it was paid for. Honestly, it really did look nice on you, though it was probably because of how thin and delicate your arms looked by now, kind of like Aiko's to be honest. Still, it was a gift from her basically, so you'd always treasure it.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Let Aiko pick something out for you

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You started walking to another department when you noticed that your shoes were a little loose. You checked the laces, which were fine, but the inside felt loose. You must have worn down the inside.

"Aiko, you mind if we check out the shoe section? I might need to get some new shoes." you said.

"Ooh! That's a great idea!" she exclaimed and started leading you to the appropriate section.

You set about looking for new shoes. They had to be professional, since you would use them at work, but you did have enough in your paycheck to maybe get a pair of sneakers or something casual to replace a ratty pair that was currently at home in your room in addition. You went to measure your foot, and noticed that your foot was a full size smaller.

"Aiko, does this make sense, my feet are smaller than the size in my shoe." you said.

"Some brands do sizing differently. I have a bunch of pairs of shoes that list different size that all fit the same way." Aiko said. "Though those are mostly shoes straight from Japan..."

"It's probably fine." you said.

You moved to a different section and started perusing.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: To another store department

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Granted, buying shoes was never really your forte. Your mom usually picked your shoes out, so you were kind of doing something you didn't do often. Still, surely you could figure out something as simple as shoe buying. Aiko was casually looking over some shoes herself, but she didn't seem serious about getting anything, given that she already bought a dress.

In any case, you just kept on looking, seeing what was good. Honestly, a lot of this seemed a bit girly, but you didn't have much of a choice with how small your feet were now. Still, it could be worse, and maybe you'd find something cute at least. Eventually though, your eyes landed on something. A pair of shoes that looked professional enough, although they did seem kind of different.

https://www.shoesforcrews.com/sfc3/image...

They looked rather neutral, though the little heel in the back indicated something a little more feminine. Still, you wanted to give them a try, so you grabbed a pair after finding the right size. To your delight, they were a perfect fit.

"Ah, nice," Aiko smiled. "You going to wear those to work now?"

"Yeah I'd imagine so," you nodded, slipping them off and putting them back in the box. "Though...I probably shouldn't wear these now. They're not that casual."

With that in mind, you remembered how ratty your sneakers at home were. Perhaps you should get something casual as well if the price was right. Getting back up, you started some more searching, even looking at different kinds of shoes. Eventually, you happened to wander into the sandals aisle, eyeing a white pair.

"Oh, those look cute," smiled Aiko. "Why don't you give those a go?"

Well, it couldn't hurt at least. You grabbed a pair, sitting down to slip them on. It was a weird sensation, as you never wore something like this. Your little toes could be clearly seen, with even somewhat longer nails from what you could see. A stray thought of you needing to file those sometime crept into your head before you shoved it away. You took a few practice steps, actually finding them comfortable.

"Huh...they feel pretty nice," you smiled. "I think I found some casual shoes."

"Cool choice," nodded Aiko.

The prices for the professional shoes and the sandals were well within your paycheck, so you footed the bill for both of them, giving both you and Aiko some big bags to hold from your trip so far.

"Phew, shopping is hard work," you laughed a bit. "You want to grab some lunch? Probably past noon by now."
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Finding some new footwear

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I know just the place." Aiko said.

She led you to the food court and to a small sushi restaurant.

"This place is the best, I mean, nothing beats homemade, but this is the next best thing." Aiko said.

"Sounds good." you said.

You got on line and you looked over the menu, unsure of what to get, since you'd never really had sushi before.

"What are you having?" you asked Aiko.

"Not sure yet." Aiko said, her eyes still intent on the menu.

"Well, whatever it is, I'll have what you're having." you said.

You got to the front and Aiko ordered, followed by you. You got your trays and sat down at a table.

"This was a really good idea." you said as you started eating.

"The shopping or the sushi?" Aiko asked.

"Both." you replied.

You had gotten so much better at using chopsticks. You didn't do it as expertly as Aiko yet, but you were pretty good.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Having some lunch

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Eating sushi here was pretty fun, especially with you being better with the chopsticks and all. It felt like you were getting better at a lot of things, which gave you a sense of pride to be honest.

"You come here often?" you ask.

"To this food court? Yeah," Aiko nodded. "Of course, I generally vary it up, but the sushi here is pretty good. Hopefully sometime I can show you the kind my mom makes. It's to die for." she added with a giggle.

"Well, I'll look forward to that," you smiled.

Eventually, you both finished up, the meal not really taking all that long. As you stood up again, you realized just how you looked right now, especially with how slim you looked. The tank top and shorts certainly didn't hide much, and the sandals really stood out against your feet and long legs. Seriously, even your legs felt a bit different, a bit slimmer, but still smooth as ever.

"So..." you eventually came back to reality. "Where to now?"

"Well...you want to check the arcade out?" Aiko smiled. "I figure that's enough shopping for one day. I'm in the mood for some games."

"Oh? You play games too?" you smiled, earning another slap on the shoulder.

"Of course!" Aiko giggled. "I play games all the time. I love Mario, Zelda, and all the classics and whatnot."

Well, that settled that, and you were certainly in the mood for a game or two. Granted, you were never that good at arcade games, but they were still fun none the less. No way would you turn that down, so you both grabbed your stuff and ran over to where the arcade was, which wasn't all that far away.

"You got enough?" Aiko asked as she was getting some coins for herself.

"Yeah, plenty," you nodded, getting a dollar out for some coins.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: During/After lunch

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You walked into the arcade, which was quite bustling. Almost all the games were occupied. All the rail shooters, skee ball machines, sports games, classic games, even the simulations, and most of them had a few people waiting on each machine. Even the claw machine had a line. Oddly enough, the only one not occupied, was a Dance Dance Revolution machine. You looked to Aiko, who was already rushing towards the DDR machine.

"I love DDR!" she exclaimed. "What about you?"

"I've never really played it. I was never good with hitting the step pad at the right time." you said.

"Wanna give it a try while we wait for one of the other games to open up?" Aiko asked as she stepped onto the Player 1 pad and put some coins in.
