"Why not?" you sighed and you stepped onto the Player 2 pad, placing your bags next to the game.

The game started up and Aiko, being player 1, got to pick the song, picking a Japanese song that you had heard on the speakers at work. The music started and you started to try to follow the movements. At first you were shaky, but you got the hang of it pretty quickly, almost as if your seemingly smaller feet and leaner legs were making it easier for you to perform the moves. Aiko looked over at you.

"I thought you said you weren't very good?" she asked.

"That's what I thought." you replied as you continued a streak.

Eventually, the song ended and you looked at the scores. Not only had you beaten Aiko's score, but you had got a new high score on the board. It wasn't #1, but it was in the top 10, which was still awesome. You entered your name and you hopped off the game to give other people a chance to play, though many were impressed by your skills.

"Wow! That was great!" Aiko said.

"I know, I didn't even realize I could do that!" you said.

"Wanna play something else?" Aiko asked.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Playing around in the arcade

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After your amazing feat at that game, you were honestly looking forward to something a little less physically demanding. As proud as you were of your little achievement, it was quite exhausting too. Still, you were amazed none the less. Your legs felt a lot more flexible than they did before. Perhaps all that running around in the cafe was doing you some good.

In any case, something that just opened caught your eye. It was Mario Kart.

"How about some Mario Kart?" you smiled. "I'm pretty good at that."

"So am I," smirked Aiko a bit before she ran over with you.

Both of you got into the freed-up car seats, getting your coins inside. Aiko went straight for Daisy, while you went with Rosalina, as she was a favorite of yours. For the cup selected, the simple Toad Cup was good for a warm-up race.

"You ready?" smiled Aiko.

"Of course," you smiled back.

With that, the race soon began. Granted, controls were kind of wacky compared to the console games, so it took a bit of adjusting. Still, you were having a lot of fun with it, making all the turns and using what items you could. However, Aiko seemed to have a better hang of it, possibly because she was here more often than you were, which made it no surprise when she won the race.

"I win!" she smiled, celebrating a bit.

"Okay, warm-up's over," you said. "This time I'll win."

"Try it," Aiko smirked back, before you both went in for another race.

You choose a slightly harder one this time, but you still were doing better than before. Aiko was still more experienced though, and she just knew when to make a move, getting ahead of you again to win.

"Ah, you're just too good," you conceded but smiled all the same.

"You'll get better at it. We can come here again sometime." she smiled.

"I'll look forward to it," you laughed a bit.

After that 2nd race, you both enjoyed a little Skee Ball as well as some other games. You were having the time of your life here, and you doubted your siblings would have been like this. Damon would probably spend too much time making fun of you and Erin honestly.

"Boy...that was fun," you stretched a bit as you grabbed your bags. "I'm beat from that Laser Tag."

"Good thing it was on teams though," Aiko smiled. "You and I dominated that game."

"That we did," you smiled.

With that, the two of you began to leave the arcade, more than a little satisfied with how things went.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Play another game

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You walked out of the arcade, when Aiko's phone started to ring. She picked it up and started conversing with whoever it was that called her.

"Watashi wa yūjin to shoppingumōru ni imasu!" I'm at the mall with a friend! Aiko shouted into her phone. "Anata wa totemo fukōheidesu, otōsan!" You're so unfair, Dad!

She hung up the phone angrily.

"You okay?" you asked.

"Yeah, it's just that my parents need me at home." Aiko said.

"That's fine, I probably need to get home too. I'll pick up my bag and call my mom to pick me up on the way back to your house." you said.

You walked back to Aiko's and she had you wait outside while she went in to get your bag. She said that her dad had sounded angry, and she didn't want you to see him yelling. She returned with your bag around the time that your mom showed up and you bid Aiko farewell as you loaded your bags into the car. Your mom started driving.

"Nice sandals." she said.

"Oh, uh, thanks. Aiko helped me pick them out." you said.

"Good thing too, I almost threw out that ratty pair today." she laughed. "Did you have fun with your friend?"

"Yeah." you said.

"Is she your..." she started.

"Oh... uh... I'm not sure. I mean, she's really nice and all but we haven't really done anything except hang out." you said.

"That's alright. Sometimes it takes time to find that someone. Sometimes though, it can happen faster than you realize. I mean, I can't even remember what I did before I met your father." she said.

"Ugh, mom, that old story again?" you asked.

"If it wasn't for that old story, you, your brother and your sister wouldn't be here to make fun of it." she replied.

"All I can say is that Aiko is really nice." you said.

"I'm happy that this job is turning out so well for you, honey." she said as you pulled into the driveway.

You got out of the car and walked into the house, your bags in tow. You saw Damon sitting on the couch. He glanced at you and you knew he was going to have something smart to say about it.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Time to leave

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Heh, nice shoes," he smirked.

Honestly, it didn't sound quite as condescending as he usually sounded, which caused you to raise an eyebrow. It was hardly like Damon to hold back on what he said to you.

"That it?" you asked curiously. "No smart-ass remark? Come on, there's gotta be something."

Damon just shrugged. He almost seemed indifferent. Honestly, it was more similar to how he acted around either adults or people outside the family. It was usually just his siblings that he messed with on a daily basis.

"Not really, just that it's an interesting choice on you," he said before looking at your wrist. "That Japanese girl you talk about get you that?"

"Um....yeah she did," you said as you glanced at your wrist. "She said she liked it on me."

"Well, you've always been kind of dainty to begin with," he smirked. "So it fits."

Ah, there it was. The smart-ass remark. Still, didn't seem like the usual belittling, more like just teasing. You weren't sure why, but oh well. Who really cared. You got out of it without too much of a fuss so what was there to say.

That being said, Erin seemed to gush about both your shoes and bracelet. She pretty much demanded you take her to the mall sometime too, getting a chuckle out of you and your dad. That aside, things were rather normal from there. You didn't have much to do so you went up and played some video games in your room. Perhaps you were still salty about earlier, because you spent quite a bit of time on Mario Kart, just to make sure you were still good at it.

Dinner was fairly typical, with you just giving a brief explanation of the day to your family. Your dad found it kind of nice that you went out with a girl, which made you blush heavily. Seemed like you were doing a lot of that recently. Frankly, one thing you were a bit surprised at was that no one seemed to think much of your smaller tank top and jean shorts that you wore all day. Maybe they did just shrink in the wash.

Well, once that was done, you just went up to your room, just enjoying some casual time for the night.

"Phew, what a day," you smiled all the same, just settling in and playing some games.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking with Damon

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You got undressed and prepared to put your pajamas on, but remembering that your new, comfortable pajamas were dirty. You went to your drawers and found that there were three pairs of identical pajamas in different colors, a dark red, an off-white, and purple, which was an odd choice. I guess a mother does always know.

You changed into the red pair and got into bed. You decided to take the bracelet off so it wouldn't get caught in the blanket and placed it nicely on your end-table. You closed your eyes and settled in to go to sleep.

Suddenly, you found yourself at the mall, with Erin. She was perusing a display while you stood off to a side. You turned around and came face to face with a pretty Japanese girl, wearing a similar Cherry blossom dress to the one that Aiko bought. You lifted up your hand to say hello and noticed that the girl's hand went up as well, wearing a familiar bracelet around her wrist. It was you! You stepped back and took in the sight. It was you, you could tell now, with there being telling features in the face, which was decidedly Japanese. Your hair was long and black, but styled in a ponytail. You could even swear you were wearing makeup. Your hands were dainty and manicured, but the interesting thing was that both your fingernails and toenails were polished with a light pink color. Your toenails were peeking out from a pair of open-toed heels. But the strange thing, you weren't alarmed by it like usual. You just giggled and turned back to Erin, who had found a dress and held it up to her body.

"What do you think of this?" she asked.

"Sore wa subarashī ne" (It looks great!) you replied, happily.

"You think so? You're the best." Erin said as she hugged you.

You slept pretty soundly that night.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heading to bed

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Sunday was typically a day where you got to sleep in, and you took full advantage of that, given what a week it was. Perhaps the nice dream you had had something to do with that. It was kind of strange....yet it gave you a warm feeling as well. It reminded you a lot of your shopping trip with Aiko.

In any case though, you slowly got up around the middle of the morning, not too bad for your standards. As you got up and stretched, you wondered a bit about Aiko. She seemed a bit stressed after her dad called her. Frankly, you felt like you had something to do with it, making you feel a bit guilty, the last thing you wanted was to get her in any sort of trouble.

With that in mind, as you showered, you decided not to call her, unless she called you personally or something. It probably wasn't a good idea to suddenly intrude if there was some family business. You'd let her control if she wanted to talk or not. Having settled on that though, you kind of missed her soap and shampoo though. The regular ones you had didn't seem to have the same feeling. Heck, your skin kind of felt weird with them. Perhaps your mom could help with that sometime.

In any case, following your shower, you went and grabbed some clothes. Honestly, having looked at a lot of them, many seemed a bit smaller...and kind of more form-fitting as well. Granted, with puberty happening, you did have a lot of shirts getting too small for you. Perhaps your mom was staying ahead of the game. Honestly, you wondered just how much money she spent on you. Then again, it likely hardly ever dented her paycheck.

So, you put on a casual tank top and shorts, similar to yesterday though different colors. Once you were done, you walked downstairs, grabbing a little breakfast from your mom.

"So where's Damon?" you asked.

"He went out to skateboard with some friends," your mom said.

Of course. Damon wasn't one to just sit and do nothing during a weekend. He had a circle of friends that he liked to be with. Good for you at least. You had some peace and quiet. After breakfast, you went into the family room, where Erin was just casually playing with some stuff.

"You can watch whatever," Erin smiled. "Nothing much is on."

"I'll take you up on that," you smiled as you sat down and began to find something to watch.

Yep...pretty ordinary Sunday...so far at least.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The next day

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sat on the couch and spend a few hours just vegging out during a lazy Sunday. Eventually, during a commercial, you noticed that Erin was sitting and painting her nails. At first you shrugged it off, but something started to eat at you. You turned to watch Erin, focusing on the skill and detail she used. Eventually, she noticed you watching and you quickly turned away.

"What's wrong?" she asked.

"Oh, nothing." you said. "I was just... admiring your skill."

"Alright." Erin said, turning back to her work. "Do you want to try?"

"What?" you asked, shocked, "I... uh..."

"I can teach you if you want." Erin said.

You thought for a moment. Damon was out, for the whole day probably, and your parents had gone out to lunch.

"Sure. Why not?" you asked.

"Great, let me take a look at your nails." Erin took your hand into her's. "Oh hey, your nails are very nice, do you file them?"

"Aiko did that, but I did my toes." you said, showing your toes to Erin.

"Nice!" she said. "Anyway, let's get started."

She started painting her nails to demonstrate it to you. You decided to start with your toes and Erin helped you put cotton balls in between your toes and you started painting them, using a light pink polish. You messed up a bit at first, but quickly got the hang of it, like the chopsticks and the stuff at work. Eventually, you had ten nicely painted toes, with a clear coat at Erin's insistence.

"Very pretty." Erin said.

"Yeah, they are." you said, marveling at your toes.

"Want to do your fingernails too?" she asked.

"Maybe later." you said as you waited for your toes to dry.

"Well, you can keep this, just in case you change your mind." she said, handing you the bottle of nail polish.

You went back to vegging out while you resumed watching T.V.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Something happens today

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
All in all, aside from inquiring about Erin's little hobby, it was a fairly normal day. Honestly, once your toes had dried, you actually kind of liked the look. Heck, it pretty much looked straight out of your dream.

Honestly, things did seem a little weird, what with how different you were feeling and all the dreams and such. Still...you couldn't say you felt bad about them. There was a certain warmth to them.

In any case, a little bit later, you actually did return to Erin, asking about your fingernails. Granted, given what you saw with your toes, you kind of had an idea about them, so she mostly just supervised. It did take a try or two, but by the time it was done, your nails were nicely painted with the same coat as your toes. Erin was really impressed at how good you seemed to have gotten and so quickly too.

Again, you seemed to be picking up on things faster too. Aiko and Erin had shown you a lot and you seemed to be getting the hang of this stuff. It felt kind of nice to be good at something.

"So, your new friends are Japanese right? At the cafe?" Erin asked suddenly.

"Um, yeah," you said. "What about it?"

"They teach you any Japanese?" Erin asked further. "That would be really neat if you could!"

"Erin, is this really the time?" you rolled your head, but Erin wasn't having any of it.

"Oh come on! Show me!" she cried out.

Okay, one thing about Erin. If she ever got an exciting thought, she would never let go of it, not until she was satisfied. You groaned at this fact, and just talked back at her.

"Miru? Watashi wa nihongo ga hanasemasu," (See? I can speak Japanese) you finally spoke, your eyes widening a bit at what you said. You actually weren't trying to say anything like that. Erin just covered her mouth in awe.

"That's....so...,cool!" she giggled. "My big brother can speak Japanese!"

"Um, I guess I know a bit," you scratched your head a bit, only reminded of your shoulder-length hair at that.

Well, Erin seemed to be satisfied, leaving you alone after that. Actually, that little moment with your hair made you realize something. Perhaps you could use a ponytail, just like how Aiko stylized it yesterday. You got to keep the hair tie after all. Taking a quick break, you got the tie from your room, somehow being able to put it in a low ponytail just like how Aiko did it.

"Heh....maybe sometime I can get it to a higher ponytail like she does," you smiled as you returned to the TV.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You kept watching TV and you started to absentmindedly scratch your chest. That weird feeling was back, but at least now it was localized to one spot. Your parents returned home and neither seemed to notice your polished nails. You had earlier asked your mother to pick up new soap and she came through, bringing you the same soap and shampoo that Aiko had.

"Thanks, Mom!" you said.

"It took a while to find. I ended up noticing a sign for it at that new Japanese store near the mall." Mom said.

"I appreciate it." you said.

You brought it to the bathroom and then decided to veg out in your room. You sat down and then your phone started buzzing. You picked it up, and saw that Aiko was calling you. You immediately brought the phone to your ear.

"Nē, Chris!" (Hey, Chris!) she exclaimed.

"Aiko, hey!" you replied. "Dō shita no?"(What's going on?)

You paused for a moment, shocked at your usage of the language.

"Someone's been practicing. At this rate, you'll be able to wait tables too!" Aiko giggled.

"Anyway, what's up?" you asked.

"Not much, I'm just bored." Aiko replied. "My dad's a little annoyed because I didn't tell him that you were a boy, just that I was hanging with a friend from work, and he just assumed that it would be one of the girls."

"Oh, I'm sorry." you said.

"It's not your fault." Aiko said. "What have you been up to?"

"Had a bit of a lazy day, Erin helped me paint my nails." you said.

"Aww, I bet they look super cute." Aiko said.

"They do." you said, admiring them.

"Anyway, I've gotta go, we're about to have dinner. I just wanted to see how you were and explain what happened yesterday." Aiko said.

"Awesome. See you at work tomorrow." you said.

"Mite yo!"(See ya!) Aiko said.

Does anything else happen today?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: More stuff happening

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Other than that, the rest of the day was fairly normal. You got in another look at some anime, but that was pretty much it. You know, perhaps sometime you should go online and test to see how much Japanese you knew. Might as well see some subtitles episodes to test yourself.

In any case, the rest of the day came and went. Damon eventually returned home, though surprisingly he didn't mention your nails. Granted, you didn't mention them to him so perhaps he didn't see them. It was honestly time to remove them for the day anyway.

Dinner was fairly natural, though you didn't have much to say for once. Tomorrow would be about returning to work. You kind of looked forward to it, getting to see Aiko and the other girls again. You felt like you accomplished much with them during the past week so you could only wonder what might happen next.

"Good night Chris," Erin smiled as she began to head to your room. "Seriously though, really cool what you showed today."

"No problem," you smiled back at her before she left, allowing you to head into your room.

Getting ready for bed was rather typical, though, as you looked around your room, you kind of began to wonder if it looked a little plain. Aiko's room looked vibrant compared to what you had. Maybe you could liven it up some time. Actually, as you were looking, you saw your work clothes. You had the new shoes, but you wondered about the rest. Hopefully you could work with it.

"Well....that's for another day," you sighed as you stretched a bit and went to bed.

That night...you surprisingly didn't have any weird dreams. However, around midnight, you did happen to wake up, feeling a little parched. You made your way towards the bathroom, turning the light on so you could get a cup of water. However, as you did so, a slight turn of your head blew some hair into your face. It was at that moment that you saw that your hair had grown again. It was well past your shoulders now, doing down your back in straight strands.

And speaking of those strands, they appeared to be pure black now, like the night sky. It was actually kind of pretty, kind of like the girls at the cafe. You weren't sure what to think, but you gave it a little comb over with your hands to feel it out before feeling like sleep was coming back. Perhaps you could worry about that later, once you were actually wide awake.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later/That Night

choices: Let Aiko cover it up with makeup
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You woke up from a pretty sound and relaxing sleep and started your morning routine, showering with your new soap and shampoo, which you really liked. Even a chaotic shower in your house was made better by it. You got out of the shower and went to get dressed, noticing something odd when you pulled a fresh dress shirt out of your closet.

"Are the buttons on the wrong side?" you asked yourself.

You checked all the other shirts, and no, all those buttons were on the same side as the shirt in your hands. It also seemed a bit smaller, but you were past that. You put on the shirt, and a new pair of pants, which seemed tighter and the legs seemed shorter, stopping a little bit before your ankles. You'd have to talk to mom about getting new pants.

You also brushed out your hair, which was definitely black. But it wasn't alarming, since your father's hair was black, so maybe genetics just took a while to assert themselves. You pulled it into a ponytail, and pulled it a bit higher than usual, like Aiko's. You looked into the mirror and saw something that was alarming, a huge zit on your forehead. How had you not noticed it when you were in the shower? You tried to use your hair to cover it, but no dice, it was noticeable. But you couldn't worry about it, you were going to be late if you stood around trying to get rid of it.

You put on socks, and your new shoes and headed out for work. During the car ride you mentioned your pants, and your mom said that maybe she'd pick some stuff up for you. You went into work and came face to face with Aiko as soon as you walked in.

"Seinaru ushi!"(Holy cow!) she exclaimed. "Chris! Your forehead!"

"I know." you said. "I don't know how it happened."

"Well, it's natural but... I think I can cover it up." she said.

"You can?" you asked.

"Yeah, with some makeup. Concealer, foundation, it'll still be there, but no one will notice it." she said.

You thought about it for a second.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The very next morning

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Well, it couldn't be that bad. It honestly wouldn't be the first time. Your mom put some make-up on you once, just to clean you up a bit for a family photo a few months ago.

"Okay, let's do it," you nodded.

Aiko smiled and nodded back, motioning for you to follow her back into the break room, where she proceeded to grab her purse and grab a little make-up kit out of it.

"I don't use a lot myself," she smiled. "Just enough to clean up usually. I've never really been the type to go all out if you can believe it."

"I can," you smiled, getting a bit of a teasing look from Aiko.

Anyway, she proceeded to use some of her foundation and concealer on you, though you didn't get much of a chance to learn about it. You guys did kind of have to rush with work starting soon and all. Still, it didn't take Aiko long before she was satisfied.

"Good, can't see a thing," she smiled. "Just let it settle there and don't touch it."

"Thanks," you smiled, looking in a little hand mirror Aiko had just to make sure. "Perhaps I should get some of my own sometime, just in case."

"Maybe we can get some the next time we go shopping," Aiko smiled. "You hear of the new Japanese store next to the mall?"

"Yeah, my mom actually got me some stuff from there," you said. "She got me some of that shampoo you use. It really helps."

"Oh? Well, that's good," she smiled. "No wonder your skin looks as smooth as mine."

She giggled at that, while you smiled. Well, your work here was done. It was time to get to work once again. Before long, you and her were back on the floor.

"By the way, the new shoes look nice on you," she smiled. "You'll fit in nicely with the little heels. Maybe soon enough you'll have heels like mine," she giggled with a little tap of her high heels.

"That'll be the day," you smirked before getting to work.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Let Aiko cover it up with makeup

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Chris, just who I was looking for." Ruki said.

"What do you need?" you asked.

"A few girls called in sick today, so I'm short a few waitresses. I need you to fill in." she said.

"Me? But don't the patrons come because the maids are waiting on them?" you questioned.

"It'll be fine, it's happened before when we've had less people working." Ruki said.

"As long as you say so." you said.

And so you started waiting tables. You attempted to mimic what you saw Aiko do, in order to make it easier for the patrons to accept that you were their waiter instead of a cute girl. Most didn't seem to mind though. You even peppered in some Japanese into your vocabulary when you spoke. It was tough, you couldn't imagine running around like that in the elaborate dresses that the other girls wore. In fact, it was so busy, that waiting tables was basically all you did.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Ruki comes around

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Honestly, just trying to figure out what to say was a bit of a challenge. You were kind of social, a little bit introverted maybe, but actually waiting on customers like this was quite a step up.

Luckily, you always had some help if things seemed a bit out of control, Ruki, Aiko, Sayaka, and the other girls were more than happy to help out if you looked a little bit overwhelmed. Frankly, you were surprised by how helpful they were. You didn't see this kind of thing at other fast-food places and such.

"Wow...everyone's really helpful," you smiled at Aiko as you were getting back from a table.

"It's kind of like a family away from home," Aiko smiled. "So yeah, you're part of that family too now."

You smiled and blushed a bit at that, feeling a sense of pride. That give you some motivation to keep on going. Can't exactly let these girls down now could you? On another note though, you did take note of how your clothes felt as you were working. The slimmer shirt was one thing, but the shorter pants definitely felt kind of off. At least the shoes you paid for were actually doing their part, though you kind of blushed at how they had a little clacking to them, not totally different from the girls high heels. Well, at least it perhaps helped you to fit in.

"I'll need to get better pants," you sighed as you had lunch with Aiko. She was nice enough to bring you one again. You really needed to learn to make this yourself. "They just feel strange like this."

"Honestly, that's why I like the dress," Aiko said as she ate. "It's pretty easy to move in and the skirt is just the right length."

"Eh...I think that sort of thing is a bit out of my league." you chuckled.

"Maybe, but who knows," Aiko said before giggling. "By the way, I like your hair. It really goes well with the hairpiece. Just like us." she said which made you smile again.

Still, as the day was going on, you couldn't help but feel a small feeling in your hips. You had grimaced a bit as the day went on, as if they had slowly pushed out or something. Looking down when you had a second, there definitely seemed to be a small curve to them, which didn't help with your small pants. Maybe you had put on some weight? That didn't sound good.

"I've got a lot of things to figure out," you said as you continued to push through.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You finished up for the day and headed home. During the car ride, your mom pulled a bag out from the back of the car.

"I got you some new pants and some other things." your mom said.

"Thanks." you said, deciding to wait until you were in your room to check out what she got you.

You got home and went into your room, pulling out the few items in the bag. The first was a pair of very thin black pants, almost like tights or something, though it had the design of belt loops a button, a fly and all that. You tried them on. They were definitely much more comfortable than the pants you were wearing and your... curves fit a lot better in them. In fact, they didn't look all that off with your shirt tucked into them. The next item was a bag, a red leather satchel. You wondered at first why your mom would get you a bag, and then realized that those new pants lacked an important feature, pockets. The bag made sense. The last item... well it just confused you. It was a black skirt, that came down to about the same length that the dresses that Aiko and the other girls wore at the cafe.

"Maybe it's for Erin?" you wondered, but a check of the size showed that it's too big for Erin, but just the right size for you. "Why would mom get me a skirt?"

You stared at it for a moment, before curiosity got the better of you, remembering what Aiko had said at work. You slipped off the pants and pulled on the skirt, posing in it a few times in front of a mirror. With your smooth legs, the skirt actually looked pretty good. You started walking around your room, pretending to wait tables, to see what it's like for Aiko and the others, and you concluded that the sensation of the skirt was pretty weird, but you supposed you could get used to it.

You placed it in your drawer along with your new pants and you transferred the contents of your pockets to the new bag.

You also took some time to examine your chest, which was irritated, no doubt from your old soap, and the new soap alleviated it, but your skin was still sort of raised in the area. It didn't look that bad, so it wasn't anything to trouble your mom about, though.

You finished up and decided to spend the rest of your time before the evening, relaxing.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heading home

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Eventually, dinner came as usual. By now, recalling the events of your day to your family had gotten pretty normal. Though, for the most part, you kind of just stayed back and let your parents talk things over with each other.

"You okay?" Erin asked you.

"Yeah, I'm fine," you said. "Just a long day."

Honestly, you couldn't help this little strange feeling. Like....for some reason....being in your work place felt a little bit more comfortable than you did now. You didn't get why, as this was your family and all, but all those Japanese girls oddly felt...comforting to you. Kind of like what Aiko said, it was like a family away from home...which kind of made you wonder.

Eh, maybe you were just being paranoid. You spent most of your weekdays there now so a sense of familiarity with them was kind of expected. Still...it did kind of make you want to get to know Aiko and the other girls a little better. You actually kind of missed the constant Japanese babbling that killed the kitchen whenever you were at work. Heck, you almost felt inclined to blurt out something in Japanese right now, but you held it in.

Even more weird, Damon hadn't been all that teasing. He smirked a little bit at times, but he never seemed to insult you much anymore. You kind of wondered why. Your mom liked to believe he was finally maturing, though that seemed kind of sudden.

Well, eventually you excused yourself and went upstairs, playing a few games and watching a show or two on your computer before deciding to hit the hay. Though, as you were putting your pajama shirt on, something else did stand out. Your chest was raw for sure, but further down it looked like you had gotten a little bit thinner. Your waist just dipped in a tiny bit, and your stomach felt just a bit flatter. It honestly confused you, feeling bigger in one place and smaller in another. You weren't sure if it was your diet or something.

"Well....I don't feel sick or anything," you shook your head as you just put your shirt and pants on, brushing your teeth as usual before going to bed.

One thing though, taking care of your long hair was certainly a bit of a chore, though you didn't feel like disliking it. There was something kind of pretty with the shade of black, kind of like the other girls. Heck, Sayaka actually came around and called your hair pretty, while Ruki really liked how it was like most of the other girls. Guess it was a hassle you could live with. Perhaps a haircut could wait.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You found yourself sitting in your room, though things were different. It was decorated quite like Aiko's with posters and vibrant colors, with a Japanese inspired design to it. You were sitting at a vanity, brushing your long black hair. You looked into the mirror and saw yourself, looking quite like you had in your earlier dream of the mall trip, though this time you were wearing light makeup. Not caked on, but still more than just concealer, you could distinctly see some mascara and lipstick on your face. You were... pretty. And you felt content.

Suddenly, the door to your room opened and Aiko, and several of the girls from work walked into your room, carrying bags. It's a sleepover, like you had had with Aiko, but with all your new friends. You felt much more comfortable as everyone set up sleeping bags and started doing sleepover activities.

"Kore wa totemo tanoshīdesu!" (This is so much fun!) you exclaimed.

"Zettai ni" (Definitely) Aiko replied.

You found yourself having the most fun you'd had at home in a while with all your new friends... your work family.


You slept soundly that night, not waking up once.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: That night

choices: She wants you to meet her family
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Again, you got up naturally but felt pretty good. These dreams, while really strange at first, were starting to become something you kind of liked. You weren't sure why but you liked them all the same.

In any case, you began to get dressed after showering. As you got dressed, you took a minute to think about the new pants and the skirt. Honestly, given that the skirt was kind of weird for right now, the smaller pants seemed like the better option. So you went with that, grabbing your shoes as well. Breakfast came and went as natural, and you were soon in your mom's car headed to work.

"How do the clothes feel?" your mom asked.

"Pretty good," you smiled. "Though...I'm not sure about the skirt."

"Well, it's there if you feel like it helps. It was on sale anyway," your mom smiled.

You smiled a bit as well but left it at that. It was kind of strange having the satchal as well, but perhaps you could get used to the lack of pockets. I mean, Aiko and the other girls didn't have pockets to deal with either, so it wasn't like it was something new. In any case, you made it to work safely, grabbing your headpiece and apron as usual before you tied your hair up.

As pretty much usual, Aiko showed up with a hello not too soon after. However, she didn't seem sure about something.

"You okay?" you asked as you flattened your apron a bit.

"Yeah just.....I actually have something I want to ask you," Aiko said, actually sounded really serious.

"Oh...well, what is it?" you asked curiously. "You need something?"

"Well....." Aiko said, sighing a bit as if this was a hard thing to ask.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Waking up

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I want you to meet my family." Aiko said.

"What?" you asked, bewildered. "Is that such a good idea, I mean, after what happened with your dad and all..."

"That's exactly why. If he just meets you, he'll know that you're okay to have around when they're not." Aiko said. "He's very traditional, but once you get to know him, I'm sure he'll treat you like family."

"Well, if you think it's a good idea, I'll do it." you smiled.

"Come over for dinner tonight." Aiko said, "My mom is cooking and it'll give you a chance to talk with my dad and let him know you."

"I'll have to run it by my parents, but sure. I'll do it." you said.

"Subarashīdesu!"(Great!) Aiko clapped her hands together.

You went back to work, waiting tables again, since those other girls weren't back yet, and went about your day as usual.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: She wants you to meet her family

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As something that had become pretty typical of late, you called your mom to let you know that Aiko had invited you over. In typical mom fashion, she was all for it, saying that she loved you getting to know people. Aside from that, things went pretty typically. You had gotten more used to waiting tables. Granted, you still couldn't help but worry about things. I mean, you were a boy after all, not what most of the customers expect.

"I honestly wish I knew what they think when they see me," you sighed one minute.

"Oh, you're fine," Ruki smiled as she was coming around. "You're doing better. You just need more experience is all and you'll be good as everyone else is."

"I hope so," you smiled weakly but sincerely.

In any case, after yet another busy day, you hung up everything and began to meet Aiko outside. Oh boy, this was going to be something. Damon actually told a story once of meeting the dad of his first girlfriend. He said it wasn't too pretty, but not as horrible as it could have been. Still, the very memory you had of Aiko's reaction back at the mall kind of scared you.

"I don't know about this," you said as you were walking along.

"It'll be okay. Trust me," Aiko smiled a bit.

"I don't know. I mean...what if I screw up?" you said in worry. "What is I do something that makes your parents angry with me?"

"Well, my mom is actually really nice. She's really cool and the best mom you could ask for," Aiko giggled a bit. "My dad....yeah, he's rough around the edges, but he's a good guy. He just wants what is best is all, even if expressing it is not easy for him."

"I guess so," you sighed.

In any case, you both eventually reached Aiko's house. You took a deep breath as you approached, with Aiko taking out her house key. You gripped your satchel a bit, definitely nervous, but you had to be strong. Come on, you could do this!

"Mama, otōsan, watashi wa ie ni iru!" (Mom, Dad, I'm home!) Aiko cried out as she entered, taking her shoes off, and you of course followed to the letter.

It was time.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later/After Work

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You walked out into the living room, where Aiko's father was sitting on the couch, watching TV. He seemed pretty normal, an older Japanese man with glasses and thinning hair watching TV. That's pretty normal for dads, so maybe this won't be that bad.

"Aiko, kaettekita. Kore wa anata no yūjindenakereba narimasen." (Aiko, you're home. This must be your... friend.) Mr. Sugihara said.

"Kon'nichiwa, Sugihara-san. Watashi wa Kurisudesu." (Hello, Mr. Sugihara. I'm Chris.) you said, shocking both Aiko, her father and yourself. "Hajimemashite." (Nice to meet you.)

"I'm impressed. Is that all you know?" he asked, in English. So he did speak English.

"No, sir. I've been picking up a lot working at the cafe with Aiko." you replied.

"Well, I'm still impressed. Aiko, your mother is in the kitchen preparing dinner, if you want to introduce Chris to her as well before we eat." Aiko's father said.

"Let's go, Chris." Aiko took your hand and led you to the kitchen.

You walked inside and saw Aiko's mother preparing food. She was also pretty normal looking, an older Japanese woman.

"Mama, this is Chris." Aiko said.

"Ah, hello, Chris. Nice to meet you. I hope my husband didn't scare you too much, he's a bit protective of Aiko," she said.

"It's alright. It's nice to meet you." you said.

"I'm happy that Aiko is making friends, being an only child she's always been lonely at home with just us here." her mom said.

"Mama! Kurisu no maede wanai!" (Mom! Not in front of Chris!) Aiko shouted.

"I'm sorry, Aiko." her mom said. "Dinner will be ready soon, why don't you two wash up and then Aiko will help me set the table."

"Sounds good." you said.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Sugihara Family

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The two of you proceeded to go upstairs where Aiko allowed you to use your bathroom with her to wash up.

"Your mom is really nice," you smiled as you washed your hands. "You resemble her a lot."

"Well, where else did you think I got these looks?" she cutely giggled. "And I think dad is already warming up to you."

"I can only hope so," you sighed.

After that, you both took the time to change out of your work clothes. Yeah, your mom came over before you left the restaurant to give you some proper clothes for dinner time. You excused yourself to let Aiko change out in privacy, though you couldn't help this small feeling that changing with her wouldn't be bad. Ah, you shouldn't think like that. You're a guy after all.

"All done," Aiko said as she exited her room in casual clothes.

You nodded at her, beginning to walk with her. However, as you walked, you noticed something to the side. Across from Aiko's room was another room, with simply a bed and not a whole lot else besides a dresser and some other things.

"Whose room is that?" you asked curiously.

"Oh, that's just an extra room," she shrugged. "We generally don't use it much. Seriously, if I had a sibling, it'd be perfect."

You nodded in affirmation of her words, though the room still stood out to you. It just seemed so plain that you wished it was as vibrant as Aiko's room. Oh well, guess that was out of your control. In any case, you walked down behind Aiko on the stairs. Aiko excused herself to go help set the table, kind of leaving you on your own devices. Granted, you didn't do much. You just kind of hung around, doing nothing inoffensive other than just observing little things about the house that you didn't see the first time around.

"All right, dinner everyone," Aiko's mom smiled out as everyone converged for dinner.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Washing up/Dinner

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sat down and started eating. The dinner consisted of miso soup and katsudon. They had given you a fork, but you found that the chopsticks were more familiar, and felt easier to use.

"So, Chris." Aiko's dad started. "Did you learn all this from just working at the cafe, or did Aiko have a hand in it?"

"I think it's a little of both, Mr. Sugihara." you said.

"Please, call me Otōusan." he said.

That was a little odd, but you did know that Otōusan was a form of the word father that can be used to address a friend's father, so you supposed it works. Though how you knew that is still a mystery.

"Alright, Otōusan." you said.

Aiko leaned over and whispered in your ear.

"He likes you." she said. "He's only ever let my friends who he really liked call him that."

You felt a warmth in your... heart? It felt nice, like you had gained the respect of your own father. You felt proud to call him Otōusan. You felt like part of the family, moreso than you had at dinner with your own family over the past few weeks. That should alarm you, but... for some reason it didn't.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dinner time

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You felt both confused and warmed by what was happening. I mean, you still thought highly of your family....but did it feel a little bit different? You weren't entirely sure. They were...still family right? At least you certainly thought of them as much. If anything, it almost felt like you thought of your family and Aiko's family equally right now. Well..perhaps it was something to think about later. You were enjoying your time here for now.

"So...Aiko told me that you lived in Japan when she was a kid?" you asked curiously, hoping that it wasn't deep in personal territory.

Good news was that it seemed to be perfectly fine judging by Aiko's mom's smile.

"Yes, until she was 7, we lived in Tokyo," she said. "I remember those first few years being quite the adjustment. See, my husband and I already knew a fair amount of English before coming here since our jobs required it, but Aiko never really had that before coming."

"Did you really have to mention that part?" Aiko sighed, her face beat red. "But...yeah, going to school here was quite the adjustment for someone who had to learn the language on the fly."

"Seems to have worked out for the best," her dad said, actually having a hint of a smile on his face. "You caught on quickly enough."

"Apparently "quickly" in his definition means a couple years," Aiko pouted before turning to you. "Imagine speaking broken English in the best case scenario in 3rd and 4th Grade..."

"I...can imagine it I suppose," you chuckled a bit, getting a little smack from Aiko in return.

The tension at the table had lessened. It had become a bit more casual, which was nice. Aiko talked some things over with her parents, just personal things that didn't need to be mentioned on by you. While she was talking with her mom though, you actually turned to her dad, apologizing if you caused any trouble when you went to the mall with her. Surprisingly, her dad kind of waved it off, saying that it was in the past and no harm was done. He actually kind of admitted that he's a little overprotective, though he didn't regret that side of him. That helped you feel a bit more comfortable.

And as the food was just about gone, Aiko had a thought.

"Hey Mama, could Chris perhaps come with us this weekend?" she asked with a smile. "I think it'd be fun."

"Oh, I think that's a marvelous idea," she said. "The company would be nice."

"Huh?" you asked with a raised eyebrow. "What are you talking about? What's this weekend?"
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dinner continues

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"This weekend we're going to Splashventures." Aiko said.

This caught your attention, as you had heard of that water park, but your family had never gotten out there.

"We've been planning it a few weeks, a little getaway for the weekend before school starts up again." Aiko's mom said.

"I mean, it was going to be fun anyway, but with you there to hang out with, it'll be extra fun." Aiko said.

"I wouldn't want to impose." you said, though you did want to go.

"Nonsense, I insist." Aiko's dad spoke up.

That settled it.

"I guess I'll go then. I'll have to check in with my parents, but I can't imagine they'll say no." you said.

"Make sure you pack a bathing suit, cause we're going on every slide there." Aiko said.

You were so excited. You quickly texted your mom to tell her about the offer, which she naturally accepted without question. She also said that she'd pick you up a bathing suit on her way home from work tomorrow. Everyone finished their meals, and even you helped Aiko and her mother clean up everything, while Aiko's dad sat on the couch again.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: What she means

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Your mom was going to come over and pick you up as well. That would take a little bit so you waited things out at Aiko's house. You had a bit more freedom it seemed to look around, so long as Aiko was around.

"Well, that went well," You smiled. "They took to me pretty quickly."

"I was a bit surprised myself," Aiko smiled back. "But it's all well and good now."

You nodded back, just enjoying the time you had here. Honestly, the more you saw of the house, the more it felt like it was being etched into your memory, like something you would never want to forget. You kind of wondered why, but it didn't matter. Still, the extra room Aiko told you about kind of drew you in a way. It...looked so plain. It was like you wanted to make it look better or something, so it looked nice with the rest of the house.

"What's wrong?" Aiko cocked her head a bit.

"Oh, nothing," you shook your head, before scratching your chest a bit. "Although...my chest has been itching a bit lately."

"Oh? Can I take a look?" Aiko asked. "Perhaps it's something I could help with."

The idea of showing your chest to a girl made you blush a bit, but then again, you'd have to be fine with it if you were going to spend a whole day with her this weekend. Slowly, you nodded and allowed her to take her into her room again, closing the door. You took off the nice shirt you had, letting you and Aiko have a little look. Honestly, from what you could tell, even the tiny hairs you had a few days ago were gone, leaving nothing but smooth skin. In any case though, you definitely had two red rashes along your pecs. Your nipples seemed a bit enlarged as well, considerably larger than they were before, and darker as well. The flesh had raised a bit, forming a small bump in both places. Aiko tapped her chin a bit before running inside her cabinet and closet.

Before long, she returned with some cream of some kind and....a bra?

"This cream helped with the rashes when my breasts began growing. Perhaps it can deal with your rashes as well," she said as she began putting it softly on your chest, which got a bit of a cold feeling to it. "And this should hopefully keep your shirt from irritating it further. It's my training bra."

You weren't entirely sure, but she seemed to have an idea so you let her do what she wanted. Once she had the cream on and got the training bra on you, you were surprised that you actually did feel considerably better. Your shirt couldn't rub against it through the training bra.

"Thanks Aiko. You're a lifesaver," you smiled at her, putting your shirt back on.

"I know I am," Aiko giggled, getting a little laugh out of you both.

Eventually, your mom picked you up, and you said your good byes to the Sugihara family for now. Your mom was pretty happy that you had become friends with them all, much to your pleasure as well. After a time, you got home, though it was already pretty late. You did a little relaxing in your room, though you still couldn't help that feeling from before in Aiko's house, like something that this room didn't have.

Ah, that's for another time you decided. It was time to hit they hey. You grabbed your pajamas and went to bed, feeling pretty happy about your day.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After dinner

choices: Skip to the day of the water park trip?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You drifted off to sleep.

You suddenly found yourself at Aiko's house again, this time wearing an outfit more similar to Aiko's casual outfit. It was just around dinner time, as you could smell it and you noticed that you were standing at the table, helping Aiko set the table. You did pretty good together, like a well oiled machine, working in tandem with each other to make everything easy for mom and dad... er... Aiko's parents.

"Otōusan!" you beckoned as Aiko's mom placed a dish on the table. "Yūshoku wa junbi ga dekite iru!" (Dinner is ready!)

"Coming!" Otōusan said from the other room. "Watashi wa kazoku to shite taberu jikan ga aru koto o totemo ureshiku omoimasu." (I'm very happy that we have time to eat as a family.)


That made you feel really good for some reason. Then, you found yourself in Erin's room, sitting on her bed as you browsed through magazines and listened to music. Your mother opened the door and poked her head in.

"You girls all right in here?" she asked.

"Yes, mom." Erin said.

"Yes, Mrs. Hoffman." you said.

You paused at that, Mrs. Hoffman? She was your mother, you'd never called her that before?

No one else seemed to notice and your mom left you and Erin to your business.


Other than that, you slept rather soundly, now that your irritated chest was being treated.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Nighttime

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The remaining three workdays this week just flew by. You were quite excited to be able to spend more time with Aiko's family. It felt like your desire just grew everyday, so much that nothing could really get you down about it.

Funny enough, whether it was the dreams or not, you had spent more time with Erin of late. Sometimes you played a game or two, and sometimes you did each other's nails. You had gotten quite proficient at that by now, much to Erin's surprise. Honestly, you really felt like taking her shopping some time, kind of like in one of your dreams. Damon was still his usual self, though you didn't talk to him much.

At work, things had stayed the same for the most part. However, yesterday marked something major. As time had gone on, it felt like your hips had just pushed out wider than ever, forming distinctive curves in your legs. It had gotten to the point where even the new pants had begun to feel a bit odd, so you decided to take the leap. You used the black skirt your mom got you, going to work with that. Boy, did it feel strange, but everyone at the cafe loved it. You remembered Sayaka absolutely gushing over how cute it looked on you, and the customers seemed to like it too. Well, you couldn't complain I suppose.

And so, that was why you were wearing a casual skirt right now, along with a tight tank top that was showing off a bit of midriff. You had gotten this recently with how hot it had been of late, and it showed off how slim you were now. Your back had this nice little arch to it, and your stomach was nice and flat. You kind of liked how smooth and trim you looked. You were skinny, but not overly so, like you were perfectly healthy. Guess all that exercise at work helped.

"Here's your bag with the swimsuit," your mom said. "Hope you like it."

"Thanks," you smiled as you exited the car.

Oddly enough, you hadn't been calling her mom lately, which was really strange. I mean...you still thought of her as a mom...but at the same time she wasn't. It was confusing, but one thing you knew for sure was that you loved her like a mom. That would always be true. Anyway, you met Aiko right outside, as she was putting her stuff into her family's car.

"Kon'nichiwa!" (Hello!) you smiled as you approached her.

"Kon'nichiwa!" (Hello!) Aiko smiled as she turned around and hugged you. "Son'nani tanoshī jikan o sugosu junbi ga dekimashita!" (You ready to have so much fun!)

"Zettai ni! Sore wa totemo tanoshīkoto ni narudeshou!" (Absolutely! It's going to be so much fun!) you smiled as you laughed a bit. "What do you think of that? Much improved huh?"

"Definitely. I feel like I could take you to Japan and you'd fit right in," Aiko smiled.

You liked the sound of that. At that time, Mr. and Mrs. Sugihara move arrived, welcoming you as well. You barely felt any sort of resistance from her dad now. It felt a lot more natural now. With that, you got into the car with them.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Skip to the day of the water park trip?

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The radio was playing on a Japanese pop station, and you could understand the songs, they were cute and a lot like American pop music. Even though you were never really a fan before you felt like you had been listening to J-Pop your whole life. Aiko was really into it as well and you spent the car ride singing along with her.

"You know Chris, I feel very close to you." Aiko said. "Almost as if we were... sisters."

"Sisters?" you asked, though not at all offended by the use of the word.

"You know, we go shopping together, have sleepovers. I've never had one, but that's what I always thought that having a sister would be like." Aiko said. "And now we're doing family activities together."

"I guess you're right." you said.

"If it means anything, you're the best shisutā I could have asked for." Aiko said.

"That means a lot." you said.

Suddenly Aiko leaned next to you and gave you a hug. It felt nice, and you reciprocated the gesture. As she pulled away, you felt the car stop.

"And we're here!" Aiko's dad said.

"Wow." you said as you looked out the window at the water park.

It was huge, with slides and rides and everything you could imagine. You didn't even know where to start. You walked in with Aiko's family and you approached the lockers and changing rooms. You walked up to the changing rooms with Aiko and saw signs on the doors for "Men's Changing Room" and "Women's Changing Room" Aiko grabbed your arm and pulled you into the women's changing room. No one inside seemed to object, so you didn't either.

"Better get your suit out." Aiko said, pulling out her's, a bikini.

You went into your bag and pulled out your bathing suit.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Car Trip

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You looked inside the bag, seeing a little blue one-piece inside. In actuality, you weren't sure when your mom got it, but she did notice how you were taking better care of your chest, and felt that this would help more in fact. Besides, the way your hips had grown, swimtrunks weren't the best option. Granted, as you stripped down and pulled the one-piece up, it did feel a bit strange to see your legs as exposed as they were.

"You look nice," Aiko smiled, her white bikini already on as she was putting her hair in a ponytail.

"Thanks," you blushed a bit and smiled before following Aiko's example and tying your hair up as well.

"How has your chest been since I gave you the training bra?" she asked.

"Much better," you said before looking down. "It hasn't been as irritating."

Your chest was pretty much the same size as it was days ago, with not a lot of growth. Still, it was enough that you could see the slight pushing out of your one-piece, a stark contrast to how Aiko had a pretty nice stack on her. Eh, size didn't really matter to you anyway. After making sure everything was properly applied, including sunscreen and all, you both waited outside.

It wasn't too long before Aiko's parents joined you.

"So, where should we head first," Aiko's mom questioned.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your bathing suit

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Check that out!" Aiko exclaimed, pointing to a tall slide with lots of twists and turns in it.

"Wanna go?" you asked.

"Of course!" Aiko said.

"I think we'll sit this out. That's a lot of stairs to get up there." Aiko's dad said.

"Alright, Otōusan!" you shouted as you and Aiko ran for the stairs to the slide.

You waited on line for a bit and you let Aiko go ahead of you and you watched as she slid down the slide. You waited for her to finish as a boy, that looks about your age taps you on the shoulder.

"Hey, your sister is pretty cute." he said.

"Oh she's..." you started, but remembered your conversation in the car. "Yeah, she is."

"You're not bad either." he said.

"Thank you." you blushed.

Your turn on the slide came up and you slid down into the pool at the bottom. You met up with Aiko at the bottom.

"A guy behind me on line called you cute." you said.

"No he didn't." Aiko playfully pushed you.

"He did!" you insisted. "Said I wasn't bad either."

"Well, you're not. You're almost as cute as me." Aiko giggled as you playfully pushed her back.

You walked back towards Mama and Otōsan. They got up and you continued walking to the next attraction.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Finding some slides

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
There were a few other slides, a couple involving inflatable tubes, which made it even more fun. This wasn't the first time you had been to any water park, but your first time at this particular one was turning into something truly wonderful.

"Phew, that's enough slides for a while," you smiled while putting your hands on your knees.

"True," Aiko agreed before turning around. "Why not try the wave area for a bit?"

"Oh, I haven't tried that in a long time. Let's do it." you smiled.

Mama and Otōusan took a little bit of a break after all those rides, wishing you both fun in the wave area. Keeping your tubes with you, you both found the wave area rather easily, finding enough room to get in and sit.

"Ah, this feels great," Aiko smiled as she relaxed a bit. "Even better with you here."

"Thanks. You too," you smiled back.

After a few minutes, a bigger wave emerged, surprising you as you actually capsized and fell into the water. Of course, there was no danger, just a small amount of time where you were fully underwater. Right as you did though, it was like your face was becoming as soft as the rest of you. You had kind of wondered why, but it didn't matter. Eventually, you finally resurfaced, seeing a giggling Aiko.

"Caught you by surprise there?" she giggled.

You laughed back, before happening to see a decent reflection of you in the water. It...was almost like seeing a blurry image reshape itself. Your face looked smooth, with delicate and soft features. Your jaw was much less pronounced, and your lips just a bit puffier. Your nose felt just a bit smaller too, and your eyebrows were thin. However, the biggest change was your eyes, looking just like Aiko's.

Just seeing it...made you smile wide. Being cute like Aiko was something you had warmed up to, and now you even kind of looked like her. A true family resemblance.

"Come on, let's get closer!" you laughed, your voice even just a little bit higher than before.

Aiko of course obliged as you both enjoyed some more time in the waves.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sat at a table outside one of the cafes in the park. You, Aiko, Mama and Otōusan were eating and you were slightly shivering from being wet.

"Dakara, anata wa on'nanoko ga tanoshīdesu ka?" (So, are you girls having fun?) Mama asked.

"Hai, mama." (Yes, Mom.) you and Aiko replied at the same time. You both giggled as a result.

"Anata futari wa itsumo subete o issho ni shite kimashita." (You two have always done everything together.) Otōsan said.

You paused for a moment, suddenly remembering being with Aiko more than just in the past few weeks. You remembering being little kids together, playing with toys and going to school.

"Watashitachi wa motte iru to omoimasu." (I guess we have.) you replied.

You still could remember your own family, though moreso Erin than anyone else. You remembered hanging out with Erin, but it was more of what you had done in the past few weeks, hanging out in her room and on the couch and less so all the time.

You kept eating and excitedly talked with Aiko about what to do next.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Lunch time

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After lunch, you and Aiko enjoyed more rides, though you got a bit of a laugh of Aiko having a little trouble with her bikini after one ride.

"You know, a bikini on slides probably wasn't the best idea," you giggled.

"Oh shut it!" Aiko giggled and pushed you a bit.

The more the day went on, the more it really did feel like a family day, just enjoying time with the Sugihara's. Still, it really did begin to feel like they were a real family to you, even more than your other one right now. Still, that didn't mean you didn't love them. You loved them all equally.

Eventually....

"Whew....I'm pooped," Aiko sighed after another ride.

Everyone was getting kind of tired. You had spent all day here after all. You went back with Aiko to dry off and get back into your normal clothes before heading back to the car. You felt like you didn't even need to ask if you could stay for a bit. It was like such a thing wasn't even needed. You were welcome here.

After a while, you all returned to the house. You were pretty pooped from the whole thing, somehow finding your way into the spare room that you noticed earlier. You just plopped down, taking a little rest. It felt nice.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You were so tired that you didn't even dream that night. You woke up and stretched your arms, yawning. You looked around, noticing that the room seemed to be decorated, except it wasn't last night, but... maybe you were just so tired that you didn't notice that it's design seemed to mirror Aiko's room, though with some differences in colors and preferences. You walked downstairs in your pajamas, to find the Sugiharas enjoying breakfast.

"There you are, sleepyhead." Aiko giggled.

"It was a very long day yesterday." you defended.

"Watashitachiha sakuya subete tsukarete ita." (We were all exhausted last night.) Mama said.

"Shikashi, sore wa yoi kazoku no tsuitachidatta." (But it was a good family day out.) Otōsan said.

You ate your breakfast and then went back up to your room... the spare room to get dressed and gather your things. You went towards your bag when suddenly you felt as if you were being dragged to the closet. You opened the door and saw several outfits hanging up. One was a casual outfit consisting of a skirt and a blouse. You put it on and noticed that the outfit fit you perfectly, almost as if it was yours. You admired yourself in the mirror when Aiko walked in. You jumped and started to explain yourself.

"Aiko... I..." you stammered.

"Oh, that looks cute on you. You don't wear that one enough." Aiko said.

You suddenly felt at ease. It was your outfit, and you should wear it more, it's super cute! You finished getting dressed and Mama was nice enough to drive you home. Normally you'd have used your key, but you couldn't find it, so you knocked on the door. Erin opened the door and she looked excited when she saw it was you.

"Chris!" she exclaimed.

"Yeah." you smiled.

"Come on in, let's go to my room, Damon and his friends are in the living room." Erin said as she led you upstairs.

It was strange, passing Damon. He looked at you, but only with the look of recognition, and not of say, sibling rivalry or familiarity, as if you're not close. You saw your room across the hall, but the door was shut and appeared locked. That was strange but... you didn't really notice it, hanging out with Erin. You had fun hanging out in her room, doing what had now become your typical behavior, talking and doing things like best girlfriends.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Skip to the Next Day?

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sat around talking with Erin for a while, until a knock came on the door. It opened and Erin's mom, er... your mother poked her head in.

"Erin, I..." she paused. "Oh, Chris, you're here too. Erin, did you finish all your homework?"

"Yes, mom." Erin said.

"Good. Oh, and Chris, are you staying for dinner?" your mother asked.

At first you were confused. Why would you not be staying for dinner? This was your family, after all.

"I..." you started. "I'd have to ask my mom."

"Alright, just let us know." your mother smiled and walked out.

As you and Erin resumed your talking, you glanced into the mirror at her vanity, noticing that you barely had a scrap of familial resemblance. There were still some vague things you recognized, but you didn't much resemble Erin, Damon or your parents much anymore. You took out your cell phone dialed a number that you weren't aware that you knew. Mama picked up the other end.

"Kon'nichiwa?" she asked.

"Mama, Kurisudesu." (Mama, it's Chris) you replied.

"Erin no kyō wa dō yatte burabura shite imasu ka?" (How is hanging out at Erin's today?)

"Mama, watashi wa Erin de yūshoku o taberu koto ga dekimasu ka?" (Mom, can I have dinner at Erin's?) you asked.

"Mochiron, tsūkōdome ni modotte iru koto o kakuninshitekudasai." (Of course, just make sure you're back by curfew) she replied.

"Arigatō, mama. Anata wa saikōdesu." (Thank you, Mama. You're the best.) you said as you hung up. "I can stay for dinner."

"Awesome!" Erin exclaimed.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You smiled as dinner with Erin's family eventually came. Honestly, you weren't entirely sure how you felt.

As you sat down, you tried thinking about them. They were family right? Yet, something felt like they were a little bit different. Maybe not entirely as close, but still enough that you loved them. You know what, there wasn't really much of a problem with that. You loved Mr. and Mrs. Hoffman like they were your own father and mother, and that was enough.

That thought gave you some relief as you thanked Mrs. Hoffman for the meal, enjoying it with everyone else. Erin of course liked to talk about all the fun things you both liked to do, making you giggle a bit. On the other end, Damon would just roll his eyes but not comment on it. At least it was better than him giving out some kind of insult or sarcasm.

As you ate though, you felt a small feeling in your chest. Taking a little break, you looked down, seeing fully grown breasts on your chest. They looked at least as big as Aiko's....and of course they would be right? She was your sister after all. It honestly made you giggle a bit to think you might outgrow her despite her being older.

In any case, the dinner was very nice, and you thanked them all once you were done. It felt like it was time to go home now....to your real home now, even though this house would always be welcome to you.

"Let's go shopping tomorrow!" giggled Erin.

"It's a deal!" you giggled back, waving good bye to Erin as you exited the house, hearing your Mama picking you up.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dinner

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You got in the car and Mama started driving home. You smoothed out your skirt as you sat there and glanced in the mirror at yourself.

"Anata no hi wa dōdeshita ka?" (How was your day, honey?) Mama asked.

"Tanoshī. Erin to watashi wa ashita kaimono ni iku yo." (Fun. Erin and I are going shopping tomorrow.) you replied.

"Sore wa subarashī, hanī." (That's great, honey.) Mama said.

You arrived home and you felt the most comfortable you had felt in a while. You said hello to Otōsan and went to your room, plopping down on your bed after a long day. Aiko poked her head into the room.

"Hey, sis!" she exclaimed.

"Hey." you said.

"How was Erin's?" she asked.

"Pretty good. We're going shopping tomorrow." you replied.

"Sounds fun." Aiko said.

"Yeah." you said. "You should come!"

"I would but I got called into work. Ruki's still short some girls, since some of them just up and quit. I think you'll probably get bumped up to waitressing full time." Aiko said.

For some reason that thought didn't alarm you at all. In fact, it felt nice to think that you'd be able to do that full time, it was fun!

Aiko went back to your room and you decided to get some well needed rest.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Going home

choices: Full-time Waitressing and a New Name
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You spent Sunday shopping with Erin, and it was quite a blast. Course, Erin did most of the posing in dresses and such, though you had a little fun as well. Funny thing though, you wore your own dress to the mall, one very much like Aiko's, and wearing a pair of pink open-toed high heels. It was just like the dream you had days ago, and somehow it made you feel even happier than before, especially given it was really your first time in real heels.

Aiko somehow was able to survive having to work on Sunday of all days, but she was able to manage. She actually really liked her job after all, so it wasn't too bad.

In any case, you were heading to work with her right now, oddly enough still dressed in that white button-up and skirt you had the last few days. You even still had those small heeled shoes you got so long ago. You honestly kind of hoped you could upgrade your attire sometime.

"I'm honestly looking forward to this," you smiled at your sister.

"I hope so. It's going to get really busy this week," Aiko smirked. "It's pretty much that time of year."

You honestly didn't mind that. You were hoping that you could actually be a full waitress at long last. Hopefully Ruki would agree. In any case, you could already see customers inside as you and Aiko were left off at the restaurant.

By the way, you pretty much fully resembled a member of the family now. Your face? Completely Japanese, and almost a complete twin of Aiko's, which served as some funny pictures for you both. Your body had pretty much fully matured to that of a growing young lady, with the only reminder of your old life still in your groin. However, it had been getting smaller, and went limp a day ago. It was only a matter of time.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Skip to Work Day

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You walked inside and put your bag down in the breakroom. You put in your headpiece and as you were about to grab your apron, Ruki stopped you.

"Hold on, one second." Ruki said.

"Alright." you said. "What's up?"

"Well, since we've been busy the last few weeks it took a while to get them made, but we finally have your uniform and nametag." Ruki replied.

"That's great!" you exclaimed.

Ruki went to a closet and pulled out a dress, identical to the ones that Aiko and the other girls wore. She handed it to you and you looked over it.

"It's beautiful." you said.

"And your nametag." Ruki said, handing you a small nametag that had "Chouko" written on it.

"But..." you started. Then something clouded your mind for a moment. "Wow! It's great!"

"Glad you like it. Go change and get out there." Ruki said.

You quickly found a place in the breakroom and changed quickly, coming out dressed identically to all the other girls. Maid outfit, complete with skirt, the headpiece, the only anomaly was your shoes, but that was about to change.

Aiko walked into the breakroom with a shoebox as you made sure your outfit was ready to go out. She walked up behind you and tapped you on the shoulder. You turned around.

"Chouko!" she said. "I got you a present."

"Oh, you shouldn't have... what is it?" you asked.

"Since it's your first day as a waitress, I wanted to make sure you fit in. I brought an old pair of my heels, the ones I used when I first started here." Aiko replied, opening the box to reveal a pair of black heels, around the same height as Aiko's and the other girls'.

You quickly took them and traded out your shoes for the heels. Something just felt right about them. You and Aiko started walking towards the door to the main part of the cafe.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Full-time Waitressing and a New Name

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Your new uniform made you feel even more comfortable and confident than ever. Plus, just hearing that name on your nametag...it was like so many things cleared up at once. You were working here with your dear big sister.

"Well, go break a leg," Aiko giggled as she lightly pushed you along.

"Same to you!" you giggled back.

You had liked to think that you had gotten better at waitressing over the past week, but now you felt better than ever, like you were a pro. You could speak fluent Japanese at the drop of a hat, which really seemed to resonate with certain customers. Plus you were just so darn cute now, and you were even able to play on that a bit with some of the guys.

You and Aiko even kind of ended up competing a bit on who could wait more tables, which just made things more fun anyway. As you were working, beneath the panties you were wearing, the last remnants of your manhood were fading away, as a perfectly functioning girlhood took it's place. Not that you felt any of it nor did it matter. This felt like perfection to you.

"With our paychecks combined, we'll have enough for that anime con in no time," you smiled.

"I'm glad you remembered," Aiko smiled back as you both ate lunch together. "Things have been so crazy of late that I almost forgot."

"Me too honestly," you smiled as you kept on eating.

Yeah, you had so much family now. Your new Japanese family, your work family with all the girls, and the Hoffmans who you also cared for and vise versa. Everything felt complete.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Life was good. A few weeks later, school was about to start and you found yourself a bit nervous about starting school again, it felt like you had been a completely different person when the previous school year had ended. You made your concerns known to Aiko, who helped you figure it out.

"I'm so nervous about school." you said.

"Oh, come on, sis. What's there to be nervous about? I mean, you were always the one who adjusted easier. Remember when we moved here? It took me so long to adjust to American customs and learn the language and you took to it like you had lived here since birth." Aiko said.

As she did, your mind filled with memories of childhood, of moving to America and of growing up with Aiko. You suddenly felt at ease and knew that the future was bright for you.

On the first day of school you got dressed and looked at yourself in the mirror, and you smiled, knowing that life was going to be good from now on for Chouko Sugihara, and to think it all started when Aiko convinced you to apply to the same place she worked at.


Another life changed and another story closed, but maybe the magic that brought Chouko Sugihara and Alexandra Hoffman into the world still has transformations to perform.
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Moving on

1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
All right, and thus a new tale in this world shall come to pass.

However, who shall be the next to experience this? Could it be Chouko's former brother Damon? Or perhaps the magic finds a brand new kid or teenager to transform?
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A New Story

choices: A young woman, around your age, is standing there
1543111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
So you're going to be Damon Hoffman, recent high school graduate and college freshman who's about to start the new year away at school. What you don't know is that your life is about to change, much like your mother and former brother's lives before your's.

You arrive at the campus of Maran University, having trekked up alone, since your parents were busy and you didn't mind the solitude. You walked up the dorm building and checked your phone for the number of your room. You walk up to the room and knock on the door, while wondering what your roommate will be like.
