Life isn’t fair:

A young man finds out his body is slowly changing into a female. There seems to be no reason or explanation as to why. All he can do is try to cope and adjust the best he can.

15433333231.content:
“What do you mean there isn’t any explanation?” Your mom shouted at the doctor.

“I’m sorry ma’am. Our tests show nothing wrong or out of the ordinary with his DNA. We...we don’t really know why this is happening.” The doctor replied.

Looking down you sighed seeing your hands. They were noticeably smaller now and even your nails were looking a bit longer.

This all started about a couple weeks ago. You started noticing small changes to your body. It started off small and hardly noticeable. In fact you didn’t really even pay much attention you noticed you had lost over an inch in height. Your parents finally noticed something to and ever since have been trying to get answers.

However test after test showed nothing strange. Nothing out of the ordinary with your body, DNA, no viruses nothing. All the doctors could say was it was clear your body was becoming more feminine for some reason.

“Come on Ben.” Your mother said as the two of left the doctors. They were just as frustrated as you at not knowing what was causing this.
15433333231.title: Sounds good

154333332321.content:
Crawling into bed for the night you yawned as you nodded off for the evening.

You are Brandon Michaels. 25 and single. You live alone and work a pretty normal office job as an administrative assistant. Your best and only real friend is Chase, a guy you’ve known since high school.

Drifting off to bed one night you fell into a deep sleep rather quickly as a rather strange dream began to fill your mind.

You saw a woman...She was beautiful. It was as if you were seeing the world through her eyes. She had long platinum blonde hair down to her hips. It was currently styled and tied up in a long ponytail.

She had large breasts at least DD cups pushed up bra a sexy push up bra as she wore a tight black mini dress and matching heels. She had long nails well trimmed and manicured with French tips.

She had great curves and long legs. A perfect bubble butt and wide hips with a perfect thigh gap. She obviously worked and cared about her body a great deal as she was examining herself in a mirror.

It seemed she was in a bathroom of some kind of dance club there was loud music in the background as she was applying some makeup and lipstick to herself.

Seeing this all from the 1st person perspective was a bit weird as suddenly the door opened behind her.

“Brittany are you coming? This guy and his friend want to buy us some drinks!” A red headed girl said.

The red head was sexy and gorgeous as well. Very similar to build and body as this Brittany woman.

“Coming Maddie!” Brittany said winking at herself and blowing herself a kiss in the mirror as she turned around and left the bathroom.

The dream ended there as you suddenly found yourself waking up to your alarm. That dream was weird. It felt so real it took you a moment to realize you weren’t dreaming anymore.

Woman's Work- While at your girlfriend's cabin for the weekend, you ruin all your clothes, but it's okay, because she keeps a closet of her clothes there.

155.title: Something else

choices: Later on, you spill something on your pants.
1551.content:
This was going to be the best weekend ever! Your girlfriend, Carrie, had a cabin upstate, that was secluded enough for privacy but close to civilization. Her parents were rich, and had kept the cabin for years before you met Carrie. You two met in high school, and started dating right before college. You went to the same one, and for the past two years had been begging her parents to use the cabin. They didn't trust Carrie and you alone, because they feared underage drinking, or worse, the two of you having sex. Of course the underage drinking thing made no sense anymore, now that you were both 21, so they conceded and you were driving up there with her.

"Okay, Noah, remember the turn is coming up, it's tricky to see if you aren't paying attention."

"Yeah, yeah. I'm a man, remember? I know how to drive." you said as you turned and drove to the cabin.

You walked in and she gave you the grand tour.

"The first floor is just the kitchen, laundry room, living room, den, that stuff. Upstairs is mostly my closet. I used to be a clothes hoarder, so I have clothes from two or three years ago stocked upstairs." she said.

She wasn't kidding. Three entire rooms were just closet space. And then there were the two bedrooms, one with a bathroom attached and the other without. Since you were alone, you got the master bedroom.

"Anyway, let's unpack!" she said.

You started unpacking, as Carrie emptied out a full suitcase of clothes.

"We're only here for a weekend, not a summer. Why so much clothes?" you asked.

"Just in case." she said. "What did you bring?"

"I have my pants." you said pointing to the pants you were wearing. "I have two shirts, three pairs of underwear and a few pairs of socks."

"I told you to pack more than that, what if you ruin those pants?"

"I'll try to to ruin them!"

"Anyway, we haven't touched the cabin since last summer, would you mind helping me clean downstairs? The fan hasn't been dusted in ages."

"Dusting? Isn't that women's work?" you asked.

"No. It's your work now. Do it!" she said sternly.

"Fine..." you muttered.
1551.title: Woman's Work

15511.content:
You sat on your ass watching television for the next few hours. Carrie made dinner and called you into the dining room.

"Can you grab the pitcher off the counter and bring it to the table?" she asked.

"Sure thing, honey!" you said and grabbed the pitcher. You began to walk back to the dining room, when you slightly turned your head and walked into the door frame, dropping the pitcher, and it's contents, onto yourself.

Carrie just stood there with her hands over her mouth. She was stifling her laughter until it erupted in uncontrollable laughter.

"Yeah, yeah. Very funny!" you said as you stood up. "My pants are ruined!"

"Told you to pack more" she said.

"Whatever, did your dad leave clothes here?" you asked.

"Nope. Just me, but I have stuff that can be unisex." she said. "Come upstairs and shower yourself so you aren't sticky and we'll find some replacement pants."
15511.title: Later on, you spill something on your pants.

You walked into the bathroom and stepped into the shower. You realized that you had forgotten to bring soap, and silently cursed yourself for being so stupid. Fortunately, there was a bottle of soap and a bottle of shampoo in the shower. You used the soap, and it began to tingle and you washed it, your body hair going with it. You also washed your hair, which seemed to gain more volume from the shampoo. You left the shower, shivering because of your new hairless body and Carrie stood searching a closet.

"I'm out." you said.

"Good, here's some stuff..." she said noticing your new hairless body. "What happened?"

"That stupid soap!" you shouted waving the bottle at her.

"Oh... I thought you packed your own." she said.

"Whatever, what do you have for me?" you asked.

"I have this... or this." she said.

"Should I be scared?" you ask.

"Only if you're afraid that you'd make a pretty girl." Carrie said.

"Fine." you said and accepted your fate. You couldn't deny her, it was a fair bet, and it was probably those misogynistic comments you made when you got here that gave her this idea.

"Where should I start?" she asked. "I want to give you a little bit of choice..."

"Uh..." you started.
1551111222.title: 2 (Carrie's current teenage girl clothes)

15511112222.content:
She asks you to close your eyes a spends a few Minutes putting something on your face.

Once done, you open your eyes and see a young girl with shorter hair looking back at you.

"Now how do you want your hair? I can just put it in a ponytail Orr..."
15511112222.title: Makeup and hair.

choices: New clothes to match the new look
155111122221.content:
"I guess the ponytail." you say, worried that she'd make your hair even girlier if you said nothing.

"That's great!" she smiled and pulls your hair back into a ponytail. Your hair was medium length, but still long enough for the ponytail to be a decent length.

"Now... It's time for..." she started.
155111122221.title: Go with the ponytail

choices: Go get dinner at a restaurant
1551111222211.content:
"Okay let's get you out of those clothes" she says.

You pull the already girly clothes off until your down to the white panties.

She wraps a bra with gel inserts around your chest and snaps it on the back.

She takes some tight white short- shorts and helps you into them, along with some flip flops.

Finishing, she pulls a floral blouse over your head and a grey cardigan around your arms.

Once fully dressed she smacks her hands together acting like some fine chef.

"Finito, my masterpiece!" She says jokingly in an Italian accent.

She stands you in front of the mirror and you gasp at how much you look like a girl.

"One last thing!" She says grabbing a small bottle.

She sprays the liquid on your body and finally into your mouth.

"Now say something" she says grinning.

"I look so-" you jump at the feminine voice that escapes your mouth "weird!"

"Serves you for acting like a jerk to me!" She says "maybe you won't be so sexist after spending a weekend in a girls shoes!"

You sigh and keep examining your features...

"Now it's a short drive into town so tonight we can..."
1551111222211.title: New clothes to match the new look

15511112222111.content:
"But I hate those, you know that!" you moaned.

"No, Noah hated those. You're Natalie, yeah I like that, has a nice ring to it, Natalie." Carrie said. "And she loves them."

"Can I at least drive?" you ask.

"Judging by your driving on the way up, I'm gonna say no." she said and you walked down the stairs. "Oh, one more thing!" she grabbed her purse and handed you one.

"Do I really need this?" you ask.

"If you want your phone, wallet, keys, and such. Girl pockets don't fit much, you know."

"Fine..." you mutter and get into the car and you drive off.

You arrive at the theater and Carrie purchases the tickets for the movie. Then you go to...
15511112222111.title: Go see a chick-flick

155111122221111.content:
You find your seats and watch the movie, admittedly, you got invested in it, and even got emotional during the climax of the film. You got up to leave and walked to the car. As you began the drive back to the cabin, Carrie started giggling.

"What's so funny?" you asked.

"I can't believe I got you to do this!" she replied.

"Not like I had a choice. You won the bet."

"I guess. But you didn't have to follow it, I wouldn't have stopped you if you refused."

"I guess subconsciously I was feeling bad about being sexist."

"I think you should stay like this for the entire trip. Until we leave at least." she said.

"I don't have a choice, do I?"

"Nope." she said smiling. "Just like last time."

She continued driving and you soon arrived at the cabin.
155111122221111.title: Find your seats

1551111222211111.content:
You get home and Carrie hands you a yellow tank top and pink pajama short shorts.

"I'm sleeping upstairs you can take my old room" she says heading upstairs,

You sigh and climb into Carries old childhood rooms bed that is pink and fluffy.

You doze off and dream of rock climbing and hiking and enjoying the forest, as you walk in the woods you trip and fall in a stream covering your clothes in warm water.

You awake and feel your crotch is warm and throw the covers off to see a large yellow stain on the bed.
1551111222211111.title: Bedtime!

1551111222211112.content:
You walk upstairs and strip out of the outfit. You sit on the bed and Carrie hands you a pink nightgown. You put it on and lay in the bed. Carrie climbs in next to you, and you doze off quickly. The next morning you wake up and put your arm over Carrie, only to find she isn't there.

"Carrie?" you yell.

"I'm in the kitchen!" Carrie replied. "I'm making breakfast. Put on the robe and come down!"

You see the robe hanging on the door, which was pink and frilly. You put it own and spot a pair of matching slippers and put those on as well. You walk downstairs and see Carrie placing two plates on the table. You see eggs, bacon and toast. Your mouth starts to water as you sit down.

"Since you didn't get to eat the dinner I made, I wanted to make sure you got a meal cooked by me."

"Great!" you said and began eating.

"So, I had a few ideas for what to do today..." Carrie started.

"Uh huh." you said inbetween bites.

"I was thinking..."
1551111222211112.title: Something else

15511112222111121.content:
"A girl's day!" Carrie said happily.

"What?" you asked.

"You know, a day where we go out and do girly stuff, spa treatments, get our hair done, it'll be fun!" Carrie said.

"I don't know."

"You don't have a choice, I already booked the spa treatment for two." Carrie said.

"Fine..."

"Let's get you dressed.
15511112222111121.title: A girl's day

155111122221111211.content:
You go up to the room filled with clothes and Carrie digs into the closet grabbing different articles of clothing before deciding on a bundle that she brings to you. She hands it to you, and you unroll it, revealing it to be a skirt with a floral pattern and a pink lace undershirt with a white v neck shirt.

"A skirt? Really?" you ask.

"Yep." Carrie said smiling.

"Fine..." you said as you put the clothes on. You stood in front of the mirror as Carrie did your makeup, doing a quick job, but it made your face decidedly feminine.

"Now, twirl for me!" Carrie said giggling.

"Ugh..." you said twirling.

"Now, put these on, grab your purse and we'll be going on our way." Carrie said handing you a pair of black flip flops.

You grabbed your purse and got into the car.
155111122221111211.title: Getting dressed for the day

1551111222211112111.content:
You drove up to the salon that was in the town near the cabin, far away from anyone who knew you, yet you were still uneasy about leaving the car.

"Come on, Natalie, you did it last night!" Carrie said.

"But it was dark then, this is broad daylight!"

"And you're a normal girl going to a salon."

"But I'm not!"

"By all appearances, you are. Let's go in."

You walked in behind Carrie and stared at the ground while she signed you in.

"Yes, I have an appointment for two, under the name Carrie Robertson."

"Ah, here we are. Go straight to the back."

"Come on, Nat!"

You walked to the back...
1551111222211112111.title: Onto the Girl's Day

15511112222111121111.content:
You and Carrie were placed in salon chairs that were side by side to eachother. Your sandals were removed and you were given foot massages as mud masks were applied to your faces, and your heads were leaned back into a basin. You had to admit, in the flurry of activity, the pampering was fun. Your feet felt great, and you were enjoying it. You felt your hair being tugged on, but you ignored it, since it was part of the spa treatment. You were in a state of utter relaxation, and nothing could ruin it. The mud masks were removed and they started to work on your faces. You had been dreading this part, but the rest of it was so fun! This couldn't be any worse!

When it was over, you and Carrie both stood up. You looked at her, and she looked stunning. The salon had made her look even better than she already was, if that was possible. And then you turned to the mirror, and saw yourself. Well, not actually, you saw a gorgeous woman. You looked at her closely. She had loose, curly hair that had blonde highlights, her lips were shiny, pink and kissable, her slender arms ended in fingers with french tips at the ends. Her legs ended with feet with perfectly pedicured toes. You snapped out of your fantasy when you heard Carrie.

"So, Natalie, I see you like your new look." she said.

"Uh... yeah." you said.

"Thank you." Carrie said to the employees.

"Yeah, thanks." you said and followed Carrie back to the car.

"You do look beautiful, Nat."

"Thanks. You too. What are we doing next?"

"I'm a bit hungry, how about we stop for lunch?"

"Uh, sure!"
15511112222111121111.title: Spa day begins!

155111122221111211111.content:
The car pulled up to a cafe, and the two of you walked in. You sat at a table and checked the menu board.

"I think I'll just have a sandwich." you said.

"Good idea. I think I'll get that too. I'll go order." Carrie said and walked to the counter.

You glanced around the cafe and saw a guy staring at you, and when you looked at him, he smiled. You immediately looked away. Carrie walked back up with the food and sat down.

"What's wrong?" she asked.You glanced toward the guy who smiled."Ooh! Looks like you have a suitor!"

"Shut up." you said.

"Come on, it's funny."

As she said that the guy, and the guy he was sitting with walked up to you.

"Hey, I'm Carter, and this is my friend Wes. Sorry if we freaked you out, but you two are the prettiest girls we've ever seen."

"Thank you!" Carrie said.

"Thanks." you said blushing.

"Can we take you out tonight?" Carter asked.

"Sure! We'll have to go home and get ready though." Carrie replied.

"It's a date." Wes said.

"Here's my number, call me!" Carrie said.

"Thank you. See you tonight." Carter said and they walked away.

"Looks like we have a date tonight!" Carrie said.
155111122221111211111.title: Getting lunch

1551111222211112111111.content:
You sat on the bed as Carrie went through the closets.

"I don't want to go on a date! I love you, not that guy!" you pleaded.

"Yes, but this might be fun!" Carrie said. "Here, try this on."

She handed you a pink dress and you held it up against your body.

"Can I wear something, less girly?" you asked.

"What do you mean?"

"I mean, I don't want to wear a dress. I'd rather be wearing my clothes, but I don't think that's going to happen."

"You're right. But since you don't want a dress, you can have this."

She handed you a black skirt, and a pair of black tights. You sat down and pulled them on, when Carrie handed you a pair of heeled boots, and a blouse. You put them on and looked in the mirror. You sighed.

"You look hot! Let's go!" Carrie said.
1551111222211112111111.title: Getting ready for the date

15511112222111121111111.content:
You get in the car with Carrie, who is wearing the pink dress from before, and start driving to the place, Carter had texted Carrie directions.

"What if he wants to kiss me?" you ask.

"When in Rome..." Carrie replied.

"You're not helping!" you said.

"Come on, it's just one date, it'll be fun!"

"I don't know...."

"Well you better find out because we're here!"
15511112222111121111111.title: To the date!

155111122221111211111111.content:
You walk into the restaurant and see Carter and Wes sitting at a table for four. They spot you and stand up as you approach them.

"Allow us." Carter says as they pull your chairs back and motion for you to sit.

"Thank you." Carrie said.

"Thanks." you blush.

"So, before we order, why don't we get to know eachother a bit?" Wes said.

"Well, I'm Carrie, and my parents own a house out by the lake."

"Cool!" Carter said.

"And my friend Natalie is a bit shy. We came up here for the weekend since we needed a break."

"Nice." Wes said.

"I go to the local college. It's nice around here, quiet."

"Yeah."

Suddenly a waitress walked up.

"Can I take your orders?" she asked.

"Of course," Carter said.

You all ordered food and she walked away.

What's next?
155111122221111211111111.title: The date begins

1551111222211112111111111.content:
"Tell me more about yourself, Natalie." Wes said.

"There's not much to say." you said. "I'm kind of a boring person."

"I refuse to believe that." Wes said. "You've gotta have a story."

Carrie nudged you, encouraging you to talk.

"Well..." you started to think. "I'm a gamer. I love Dark Robot Fighters 7."

"No way! Me too!" Wes said. "But the final boss,"

"Is a complete cop out! He was so easy!" you shouted.

"I know!" Wes said.

Dinner came and you started coming out of your shell, despite the way you were dressed, you and Wes started to hit it off, as did Carrie and Carter. You were a bit hesitant about that, but figured she was just playing the part.

What next?
1551111222211112111111111.title: More about Natalie?

15511112222111121111111111.content:
You end up enjoying talking to Wes. He is a pretty smart guy, you think. You end up forgetting how you are dressed as you chat with him. You smile and laugh at his stupid jokes unintentionally coming off as flirty. Before you even realize it, dinner is over. You are pretty disappointed. Wes seems to pick up on it and looks to the rest of the group.

“You know, the night is still young. We could move this party to a bar or something. Are you guys up for that?”

You stand, “Dude, you are singing my song. I'd love a drink.”

You don't notice but Carrie looks at you quizzically. She figured they would eat and run. She just wanted to tease you a little but you seem to be getting into this date. Maybe she should let you have your fun flirting with Wes. Besides, she is enjoying watching.
15511112222111121111111111.title: After dinner

155111122221111211111111111.content:
Arm in arm with your dates, you all stroll over to the bar after the boys graciously paid for your meals. You were initially a little uncomfortable about this level of contact with Wes but he soon calms you with his conversation as you both walk.

It's not long before you are all in a bustling bar that appears to be full of the students from the local college. The boys lead you both to the bar and ask you and Carrie what you would like to drink. You are about to ask for a beer but Carrie is quick to ask for two Cosmpolitans and then excuses herself and you as she practicals drags you to the ladies' toilets. Luckily there is no one else in there so Carrie turns to you with an odd expression on her face.

"So much for not enjoying the date huh." She says smugly.

"I'm only doing what you said to do." You protest.

"I know I know, I'm enjoying myself a little too much too but try to town down the flirting with Wes, he may start liking you."

You taken fully aback by this. "I'm not flirting" you say defensively.

Carrie puts her hands on her hips. "Oh come on, you were simpering and giggling at all of his jokes and you were talking his ear off."

"Well what about you? You were doing the exact same thing with Carter, you even did your dreamy face to him".

Carrie shuffles a little a this. "Well we're both leading them on, knowingly or not." She says guiltily. I suggest we have that one drink with them and then head home."

"That's fine with me." You say a little disappointed. You had been really enjoying you conversation with Wes.

"Right then follow me out"

Carrie exits the toilets with you on her heels. When you come out, you see Wes and Carter now sat at a table with your girly drinks waiting for you. You both greet them and take your seats next to them.

You both continue talking with them and you notice that both of them are now asking more personnel questions about you and Carrie. You answer them as honestly as possible and soon, all of your drinks are empty. You look to Carrie who is currently giggling at one of Carter's jokes to see if she is ready to leave. She notices you trying to catch your eye and realises what you want. She excuses herself from Carter s moment and then leans into your ear and whispers...
155111122221111211111111111.title: The head to a bar

1551111222211112111111111111.content:
"We should go." Carrie said. "We're kinda busy tomorrow."

"No problem. I had a great time." Carter said.

"Me too." Wes said.

"So did we." you said.

"Well, thank you for a very fun night." Carrie said as the two of you stood up.

"Call us." Carter said as Carrie started to turn towards the door.

You left the bar and walked back to your car. You get in and Carrie starts driving towards the house. As you pull up, you notice something is wrong. The lights in the house were on, when you had turned them off before leaving. As you get closer, you see a car already in the driveway.

"Oh crap..." Carrie said.

"Who is it?" you asked.
1551111222211112111111111111.title: Let's go.

choices: She pretends she is a lesbian.
155111122221111211111111111121.content:
"It's my sister Amy." Carrie says panicked, "that's her car right there."

Amy is younger than Carrie by a year and is her best friend aside from you of course. She must have felt left out with you two gong to the cabin together. While she is a nice enough person, she doesn't hesitate to poke fun at people for he own amusement, a habit that has got her in trouble more than a few times.
You feel the dread creep into your stomach as you begin to imagine all the insults and humiliation you are going to receive when she finds out.

"What are we going to do?" You murmur. As you pull up in front of the house.

"Quiet!" Carries says. "I'm thinking." You see yours and Carrie's bedroom light turn off and moments later the front door flies open revealing Amy in a pair of short shorts and sports top. She smiles as she immediately recognises Carrie in the drivers seat but her face grows puzzled when her eyes fall on you.

"Let's get out to meet her but let me do the talking" Carrie says unbuckling and opening the door. You follow her a couple steps behind and watch as the two sisters embrace.

"What are you doing here sis?" Carrie scolds when they separate. "You know that this is my alone time."

"Yeah I know I'm sorry." Amy says trying very hard to appear sorry but falling miserably. "This was your time with your boyfriend." She looks around elaborately as though making a point. "So where is he anyway?"

"Oh er, he couldn't make it" Carrie says trying to sound casual.

"Huh." Amy says looking confused "so you brought..."

"My friend Natalie instead yes." Carrie interrupts gesturing at you. You smile and wave demurely.

"Ah, you are just having a friends holiday then?" Amy asks, crossing her arms now.

"Exactly" Carrie says in a relived voice. "So you understand now?" She asks.

"Not exactly," Amy says. "I had look round the house earlier and found the guest bedroom untouched as it had been since we last came up as a family but the master bedroom has been used and the bed slept in by two people."

Carrie's jaw drops. "How do you know by two people?" She says unwisely.

"Sis we shared a room for five years, when you sleep in a bed, you never move, it's almost like no one has slept in it. But what I saw upstairs, covers pulled back, sheets all over. So you see my problem with beliving you sis?"

Carrie just gapes at he sister and you stare wide eyed at Carrie looking for an escape route.

Amy sighs. "You don't have to hide anything from me Carrie, you know I can keep secrets."

Carrie looks back at you with sorrow in her eyes.

"You don't have to be upset sis, I don't care I you are a lesbian." Amy adds before drawing Carrie in for another hug.

Carrie looks at you wide eyed over her sister shoulder. It looks like things have turned out bad for Carrie rather than you but the question is whether she will roll with it to save you humiliation or drop you in it to save face.
155111122221111211111111111121.title: Yes.

1551111222212.content:
"I should get you some new clothes now." she said.

"Why?" you asked, not really wanting to try on even more girl clothes.

"Because you need to match the new look of course. Be right back." she smiled as she left to get some more clothes, leaving you sighing as you watched her go.

"This isn't going to end anytime soon." you groaned.

It wasn't too long before she returned, carrying some clothes with her and setting them down next to you.

"All right, I've got a few choices for you here. Which one should we go with?" she asked with a glint in her eyes.

You both looked at the kinds of clothes she brought out.
1551111222212.title: Something else

1552.content:
Your sister, Julie was older than you, by a lot. When she was in high school when you were in elementary school, so now that you're in high school, she was living on her own, with her childhood room relegated to storage of her old stuff, and whatever else your parents needed storage for. You and Julie had always been close, even despite the age difference. Whenever you needed a babysitter, she was always there. Sometimes you missed her, because you only saw her for holidays and some birthdays, but not that often. You usually just passed her room with no thought about it, went in there to put coats in there when you cleaned, but other than that, it just sat there, a relic of your sister's childhood. Until now...

"Eric!" your mother shouted. "Can you move the folding table into Julie's room? We don't need it and I want it where we can get to it next time we need it!"

"Sure thing, Ma!" you shouted back, grabbing the table and moving it up the stairs into Julie's room. You leaned it against the wall and looked around.

You looked at her desk, that used to house her computer, her shelves, still covered with her old stuffed animals, her bed, that still had her red sheets on it. You smiled, remembering waking her up on Christmas morning before waking your parents. The thought of Christmas in this summer heat was welcomed. You left the room and resumed your day.

Later that night, you lay in bed, unable to fall asleep. You suddenly hear a crash, coming from Julie's room. You immediately get up and run to her room. You see the table laying flat on the floor.

"Oh, it's just the table..." you said, getting drowsier. You walked over to Julie's bed and lay down. You woke up when sun peeked through the window.

"Huh?" you thought. "Right..."

You checked the clock, 5 a.m.

"Good, no one saw me in here." you thought, walking back to your room and falling asleep in your bed until your alarm went off.

Later that day, you sat in your room, bored, as you went on social media.

"I should do something productive..." you said. "Oh! I know! I'll clean Julie's room, lord knows that hasn't been cleaned since she left."
1552.title: Julie's Room

15521.content:
You walk into Julie's room and start moving things around. Her desk is cluttered and you start there. You move around books, when a small book slides off the desk onto the floor. You pick it up, reading the label.

"Her diary? Wow!" you said. "I shouldn't read it... But if she wanted it to be secret she'd of taken it with her."

You open it up and start to read it, realizing it starts around the time you were born. She writes of how adorable you were and how happy she was to have a baby brother. Then she started to write about school, and her birthday came around, and she wrote about the presents she got. You continued reading, seeing her talk about how her favorite present from that birthday was a bottle of sparkly blue nail polish, a color that you remember her wearing quite often on her nails. You put the diary down and open a drawer, seeing the nail polish. You put the diary next to it, and decide to call it a day and return to your room.

Later that night, you again couldn't sleep and so walked to Julie's room and lay down in her bed once again, falling fast asleep. You again woke up and returned to your own bed.
15521.title: Cleaning Julie's room

155211.content:
Your parents left for the day and you go back into Julie's room, you go to the drawer and take out the nail polish bottle, staring at it. It was a very interesting color, it looked like tiny galaxies were in it. You put it down and opened another drawer, full of other makeup supplies, like brushes, and cotton balls. You start to walk past the desk when you step on something. You look down and stare at your feet. You look back at the drawers.

"Couldn't hurt, could it?" you thought.

A while later, you stared at your feet, with your toes now polished with the sparkly blue nail polish with cotton balls between them. You laughed and noted that they were still wet, so you removed the cotton balls and put on a pair of Julie's flip flops that you had retrieved from her closet.

"Hm. I might as well keep cleaning while I do this." you thought and kept cleaning Julie's room. You fixed up the bed and her desk and were satisfied with a job well done. You started to look for nail polish remover when you hear the door downstairs open.

"Eric! Help us carry these groceries in!" your mother shouts.

"Crap." you said, no time to remove it. You touch them, and realize they're dry and grab a pair of socks and run to help your mother.

Later that night, you sat in your room when your phone rang. You picked it up, and after looking at the caller ID, saw it was Julie and smiled.

"Hello?"

"Hey, Eric."

"Julie! How are you?"

"Good. I need a favor."

"Sure, what is it?"

"Well, I want to surprise mom and dad by coming in for the family reunion next week. I need you to make sure that they don't find out."

"Got it."

After that you went into Julie's room once again to sleep and woke up.
155211.title: That morning....

choices: Neither you nor Julie can sleep
1552111.content:
A week later, you sat in your room, waiting for Julie to show up. You had been making sure your parents didn't hear from anyone that Julie was coming, and that Julie's room was in shape enough for her to stay in it. Your phone rings and you see a text from Julie, saying that she was a block away. You ran downstairs and waited with your parents, as they went about their daily business.

"Say, when is Julie going to tell us if she's coming to the reunion or not? We asked her weeks ago!" your father asked.

"No idea." you said, as the doorbell rang.

Your mother opened the door and shrieked with glee when she saw who was on the other side.

"Julie!" your mother shouted.

"Hi, Mom! Hey, Dad!" she shouted. "Thanks, Eric."

"For what?" your father asked.

"He made sure you didn't know I was coming." Julie said.

"Anyway, get yourself settled." your mother said.

"Got it, Mom." Julie said, and you walked with her to her room. She walked in. "Wow, it's clean!"

"Yeah, figured your room should be clean if you were coming."

"Thanks, Eric."

Later that night...
1552111.title: One week later: Julie's arrival.

15521111.content:
That night, you toss and turn. You look at the clock and see that it's about 2 a.m. You decide to walk to the bathroom. You pass Julie's room on the way and see the light on. You peek your head in and see Julie sitting up on her phone.

"Hey." you said.

"You're still up?" she asked.

"Yeah." you said.

"Come in, sit down. We might as well talk if we're not going to sleep."

You walk in and sit down on the desk chair and start talking, reminiscing about when you were kids.

"Remember when you were nine, and I was babysitting you, and you fell off your bed and faked being hurt and made me panic?"

"Oh yeah! I remember that!" you laughed. "You told on me and I was grounded for a month!"

"You deserved it!"

Suddenly, the two of you felt an intense tiredness fall over you and you both fell asleep.
15521111.title: Neither you nor Julie can sleep

155211111.content:
You woke up in the morning and notice that Julie isn't in her bed, you walk downstairs and see her at the kitchen table, eating a bowl of cereal.

"Morning." you said.

"How was the chair last night?"

"Good, although I think it messed my back up."

"Well, Mom and Dad left for the reunion, Aunt Gina needed help to set up stuff, and Uncle Jack is busy at work. So we're going to leave for the reunion on our own tomorrow."

"Cool." you said.

Later that day, you sat in your room, barefoot and looked at your feet, with your toenails still painted. No way you were going to be able to get rid of it with Julie around. As you thought that, Julie peeked into your room.

"What did you do to your feet?" Julie asked.

"Oh! Julie... Uh..."

"Did you paint your toenails?"

"Uh..."
155211111.title: The next morning.

1552111111.content:
"Oh that's adorable!" she laughed. "Why did you do that?"

"I... don't know. I was just sitting in your room, after putting a table in there, and I was compelled to use it." you said.

"Did you like it?" she asked.

"I don't know, it does look nice." you replied.

"Well, no harm, no foul. Although I am a little annoyed you used my favorite nail polish." she said.

"Sorry."

"Say... you wouldn't mind if I asked you to do my toes, would you?" she asked.

"I guess not..." you said.

"Ooh! What if you did my toes, then I did your fingers?" she asked.

"Uh..."
1552111111.title: She's laughing

15521111111.content:
She takes a seat and hands you the bottle as you slump to the floor. Carefully she removes her socks and wiggles her toes in your direction throwing the socks on the floor a few feet away. You're not really sure where to start, after all you had only done this once and that was to your own toes not somebody elses.
Still you had a go, taking your time and layering the sparkly polish on. You held her foot firmly in one hand as you worked, something that made her spasm every so often as she seemed to be quite ticklish. Despite this you made good progress and soon she is staring down with a smile.
"Wow how much of my polish have you been using?" she asks wiggling her toes under your nose.
"Just the once I swear."

...you hear some footsteps behind you. Dammit, did she notice you'd taken her clothes. You increase your pace.

"Hey," the boyfriend suddenly catches up and walks aside you. "I didn't get your name back there."

You stay silent, you can't think of a good reply.

"Look, I don't want to get in your way, but it seems like you're up for a fun night tonight and I was wondering if I could go with you!"

You stop in surprise. You feel a bit self conscious as you face him, still tasting the lipstick and almost even seeing the mascara on your eyelashes, but the look he gives you is one you haven't received before. Enthusastic, enamoured, hanging on your very next word.

You glance back at the way you came, worried that the one you'd stolen these clothes (and makeup) would follow.

"Oh her?" he asks, only semi-misinterpreting your glance. "Oh... well, she and I... we're kinda on a break right now."

You look back at him with a disbelieving "that's really your story?" expression.

"Okay, um, so... can we walk while we talk about this?" You decide that moving away from the (ex?) girlfriend is in both your interests, and you both start pacing down the street.

"You see, um... look... it's over... she might think... look, you saw us in there, there's no passion, no care. It's a struggle to be with her."

Ugh, relationship drama, just what you didn't need. You don't mask your expression over it, but since you're both walking forward you don't expect him to be paying attention to it. Why was he so caught up about it? Either stay with her or break up, agonising over this middle ground doesn't help...

"Actually you know what? We're breaking up. I'm breaking up with her, right now!"

In surprise you look over to him. Sure enough he takes out his phone and starts hammering away at the virtual keyboard. He seems to struggle, type, delete, explain, delete, finally he gets something he's satisfied with and shows the phone to you, you stop walking to see it.

The tail end of the conversation log with "Marcy" has some messages, "I still don't understand." - "That's the problem, you should!" - "Well just tell me what it is." - "I'm sick of texting. Talk to me if you want to know, or care." Under that is his unsent text "I'm breaking up with you. It's not working out."

For a second you wonder what it would be like to receive such a message. Probably would hurt, but probably better than some cheesy justifications or attempts to imply it wasn't a bad thing or the weak "we can still be friends". The "ripping off the bandage" approach does have some merit you consider as you nod. Still, you weren't sure he'd actually...

He reaches his thumb over and taps the send icon "And... send!". It shows up on the conversation log, no "undo" or "delete" seems supported, just a regular text message.

You look up at him in surprise, and slight guilt: Had you caused this? This woman who you'd literally only passed by in a washing room!

"Look, I know its bad to break up in text... but you saw what happens when we talk. It always becomes about something else." He puts away the phone, "Look, lets just go somewhere. It doesn't have to be like a date or anything, just try to have some fun. If you bump into some guy, go with him; if you meet up with friends, I'll just slink away. You probably have a boyfriend anyway."

You shake your head, then realise you might be giving the wrong idea, then shake it harder to imply you're not keen on the whole proposition. You weren't planning to go anywhere tonight. You've got a pink shirt, miniskirt, styled hair and makeup, but weren't planning to show it all to anybody, in fact, you were planning to show it to as few people as possible.

He seems to sense he's losing grip on this conversation, "Look, La Shay is just around the corner, why don't we head there and I buy you a drink? No more relationship talk"

You sigh, and just turn and walk on. He seems to follow you, but then increases his pace so he's now beside you. You don't know what his deal is but figure you'll let him do this at least a little distance. Maybe he's still dealing with the breakup.... damn, the breakup. The guilt hits you again. You were walking her clothes and makeup, all stolen, and now seem to have made her boyfriend break up with her! What could she be going through? You look over towards the (ex) boyfriend, and see he's looking at a text he just got, probably her reaction. You hoped he'd reply with something that would make her feel better but probably nothing would. Damn, how did you get into this situation?

"I'm sorry..."

"How sorry are you...?"

"If there's anything I can do..."

"Will you keep going with your 'date', make him regret leaving me?"

You pause..."Look, I don't think that's healthy, or helpful for everyone. The best thing to do is..." Suddenly, you notice her pull something up from one of the bag's she's got hanging from her shoulders, some shorts.

"My shorts!" You exclaim.

"They were closing the place for the night, I saw these clothes on the floor and decided to keep them safe until I found the owner. Considering the pockets have a phone and keys, and wallet I thought it was better with me than whoever else found it."

"Great, thanks" you say reaching for it.

"No," she says, pulling them away from you.

"But those are mine!" You plead.

"So are those!" she gestures to what you're wearing.

"Okay....., that's fair... sorry. How about a swap?"

"You're going to give back the makeup too? My boyfriend?"

"I'm sorry, I was in a stupid position and I made the best choices I could, which maybe weren't that smart. I'm sorry I stole things from you, but could you please give back my stuff."

"Alright, I'll give them back..." she suddenly seems more composed, calm.

"Great, thank you so mu...."

"I'll leave them somewhere, a nice safe place where you can get them." She's already putting the shorts back in the bag.

"Errr, okay, where?"

"Oh, I'll text you in a little bit," she starts moving towards the door.

"But, you have my phone!"

"Oh, that's right, I guess I'll have to text Brad instead?" she says with a smile, hand on the door handle

"Who?"

She shoots you a fiery look that threatens to erupt "You know! BRAD?!? Your BOYFRIEND?!? The one that brought you HERE?"

"Oh right, Brad! Yes! Of course, sorry...."

"Great," she smiles through gritted teeth, "see you soon, or more likely, never." And with that she walks out of the stall, carrying the bags with your clothes in it with her.

You stare at the slowly closing stall door, part of you wonders if you should catch up with her and pull the clothes from her by force.. but overall, you're just emotionally exhausted. Leaning against the support rail, you try to absorb the minutes of intense conversation. One thing seems clear, you need to be near Brad, or specifically Brad's phone, sometime in the next hour or two. What are your options?
1553222121111221211.title: Leave immediately

choices: You meet up with more of Brad's friends.
15532221211112212112.content:
You sigh, taking a moment to take everything in. While there was a lingering fear Brad would run off, for the moment you just wanted a moment to catch your breath.

So you were being blackmailed... or not even that, she was just leaving your clothes and stuff somewhere, and not telling you unless you stuck with Brad.. which was kind of a blackmail. Whatever.... How were you even going to get to look at his phone?

You could try to sneak a look at it every time he got a text alert...? No, he'd notice, and then might hide it from you the moment the text you're waiting for came in. He had shown his phone to you earlier, but that was to prove he was breaking up with his girlfriend... You thought more, and a plan gradually formed in your mind. Maybe you could get him to show you every text from his ex-girlfriend. Maybe... maybe pretend you are jealous and don't believe him, that want to be sure the two of them have broken up..... Yeah, that could work. Playing the role of suspicious girlfriend... not exactly the role you were born to play but it was something...

It seems like a decent plan. You open the stall door to go, looking up to see the two women still at the mirror.

"Ummm...." you feel like you owe them an explanation, how much did they hear?

"It's okay," the blond one says, "we've all got our own stuff going on."

You smile in embarrasment and leave through the main door back into the throbbing music and crowd.

If you'd been worried that Brad had got bored and left, your fears are allayed as a hand grabs your arm before you even realise.

"This way," he says, "I got us some more seats."

Sitting seems like a better alternative to dancing, and you shakily follow him to a booth, hair wafting back and forth in front of your eye.
15532221211112212112.title: No rush, hang around and put off dealing Brad

155322212111122121122.content:
You focus again on walking on the heels, picking up more of a stride this time, and avoiding people as Brad pulls you through the throng. You wonder if you're going to have to dance with Brad again but put the thought out of your mind.Finally, he brings you up to a booth. You slide in and he slides in after you, blocking the way out, as you try to pull back a strand of hair out of your face, you look up and realise that a couple is in front of you.

"This is Steven and Michelle," Brad announces "And guys, this is Lori!" Lori? Where did that name come from? Your thoughts are interrupted as Brad puts an arm around you and pulls you in.

"Oh, nice to meet you," Michelle smiles, Steven nods. You're startled for a second and awkwardly try to shake their hands before transforming it into a weak wave. "So is Mary okay?" Michelle intoned.

"Mary... look guys, you know... it was on the rocks... I mean, if we'd kept at it, we'd have done something crazy," Too late for that, you think. "Look, it's just move on... try to keep distant, you know."

"Well, you seem to have moved on pretty quickly," Steven says looking at you.

"Yeah, Lori is..." Can he have even thought of something to describe you in the incredibly short period of time you've known eachother? "... amazing"

"Well, I know what its like to be with an amazing girl." Steve turned to Michelle.

"Awww, and I know what it's like to be with an amazing man!"

"And beautiful too."

"And sweet."

The two lean in, their mouths touch, and they start kissing. You're finding it a bit awkward, and as you turn towards Brad to see his response, you see his face moving in and before you know it your lips make contact. You feel his tongue in your mouth, and electricity as he pushes is face towards yours. Stunned, you reach out for stability and put your hand on his shoulder, then feel his hand at the back of your head and the kiss continues. Rocking back and forth, you faces shifting, you're go with it, vaguely remembering that part of your plan involves keeping close to him. Weakly you try to respond, and that just seems to encourage him. Another hand on your lower back, and he pushes into you, you're practically leaning against the seat.

"Great...." you sighed as you got to cleaning. At least it made using the soap a bit easier, not that you liked that fact.

After that, you cleaned yourself normally. Your hair wasn't really long enough to really make much of a difference. This time, you did proceed with the panties, though you didn't put on the bra, as it would be of no use for now. Might as well wait until it was needed. Aside from that, the shirt and sweatpants fitted on rather well, both looking very neutral.

"Nothing too embarrassing at least," you nodded a bit as you finally dried up and left the bathroom, heading back into the empty bedroom.
1553322212111111.title: Your body hair begins to fall off

choices: Your hair grew past your shoulders
15533222121111112.content:
You decided not to just stay in all day. There was plenty to see and do around campus. After throwing on some flip flops you went out and decided to go for a little walk.

Walking seemed a little harder as your sandals felt like they were bigger than the should be. You decided to ignore it as you walked around campus. You were a little hungry so you went to the cafeteria for some breakfast.

Normally you would be all over some bacon and waffles with maybe some coffee or Orange juice. However the thought of eating that almost made you sick. You found yourself craving just a small latte and a fruit cup. You were surprised by good it tasted as you never liked this kinds of stuff before.

As you finished your meal you saw Mandy waving at you from a few tables down. Smiling you waved back as you walked over.

"Hey there, how was your night...:did you shave or something?" Mandy asked.

"Oh....uh...no my body hair fell off this morning." You said noticing how smooth and almost shiny your skin seemed now.

"Hey listen I'm sorry what those girls did. I can't imagine what you are going through." Mandy said.

"It's alright now, I'm just not even show how to handle all this. Every day I see a little bit more of myself disappearing." You said.

"Speaking of that, do you know what your going to end up looking like? It's going to be hard to keep you dressed if we don't know." Mandy said.

"Well...actually I do...." You said pulling out your phone as you showed Mandy this photo.

http://cdn.acidcow.com/pics/20150413/asi...

Mandy was a bit shocked at the photo. "Damn! That's....not what I expected. A busty Asian girl? You are not even Asian!"

"It's a long story....Yeah there was some sort of mix up. So I ended up with a sample from this Japanese girl. They said I should be about 5'1 110lbs with around DD cups, size 5 shoes, small clothing sizes and waste length black hair when it's said and done." you said.

"That's perfect though! Now we know! We can plan for this! Come on let's go get some real clothes for the future you!" Mandy said.

"Umm...sure." You said as you decided to go along with Mandy for now since she seemed excited.

As you stood up you suddenly felt a familiar sensation as you hunched over as....
